Autographed Cheki + Digital MP3 + HQ digital photo - $20 You can collect a personally autographed Polaroid photo of Airu + Download Airu's concert + You will have access to an exclusive photo of Airu at Idol Matsuri!
HQ Digital exclusive Photobook (50 pictures) of Airu in Seattle + Autographed Cheki + Digital MP3 + HQ digital photo - $30 Airu's first photo book shoot will be in Seattle! You can have this photo book ONLY through this campaign! + You can collect a personally autographed Polaroid photo of Airu + Download Airu's concert + You will have access to an exclusive photo of Airu at Idol Matsuri!Exclusive video message to you + HQ Digital exclusive Photobook (50 pictures) of Airu in Seattle + Autographed Cheki + Digital MP3 + HQ digital photo - $40 Airu will personally thank you in a private video message for helping her achieve her dreams to perform in America! + Airu's first photo book shoot will be in Seattle! You can have this photo book ONLY through this campaign! + You can collect a personally autographed Polaroid photo of Airu + Download Airu's concert + You will have access to an exclusive photo of Airu at Idol Matsuri!General registration + Exclusive video message to you + HQ Digital exclusive Photobook (50 pictures) of Airu in Seattle + Autographed Cheki + Digital MP3 + HQ digital photo - $60 Register with this perk and receive all rewards Airu has to offer! + Airu will personally thank you in a private video message for helping her achieve her dreams to perform in America! + Airu's first photo book shoot will be in Seattle! You can have this photo book ONLY through this campaign! + You can collect a personally autographed Polaroid photo of Airu + Download Airu's concert + You will have access to an exclusive photo of Airu at Idol Matsuri!Digital MP3 + HQ digital photo - $10 Download Airu's concert + You will have access to an exclusive photo of Airu at Idol Matsuri!Exclusive HQ digital photo - $5 You will have access to an exclusive photo of Airu at Idol Matsuri!VIP pass + Exclusive video message to you + HQ Digital exclusive Photobook (50 pictures) of Airu in Seattle + Autographed Cheki + Digital MP3 + HQ digital photo - $100
* Attention: Since the cheki is Airu's main good at her merchandise table, the cheki is to be limited to one per perk. Additional chekis available at Airu's booth at Idol Matsuri.
 **SCROLL DOWN TO SEE PERKS OF BEING A VIP!!**Special VIP badge includes:Priority seating and early entrance to all concerts and events!Special gift at registration!1 raffle ticket for the autographed guest's weekend badge of your choice!Guaranteed photo op with all Japanese guests!Guaranteed autograph from all Japanese guests!Ticket to the Ice Cream Social with all guests!Risks and challengesLearning from our past mistakes, we feel that this project is virtually risk-free:Most perks are digital or fulfill-able at the event. The only possible risk is being able to get the chekis sent on time. We will collect and produce the chekis AT Idol Matsuri so there is no delay in sending the rewards.Additionally, this fundraiser is approved by Airu's management and there is a contracted agreement between management and Idol Matsuri that these perks are to be fulfilled.

story:
Hi!  I'm Mike, a singer-songwriter from New Hampshire.  You may know me as the founder and frontman from Featherscale, or from my solo performances.  I've performed up and down the East coast, headlining festivals and last releasing an album in 2011 with the band.

Folks have been asking when I'll be releasing a new album, and lo and behold, I have three- count them- THREE albums in a partial state of completion.  I need your help to finish them.

About the Music

The first album, What This Day Will Bring, features brand new original music- The sound that you enjoyed on Gypsy Heart has been further refined and may even feature appearances from a couple Featherscale alumni, including producer Robert McClung of Telergy.   Plus, guest performances from some other great musicians, like Sharon Knight and Winter, who have already recorded tracks when they came through several months ago. Expect a blend of acoustic and electric sounds with a good helping of modern rock and Celtic folk.  You can hear a demo for one track, There But For the Grace of God Go I, on Reverbnation. 

The second is titled Knotwork- A collection of traditional Irish and Scottish folk songs, electrified and rocked up in the style of bands like the Dropkick Murphys, Flogging Molly, and the Rumjacks.  The first completed song is Step it Out Mary, which features the amazing Celia on guest vocals.  Oh yeah- You can hear that one on Reverbnation as well.

Finally, something I've always wanted to do:  Knotwork will simultaneously be released in both electric and acoustic versions- Same songs, but one album of hard hitting Irish punk, and one arranged for traditional acoustic guitar, mandolin, bodhron, accordion, and fiddle.  This album will be titled Knotwork: The Parlor Mixes, and will be available separately, or bundled with the electric version.  Once again, there's a sample for you to listen to.

Where Are We?

At present, several of the songs on What This Day Will Bring are each roughly 3/4 recorded.  Sharon Knight and Winter have already contributed tracks, and I am searching for a couple session players to fill in a few of the instruments I don't actually play, like bagpipes and sitar.

I have also mostly finished recording 4-5 of the roughly 15 songs on Knotwork and the Parlor Mixes.

These are being recorded at my home studio, with the possibility of recording drums and maybe a couple other tracks elsewhere, then sending them off to Robert for mixing and mastering- Essentially the same process we followed for Gypsy Heart.

Where Crowdfunding Comes In

My studio has had some major upgrades since recording the last CD, but still needs some work to really bring out the best.  First and foremost is the computer that forms the backbone of the recording setup:  After the old one died, it was replaced with a loaner.  While it's mostly adequate, it has a few issues which can't really be fixed.  There is also the chance that I may need to return it without notice at any time- So, this needs to be replaced.

Second are the costs of some of the studio musicians.  Depending on who they are and what kind of working relationship we already have, this can vary pretty widely.  Even the close friends who volunteer (or trade for my backing tracks on their project) still get dinner and gas money.

Third are the costs of mixing and mastering.  These are the final steps after the album is fully recorded, and is an art and a science all it's own, and even the major label pro studios usually farm this out to an expert.  I'm lucky to have a longstanding friendship with someone I trust to do a great job at a reasonable cost.

Finally, there is the percentage that goes to IndieGoGo, the cost to manufacture the CDs themselves, getting set up on iTunes, Amazon, etc., and producing any perks like t-shirts or posters for backers.

When is this all happening?

Mostly, right now!  I'm actively recording already, and it's only the hired session players who will need to wait until funding comes through.  I expect to be able to complete the recording portion of the first CD within a month of being funded, and to finish the second while it is off being mixed.  This will probably take a few weeks, and then there's another couple weeks turnaround to print physical CDs.

Knotwork and The Parlor Mixes will be recorded concurrently, as it is largely during the mixing phase when they become separate projects.  This means almost no additional time to record, but mixing and mastering will take twice as long.

The goal is to finish recording Knotwork/The Parlor Mixes by the middle of August, and have them mastered by the end of September- at which point I should be done recording What This Day Will Bring.  With any luck, finished CDs and digital downloads should be available by Halloween and X-Mas, respectively.

story:
THE WHAT? 

 Is very simple... is the recording of a comprehensive transcription of the entire Beatles's album,

SGT. PEPPERS LONELY HEARTS CLUB BAND  on "DIMENSIONAL classical guitar "(a new approach to the production of sound on classical guitar)  for the first time in history as a complete work

This is not an arbitrary anthology of isolated Beatles's songs .. this is the way that

this SUITE OF SONGS as a whole  impact the world  in 1967,.. changing everything... and became  The SOUNDTRACK  of our lives...

 The Demo video above , has a little bit of the 13 songs of the album ...   

 and, in the same original order .

SIDE A

1. «Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band»  

2. «With a Little Help from My Friends»  

3. «Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds»  

4. «Getting Better»  

5. «Fixing a Hole»  

6. «She's Leaving Home»  

7. «Being for the Benefit of Mr. Kite!»  

SIDE B

1. «Within You Without You» (Harrison)

2. «When I'm Sixty-Four»  

3. «Lovely Rita»  

4. «Good Morning Good Morning»  

5. «Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band (Reprise)»  

6. «A Day in the Life»  


THE WHO?


HÉCTOR VILLAZÓN is a World Class classical guitar player , he studied in México and Spain under the direction of Alberto Salas in México and Jose luis Rodrigo in Spain ... he took a Master Class with the legendary classical guitar player Andres Segovia.

He has given more than 1000 classical guitar recitals internationally, and has performed with orchestra playing the most famous classical guitar concertos.

 Concierto de Aranjuaz J.Rodrigo  Concierto de Toronto L Bouwer etc ... He decided to take some pop albums masterpieces , mainly Beatles, and record and interpret them live as a Complete Works ... as a Suite or Sonata.


THE HOW?

First, he wants to make this World Premiere recording , and then do the World Premiere live performance., He wants to share this project with people who love The Beatles, Instrumental Music and guitar, and...   "With a little help from his friends " he means YOU . achieve this special and unique dream.

 Without your help This project will take too long .. 

C O S T S
     $1500 us Dlls .for  recording time                    
     $1000 us Dlls for Mastering
     $1300 us Dlls .for Artwork
     $1000 To run this campaign outside Indiegogo
     $  650 us Dlls publishing rights 
     $1800 us Dlls . Produce physical CD (best quality)of the album.
     $ ??? (1000)   us Dlls shipping perks around the world, we have to be prepared 


THE WHEN ?

He is going to record this beautiful and important instrumental album with

a  YAMAHA Silent Guitar SLG110N as you have seen in the Demo video , under his new concept DIMENSIONAL CLASSICAL GUITAR between february and march 2015 

THE WHERE?

The recording will be made in México, the mastering in USA and  worldwide distributon will be made .... but only if you make it happen!


THE WHY?

The first reason is because he wants someone had done this,


The second, for his unconditional love to The Beatles Music .

 
The third but not the last, is because he wants to recreate the feeling he used to had ,when his older brother listened this masterpiece in his small vinyls player ... track by track... from the start to finish ... and when took place the transition  between... When Im 64.. and Lovely Rita  ... This made him cry...

I mean me... Héctor Villazón


Thank you in advance for your Support !


Risks & Challenges

If i cant get the goal you will have your money back .so, there is no risk for you.

... or maybe the only one is this one... if i cant get my goal I will do this recording...  some day .. but ..maybe you will never know about it... so!!!

ALL TOGETHER NOW!! choose your perk!

Other Ways You Can Help

If for any reason you like the projet but cant donate... I really appreciate

that your spread the word.... Thanks again ! 

Héctor Villazón

story:
Short Summary

My name is Lorcán Mac Mathúna . I am from Ireland, I sing Irish traditional song including Sean Nós, which means the old style and is always in the Irish language. 2016 is a big year for Ireland and the Irish because we are celebrating the centenary of the Easter Rising, the great visionary rebellion which started the beginning of the end of the largest empire on earth.

The Easter Rising was led by poets and visionaries who wanted political separation of Ireland from England, and it began with the Easter Proclamation, a document which is of equal significance to Irish men and women as the Declaration of Independence is to Americans.  

Irish people are proud of this proclamation and the extraordinary people who penned it and we are celebrating their vision and courage this year; 100 years after their courageous rebellion (and the execution of its leaders) inspired the Irish people break to their chains of bondage and take their place amongst the nations of the earth.  

I was amongst 9 artists (selected from over 260 proposals) who were selected by the Irish Arts Council to produce an artistic creation which honoured the rising and its legacy and I had 1916 - Visionaries and their Words performed to critical acclaim in January and February. I hope, with your help, to record this work so that Irish people around the world may be inspired by the words of the leaders of The Rising. 

The Rising -and especially its leaders- is such an inspiring episode in Irish history and I do want to expand more on it, and the connection of this project to it. Underneath all the info about the project and funding it you will find all that great stuff (under the heading Background).



What We Need & What You Get

I have composed and rehearsed ten songs for the show 1916 - Visionaries and their Words which I now wish to make into an album. I have started this process and have recorded 9 songs in studio and to finish off the project I will need to raise the money to do so. 
I wish to record one more song, a number of spoken word pieces which were written by Pearse and Plunkett.  

At the moment we have unmixed recordings of most of the songs on the album. We have been performing the show live and have it thoroughly rehearsed but now we need to spend a little more time in studio, mix, master, design and press CDs. I have raised half the money I needed to do this and am now seeking your help to get the final funds together.

In return for your support you can get a copy of the album. A digital download or a physical copy with a 20 page booklet including notes and song words. 

I will be producing a limited number of booklets -A5, 32 page, full colour- which will give extensive background on the songs on the album, and info about their authors and the context in which they were written. All this will be beautifully illustrated with archive images I have sourced in over 6 months of research,

And there is lots of other music from my back catalogue of course. Music which is inspired by Irish mythology and history; and which features texts taken from ancient Gaelic manuscripts.

All the funds I raise will go towards producing a beautiful physical memento of the centenary of the Rising, along with a permanent musical homage to the most inspiring Irish men of the past 100 years. The lyrics and music are ready, it is now just a matter of delivering them in a tasteful and high quality format. A form which will do honour to the memory of the people of The Rising and which will make a fitting and lasting tribute to their vision. 


The Impact

If you think that the 1916 Rising is a monumental moment in Irish history -both for the residents of Ireland and for the massive Irish extended family throughout the world, please give your support to this campaign. because this project does homage to the leaders of the rising and more importantly to their vision. As a way to learn more about what drove Pearse, Plunkett, Connolly, Ceannt, and the other signatories of the proclamation, this is a great help because it focuses on what they were passionate about and reveals what gave them their passion.

Risks & Challenges

This will be my sixth independently produced album. I have always had a self sufficient approach to this and can do many of the tasks myself such as the graphic design and album text; and of course the music creation. 

I believe in  letting other people do what they are good at and what I am not able to do because I think that quality is achieved by people working together. I have done this before and I know I can deliver a high quality album within the budget I have outlined. The album is costed and once I have funds the project will be ready to go into the final stages of action.

The risk is in not achieving my funding goals so I am asking you to please share this amongst as wide a group as you can. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word please

I am leaving the funding options open to allow for generous donations which may come from a group or organisation. Groups and organisations who celebrate a common Irish lineage in particular might like to take me up on this. Perhaps this album would be an ideal Christmas gift or a part of a goody bag going home from a conference. 


Background

The words and inspiration of the Easter Rising’s leaders are brought to life with fealty and respect in this musical interpretation of their writings. The poetry, essays, and speeches of Patrick Pearse, James Connolly, and Joseph Plunkett, provide the lyrics for a song cycle which I wants to put on a CD as a special memento of the centenary of the most inspired moment in Ireland’s history; the Easter Rising, 1916.

1916 – Visionaries and their Words is a song cycle that I composed  to celebrate the centenary of the most inspiring moment of modern Irish history, and the people who led it. 

The lyrics for this song-cycle were taken exclusively from the inspiring writings of its leaders Patrick Pearse, Joseph Plunkett, Eamonn Ceannt, and James Connolly.

“a glorious exploration of what it means to be Irish.”

Over a period of six months I undertook deep and meticulous research on the writings of these visionary leaders and used their words, and only their words, to interpret their vision. This was not meant to be a contemporary revision of The Rising but a musical inspiration taken from the words and vision of the leaders of The Rising recorded in their own time, in their own words, from their own pens. 

The Rising was led by deep thinkers and artist with integrity and vision whose beautiful words stand out as some of the best essays and poetry produced by any Irish man in history. Patrick Pearse’s poetry has a beauty which sees to the heart of rural Ireland, and of nature itself. Joseph Plunkett wrote profoundly of the spirit, employing veils of meaning whilst paradoxically expressing incredibly clarity of image.  James Connolly wrote ballads of the downtrodden and the rights of the poor and Eamonn Ceannt expressed himself with the music of the hearth of old Ireland.

“Bringing the words of those who fought for Ireland’s independence, to life once again, this truly was an emotive piece of performance art."

Within the fulcrum of activity of the rising and its aftermath we get a brilliant if brief view of the passions and ideas which drove the leaders of the rising to take the stand they took. While this helps us to understand their vision it can equally be said that it is only the culmination of a journey which took in their lifetimes and a cultural memory of generations. Their writings, both at this point and throughout their lives, reveal their vision and dedication to ideas of cultural renewal, and the determination of a new Ireland.

This major composition, which uses their own words, presents a holistic picture of the leaders of The Rising; not just the revolutionaries, but the visionary reformers, philosophers, humanitarians, poets, and artists. 

The Easter Rising was the dramatic climax in the lives of the participants who shaped its stated vision. The Rising catapulted their ideals onto a world stage, and symbolically encompassed their contribution to the formation of the vision of an emerging independent Irish nation. However it is only part of the picture, and beyond the cauldron of armed insurrection and the bold assertion of a national vision these men laid down a life-times’ work in a wider cultural context.

The week of Easter 1916 gives a focused view of their motivations and resolve, and a snapshot of their philosophy, vision, and dedication. This project traces their ideals in other spheres as well as in the arena of political rebellion. This album will give a deeper insight into many of the themes the leaders dealt with in their writings.

Delving into their writings this album will shed some illumination on the wider issues, and more personal motivations, that drove these inspiring leaders onto the events of Easter 1916.

A form which will do honour to the memory of the people of The Rising and which will make a fitting and lasting tribute to their vision. 
   The Impact If you think that the 1916 Rising is a monumental moment in Irish history -both for the residents of Ireland and for the massive Irish extended family throughout the world, please give your support to this campaign. because this project does homage to the leaders of the rising and more importantly to their vision. As a way to learn more about what drove Pearse, Plunkett, Connolly, Ceannt, and the other signatories of the proclamation, this is a great help because it focuses on what they were passionate about and reveals what gave them their passion.   Risks & Challenges This will be my sixth independently produced album. I have always had a self sufficient approach to this and can do many of the tasks myself such as the graphic design and album text; and of course the music creation. 
I believe in  letting other people do what they are good at and what I am not able to do because I think that quality is achieved by people working together. I have done this before and I know I can deliver a high quality album within the budget I have outlined. The album is costed and once I have funds the project will be ready to go into the final stages of action.
The risk is in not achieving my funding goals so I am asking you to please share this amongst as wide a group as you can. 

    Other Ways You Can Help Spread the word please
I am leaving the funding options open to allow for generous donations which may come from a group or organisation. Groups and organisations who celebrate a common Irish lineage in particular might like to take me up on this. Perhaps this album would be an ideal Christmas gift or a part of a goody bag going home from a conference. 
BackgroundThe words and inspiration of the Easter Rising’s leaders are brought to life with fealty and respect in this musical interpretation of their writings. The poetry, essays, and speeches of Patrick Pearse, James Connolly, and Joseph Plunkett, provide the lyrics for a song cycle which I wants to put on a CD as a special memento of the centenary of the most inspired moment in Ireland’s history; the Easter Rising, 1916.1916 – Visionaries and their Words is a song cycle that I composed  to celebrate the centenary of the most inspiring moment of modern Irish history, and the people who led it. The lyrics for this song-cycle were taken exclusively from the inspiring writings of its leaders Patrick Pearse, Joseph Plunkett, Eamonn Ceannt, and James Connolly.“a glorious exploration of what it means to be Irish.”Over a period of six months I undertook deep and meticulous research on the writings of these visionary leaders and used their words, and only their words, to interpret their vision. This was not meant to be a contemporary revision of The Rising but a musical inspiration taken from the words and vision of the leaders of The Rising recorded in their own time, in their own words, from their own pens. The Rising was led by deep thinkers and artist with integrity and vision whose beautiful words stand out as some of the best essays and poetry produced by any Irish man in history. Patrick Pearse’s poetry has a beauty which sees to the heart of rural Ireland, and of nature itself. Joseph Plunkett wrote profoundly of the spirit, employing veils of meaning whilst paradoxically expressing incredibly clarity of image.  James Connolly wrote ballads of the downtrodden and the rights of the poor and Eamonn Ceannt expressed himself with the music of the hearth of old Ireland.“Bringing the words of those who fought for Ireland’s independence, to life once again, this truly was an emotive piece of performance art."Within the fulcrum of activity of the rising and its aftermath we get a brilliant if brief view of the passions and ideas which drove the leaders of the rising to take the stand they took. While this helps us to understand their vision it can equally be said that it is only the culmination of a journey which took in their lifetimes and a cultural memory of generations. Their writings, both at this point and throughout their lives, reveal their vision and dedication to ideas of cultural renewal, and the determination of a new Ireland.This major composition, which uses their own words, presents a holistic picture of the leaders of The Rising; not just the revolutionaries, but the visionary reformers, philosophers, humanitarians, poets, and artists. The Easter Rising was the dramatic climax in the lives of the participants who shaped its stated vision. The Rising catapulted their ideals onto a world stage, and symbolically encompassed their contribution to the formation of the vision of an emerging independent Irish nation. However it is only part of the picture, and beyond the cauldron of armed insurrection and the bold assertion of a national vision these men laid down a life-times’ work in a wider cultural context.The week of Easter 1916 gives a focused view of their motivations and resolve, and a snapshot of their philosophy, vision, and dedication. This project traces their ideals in other spheres as well as in the arena of political rebellion. This album will give a deeper insight into many of the themes the leaders dealt with in their writings.Delving into their writings this album will shed some illumination on the wider issues, and more personal motivations, that drove these inspiring leaders onto the events of Easter 1916.

story:
What is being funded?

Fox Amoore has agreed to compose the entire soundtrack for the visual novel "Major\Minor". Major\Minor launched on Steam in December 2015, and is an episodic visual novel. We are funding a complete overhaul of the auditory assets in the game in order to increase the quality of the product. 

Fox Amoore has agreed to compose all of the music in collaboration with the games creator, Klace. Major\Minor maintains a largely positive reception and is praised for its storytelling and appealing art.

The total run-time of the soundtrack will be approximately one hour at the current IndieGoGo goal. If reached, the goal will also allow for the printing of 500 physical copies of the soundtrack. These will be created and shipped to applicable backers. Possible stretch goals will be a longer run-time of the soundtrack, possible recording sessions, etc...

For more information on Major\Minor:

http://store.steampowered.com/app/417990/

For more information on Fox Amoore:

 http://www.foxamoore.com/

What will the style of music be?

The soundtrack of Major\Minor will be a mix of both epic orchestral tracks, and modern synthesized tunes. Often times both elements will be present in the same song. Major\Minor is a unique story told between two worlds and focusing on their symbiotic relationship with one another. Therefore the music will maintain a common theme, even when changing genres and styles.

Please feel free to check out the video included with the campaign. Fox Amoore is capable of creating some of the best music, and it is our goal to have his music play throughout the entire game. We also aim to bring in professional musicians for recording sessions pending the end amount we raise. This could be anywhere from an epic guitar solo to beautiful vocals.

What are the rewards?

Please make sure to check out the side bar to see all of the applicable rewards. They range from digital copies of the game and soundtrack to physical goodies like collector postcards and even a real physical copy of the soundtrack!

Why IndieGoGo?

This is the perfect platform. Not only does it allow the community to have its say -- but it allows them to place their own value on the idea we are presenting. We believe that this is the best way for everybody to win. while receiving awesome goodies and an even better game experience. IndieGoGoo also offers service to more countries, and the ability to take payment through PayPal. This is much more inclusive than other options.

In Conclusion...

The pitch of a soundtrack needn't be too complicated. We are honored by the support of every future pledge once we launch. Future stretch goals will be added when conceived and when the fundraiser is live. Correspondence after the fundraiser has ended will be done so using the built in IndieGoGo functions. Some reward tiers involve updates as tracks are completed, etc...

For the tiers that include a postcard AND a copy of the soundtrack, the postcards will be sent upon conclusion of the fundraiser. The estimated delivery date is for the soundtrack itself.

Stretch Goals, Extra Goals...

TBD

story:
Short Summary

My name is Darryl Lenard Badley Jr. I am a disabled Army veteran and father of 5. I got saved in the military and that experience catapulted me to help as many of my brothers and sister in arms live better lives and overcome their challenges. Its not always about the building that people attend on Sundays but what we can do for the people we see the other 6 days of the week. When I was medically retired from the Army in 2002 I went to school for music.  Life happened, and I had to get a job. I literally walked into the Radio One office in Richmond, VA and asked for a job in 2003. I was hired on the spot and I never looked back. My love of music, radio, and love for sharing hope is what I live for.  This is my passion. Being a Hope Peddler! With a very Deep Booming Radio Voice.

My campaign is to do my very best to impact as many of the 18.4 million Christian veterans dealing with all types of issues and drama in their lives and maybe just maybe change the mind of someone who was considering a much worse alternative. (FACT: 19 veterans commit suicide everyday) That's not counting the ones that tried and failed and now have to live with yet another failure. Can you imagine trying to commit suicide because you consider yourself a failure and you screw that up? Now add to that the number of veterans that deal with their issues with drugs alcohol or other self destructive means.

 

Many of US refuse to get the help we need and don't trust civilian doctors. I want to create a platform that those veterans sitting in his house alone with a bottle of whatever can click on his phone and listen to uplifting music and inspiring content that could be the turning point to their recovery. 

I need money to make sure I am continuously providing a resource that can help thousands of veterans and do that full time. The end goal is to get that huge number down to 18! Being the ONLY media outlet in the country specifically targeting this population it is a very daunting task. This is why it is my plan to use a similar model for growth as traditional terrestrial station, launch and sustain Christian Warrior Digital Radio affiliates in every market in the united states that host the major media chains.  This will ensure if their is a veteran in Oregon that needs assistance they can reach out to the local affiliate. This will also mean that there are hundreds if not thousands of veterans operating digital radio stations around the country. 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

So if you recall in the previous section I am the father of 5! These are my little babies. I am the small guy with the bald head. This at the graduation of the one in the middle who is currently in college. The one next to him is also in college. The one on the other end is already being scouted by college football scouts. and yes, the princess and my grand daughter round out the lot.

Running any operation with excellence requires a time commitment that results in a full time job. The funds for this endeavor will go to purchasing the equipment for broadcasting, Travel, office rental, marketing materials, and salaries for the 3 to 6 employees needed to successfully operate a fully functioning radio station. Our operational budget is a little more than $120,000 annually, 60 percent of that is salary and benefits.

Internet Radio is the Future

Here is a staggering number, $1,000,000,000! That is the amount of money that has been gained, at the expense of terrestrial radio in the past 10 years. Digital radio is the terrestrial radio as digital phones are to analog. Eventually, there will no longer be huge antennas broadcast over an AM or FM signal.  The graph below shows the ages of those who consume digital radio. It is fair to assume that if those who are in the 24 and under continue to consume in this fashion, there will be no need for FM radio at all within the next 40 year or less. Taking this into account, we seek to ride the digital tsunami and use the best practices of the top media companies in the World.

 

DOES ANYONE REMEMBER THIS COMPANY? MY POINT EXACTLY!

Clear channel, now I Heart Media,  leveraged its digital platform and went as far as to re brand itself to reflect the changing times. Doing so has now secured them the second spot of the digital plain behind Spotify. Our goal is to use that same logic and game plan but specifying veterans. 

What if We don't Reach Our Goal?

If the full amount of the funds are not raised, that will mean that I will either have to let some of the staff I intend to hire go and be forced to do the work of two or three myself. Obviously, the buck stops with me but part of the whole point of this endeavor is helping other veterans gain sustainability. But more to the point we are creating a service for veterans unlike anything seen before. This is new, and like anything new it will take resources to cast the net far enough to reach all that would need to be a part of our programming. NO VET LEFT BEHIND!

The Impact

This campaign ultimate goal is to first sustain myself and my family. I suffer from Obstructive Sleep Apnea and as such am considered high risk for Covid -19. Even if the entire country decided to go out and be social, I do not have that luxury of risking that. Me contracting that disease would at best be very challenging. So creating a sustainable income source and platform that has such a high level of impact is the best solution for me at this time. As stated earlier, This process will be scaled out similar to that of traditional radio station, minus the ungodly overhead of massive teams, towers, engineers and the like. This means more resources for the people doing the work and more opportunity for exponential growth.

Risks & Challenges

There are three main risk and challenges that we are facing with this endeavor.

  1. So many businesses are struggling due to the current pandemic and the availability of funds to advertise and promote on radio may be lacking. This also will greatly hinder our ability to conduct business face to face.
  2. The second risk is that fact that there is the possibility that the current pandemic drags out longer than anticipated. The more there is suffering the less people are willing to spend money.
  3. The third challenge is push back from organizations that don't understand the facts concerning digital media and the growth it has had over the past three years.

All three of these issues have literally been resolved because of themselves. The national pandemic has shown us that we very resilient when it comes to continuing operations remotely.  The flow of money and resources has shifted but by no means has gone away. The many video teleconferencing platforms and remote file sharing make it just as viable to conduct a successful enterprises from home. As an Army retiree, I have been trained to adapt improvise and overcome in any situation.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are 18 Million Veterans in this country.  I am sure if you are reading this you know a few.  Every one counts. Thats what makes this truly genuine. If we all do our best and do our part then together we will be able to impact those that need it most!! Dont just share this once and forget it. Please make an effort to share this info. If nothing else, a veteran may see this and log in to our website and be impacted by our message.

story:
Unsupervised comes to Curtiss Hall

Unsupervised is a collaborative, un-conducted ensemble revitalizing orchestral performance in Chicago. By giving every musician a voice in creative decisions in rehearsal and artistic leadership of the ensemble, Unsupervised fosters deep engagement in the music by everyone involved, creating uniquely meaningful experiences for performers and audiences alike.

Unsupervised's concert on February 6 will be the second performance by the full chamber orchestra. Not only will your support bring vibrant performances of music by contemporary composer Missy Mazzoli, 20th century Argentinian composer Alberto Ginastera, and Joseph Haydn to Chicago, it will also position us to receive grants and other funding in the future, allowing us to continue to present concerts and provide a model for what orchestral performances can be. 

What We Need & What You Get

Between our initial Indiegogo campaign and tax-deductible donations through our Fractured Atlas, we've raised approximately $2,000, 25% of our total goal and enough to cover all of our production expenses for this performance. BUT, we still need to raise $6,000 to pay our musicians just minimum wage for all of the time they put into preparing for this performance.

Musician Compensation

Each Unsupervised musician dedicates incredible amounts of time and energy preparing for performances, both in rehearsal and off-stage. Unsupervised respects and acknowledges each musicians’ time and talent by paying for their hours spent in rehearsal and performance. With your contribution, we can pay all our musicians minimum wage, which does not include the countless hours spent preparing outside of rehearsal. Though it does not compare to professional regional orchestras in the area, it is enough to recognize everyone’s investment in this performance, and it allows each musician to dedicate themselves completely to the performance.

What do you get?

Everyone involved in Unsupervised recognizes how essential your contributions are in making this unique arts experience possible. As a way to demonstrate our thanks we can offer: a special recording for your birthday, personalized thank you, admission to the concert, a signed copy of the concert program, recording of the performance, invitation to exclusive open rehearsal, house concert, music lessons, and more!

Our Impact

Unsupervised is Chicago's only conductorless orchestra, and with our unique collaborative structure and by engaging with the audience from the stage, we are revitalizing orchestral performance and creating a rich community around shared experiences of music.

Not only do we hope to bring uniquely meaningful performances to our audiences and our musicians, we hope we can serve as a model for what any orchestra or ensemble can (and we believe should) be. Unsupervised developed out of a belief that every performance — whether by a soloist, a string quartet, or a 100-piece orchestra — comes alive through the relationships that are behind it. We know that the best, most meaningful performances happen when everyone involved is closely connected to each other and intimately involved with the music, and we aim to be a model for how to achieve that.

Orchestral music matters, not only because of the creativity that went into its composition, or the history behind it, but because of its ability to connect us to each other and our shared humanity. We aim to bring that experience to all.

Our Challenge

An orchestra, even a small one, is an expensive endeavor, but it is well worth the investment. Nothing compares to the experience of dozens of individuals coming together and investing themselves completely in a common goal and sharing that with an audience. With the challenge of funding a 25-member ensemble comes an opportunity as well: an expanded community with which to engage. Every member of the ensemble will help us to meet our fundraising goal and to grow our family of supporters by connecting us to their personal community.

Our ensemble is comprised of accomplished young musicians from the Chicago area and beyond. We come from many of the best music schools in the country and have performed with some of the most exciting young organizations such as Zafa Collective and Ensemble Dal Niente and with many of the region's well regarded established ensembles including the Civic Orchestra of Chicago, the Chicago Symphony Orchestra, the Madison Chamber Orchestra, Quad Cities Symphony Orchestra, Elgin Symphony Orchestra, and more.

Our musicians also have experience starting and leading young music ensembles and working in some of Chicago's most significant cultural institutions. We are all deeply committed to all aspects of the organization and to fostering this new model of an orchestra.

Tax deductible contributions

Unsupervised is a fiscally sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization that supports not-for-profit arts projects. This allows us to accept tax-deductible donations. If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation to Unsupervised, visit unsupervisedchi.org/donate.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute financially, there are many other ways you can help. A great way to start is simply by sharing this campaign. You can also join us on Facebook and help get the word out about our February 6 performance.

If you have particular expertise that you'd like to offer to Unsupervised (legal, financial, marketing, graphic design, photography/videography, etc.) or material contributions like rehearsal space or reception food, etc., please email info@unsupervisedchi.org.

This allows us to accept tax-deductible donations. If you would like to make a tax-deductible donation to Unsupervised, visit unsupervisedchi.org/donate.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you aren't able to contribute financially, there are many other ways you can help. A great way to start is simply by sharing this campaign. You can also join us on Facebook and help get the word out about our February 6 performance.If you have particular expertise that you'd like to offer to Unsupervised (legal, financial, marketing, graphic design, photography/videography, etc.) or material contributions like rehearsal space or reception food, etc., please email info@unsupervisedchi.org.

story:
1st September 2017, I made a promise to myself that I would truly start to honour this life path of becoming a singer-songwriter, connecting to the world through my songs and the stage as my home. 

I picked up my guitar for the first time in months, and started writing. 

The years prior to this moment, had seen a complex duality of who I wanted to be and who I felt expected to be. The cycles of emotions, the pain, the laughter, the tears, the dreaming, the stillness, yet the one thing that brought me back to me, to my centre, was my voice. 

Since holding this prayer deep in my heart, and telling the world about this journey I am wanting to take, the inspiration, commitment and belief has been incomparable to anything I have encountered before. I feel immensely rich through the showering of love that I share with my community.

However, to be able to share this music, to be able to share my inner-knowings of this deep journey that we call life with others, to be able to inspire, support, and to make a difference, I am in need of some serious financial support.

Being an independent artist, is not an easy mission and making and producing music costs a lot of money too! The average signed artist would spend  approx. £30,000- £50,000 on making and distributing an album. (That's crazy money!) 

The breakdown of what I am proposing will go towards:

  • Recording
  • Arranging
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Paying the musicians/ producer/ engineers 
  • Professional video of first single 
  • Indiegogo's fees +  Creating + Postage for your gifts

 

Now it's time to start sharing this beautiful vision! Share with your loved ones, Share on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Email, Word of Mouth! Sharing is the easiest way to contribute to this creation!

If you would like to pre-order the EP, please click to the right to donate your amount and the goodies you feel to choose. 

This is the start of an incredible journey and I thank you all from the bottom of my heart.

Lucy x

 

The Breakdown - How are we going to do this? 

 

Introducing you to the wonderful musician, guitarist and producer who is helping with the full creation of this EP, Michael Stanton. He has worked alongside many other musicians such as Ayla Schafer, Susie Ro and Faeland who are all an integral part of inspiration to my journey.

Michael Stanton and I met in the wintry month of January where we sat down and started to envision the full colour spectrum of the songs. 

Meeting Michael has been an incredible blessing on this journey. Until recently, I felt a lack of growth in the right direction. It was important for me that the right producer not only understood my music but also understood the way I danced internally, especially when working on a project that's so vulnerable.

The Musical Instruments 

We are still at the very early stages of this project, however, these are some of the musical instruments we have envisioned on the tracks that are going to be recorded for the EP. No Musicians have yet been contacted but we do already have a list of musicians we hope to use. 

  • Cello
  • Violin
  • Percussion 
  • Double Bass
  • Classical Guitar 
  • Clarinet 
  • Harp 
  • Native Flute
  • Ngoni 
  • Piano 

 

Your generous support will go towards the costs of paying the wonderful musicians as this is very important!

A rough outline of where the costs will be going if I meet my target. Any extra money will be going towards a UK and European tour and more media outlets.

 

  • Studio Hire  (10%)
  • Musicians  (15%)
  • Producer  (15%)
  • Mixing and Mastering  (20%)
  • Professional Video  (10%)
  • Artwork + Printing of CD's  (25%)
  • Fee's and Postage of perks (5%)

 

Doing a campaign so early on in this journey does provide some risks, however, if I do not meet my target, I am still committed to fulfilling this task and providing you with an EP. There would be some compromises to how many instruments will be used, the artwork and media outlets, but all perks will be sent towards the end of July.

 

The Plan 

 

Listed below is a goal-orientated plan! We will keep you informed when we have reached these goals! 

  • Making Demo's 
  • Visioning songs and writing of other instrumental parts 
  • Contacting musicians to play parts
  • Get together to play the songs and change anything that may need changing
  • Record parts
  • Master 
  • Release! 

 

I am limiting this project to 3 months. Ideally, this should be enough time to complete all the tasks, however, this is music and there are always short-falls, and mishaps, but I am confident in meeting our goals within a good distance. 

If you have any questions regarding the crowdfunder, the music, rewards or any other issue, please do not hesitate to contact!

Email:  luewylde@gmail.com 

 

Lucy Wylde: Who am I? 

 

When I think about putting myself into words, I always become blank, not because I don't know who I am, but because I have no idea how to describe how my music! 

Imagine an array of balmy seas, mixed with a dash of vibrant celestial colour, sunshine, deep blue waters, and a heart full of love. Imagine being faced with a moment of empathy, someone who sees you and is not afraid to express their darkness in the turn of the light. A bridging of two worlds, an acceptance and relief of my journey put into melodies and words. 

Every song, carefully grasped by the light of the dark, a moment of balance, truth and beauty. 

Born in Devon, Lucy Wylde captures the heart lines of the soul, her celestial essence mixed with the history of her past, brings an emotive picturesque and a calling for the heart to come home. Her melodies transcend landscapes through the mind, creating waves and flutters of seeds and gardens full of pure beauty and oneness. 

Her music took a turning point back in January 2017 when she dedicated her path to healing the wounds that she had carried for so long. Through this journey, she met some of the most beautiful soul teachers, guidance, and support from her community, and her heart started to open. She started to remember why she was here and the gift and stories that she wanted to bring to the people. 

In September 2017, she made a promise to herself to dedicate her life to her music, for it is her soul mission on this earth. 

 

"Such a magical voice!" -David Ginn

"Totally breathtaking performance! We were blown away by your very unique and unforgettable performance!" - Jess Bundy 

"Everytime I see her, I am stunned by the power of her voice! I cannot help but be mesmerised by her beautiful lyrics and the way that sings with all her heart and soul. Her music melts my heart. She is incredible talented." Bethany Carter

story:
My Story

I have been active in many areas of music for most of my life.  I was enchanted after seeing a movie about an orchestra as a small child and hearing a good choir a few years later.  The seed was planted.  As a young man, I had experience on the piano, saxophone, and the classical guitar, which became my primary instrument for over 30 years.  I took first prize in the Boston Guitar Circle competition in the 1960's.

In 1991 I decided to concentrate on composition rather than performance and developed a unique style that avoids the excessive dissonance and chaos too evident in the works of other modern composers.  My style, while formally atonal, does not shy away from the frequent use of melody and harmony, while at the same time avoiding obvious references to 19th-century tonal music; this style has been characterized as "locally tonal".  It is rewarding, both intellectually and emotionally, and its effectiveness is due partly to raw inspiration and partly to my unique way of going about the composition process.  The fact that I never attended a conservatory is one of the happy circumstances that contribute to my unique sound.  My work is structured, organic, and contains an endless variety of musical effects that include homophony, polyphony, orchestral fireworks, leitmotivs, and the occasional tone cluster.

My works to date include operas, song cycles, and chamber music. I composed the well-known Annabel Lee, recorded by Joan Baez in the 60's.  An arrangement of that work for three instruments and mezzo was performed in New York by members of the Metropolitan Opera in 2003  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3vd5hIvlCNE  My operas include Rostam, Rasputin, The Inca, and a set of three one-acts: The Decision, The Love Machine, and Top Secret. To these may be added an operetta, The Ms Seattle Skyline Contest, with a libretto by Linda Rimel, and the ballet The Brothers of Judar, set to an Arabian Nights story.  My song cycles include a set of five songs to poems of William Blake, a set of 39 songs to classical Indian love poems, and settings of Longfellow for mezzo voice and piano and for SATB chorus.  Other choral music includes There is Peace, to a libretto by Linda Rimel.  My chamber works include Seven Attitudes for Horn, with a version for clarinet.  I have also written string quartets.  I was for many years the President of the Maine Composer's Forum and I am represented by BMI.  Aside from music, I also hold a BS in physics from MIT.

About the Opera Rostam

The opera tells the story of the Persian hero Rostam, as described in the classic 11th-century epic The Shahnameh, by Ferdowsi, who is the Persian's Shakespeare.  His epic is almost unknown in the West and is a masterpiece, and that is why I selected it for my opera.  Rostam is their greatest warrior.  During his 600-year life, he spent exactly one night in the company of a woman, a princess named Tahmina, and the result of that union was his son Sohrab.

According to the story, Rostam, who was off on his military campaigns, knew nothing about Sohrab, and the latter did not know who his father was since Tahmina had reasons for keeping it secret. The movement we are going to perform and record tells of when Tahmina at last, informs Sohrab, who is now a young man, of his father.  Sohrab is inspired by an overwhelming vision of himself and Rostam together ascending the throne.  Despite the tears and pleading of Tahmina, Sohrab gathers his sword and armor and sets off to find his father.

Operas must, of course, tell of conflict, sacrifice, and inevitable death from conspiring events.  Rostam and Sohrab meet on the battlefield in the last movement, but not until Sohrab has been mortally wounded does Rostam discover who his opponent is. He cradles Sohrab as his son dies.

The Goal of the Fundraiser

The goal is to raise sufficient funds to support an Opera Workshop, to be held at the Snow Pond Music Camp, Sidney, Maine, in the Spring of 2018.  We will rehearse and record one movement from the opera with professional-quality musicians, and then approach qualified opera companies with that recording, with the goal of inspiring them to mount a full production.  Nobody is going to produce a new opera unless they are convinced it is a wonderful work that absolutely should be performed.  A great recording of a beautiful movement should convince them

Why should anyone support the fundraising effort?

Well, to start with, this is an opera that sounds like music, as distinguished from many modern works that sound more like noise. This is an opera that people will gladly pay to hear and see, once it becomes known.  An opera that is unperformed solely because it is not yet known. This fundraising is a vital first step in changing that.

“A Russian chemist wanted to write an opera, and the result was Prince Igor. That composer had little formal training, but his superb talent made up for it. If a Russian composer can do it, so can an American composer.”
 

What we need and how the funds will be applied

The funds raised will pay for the venue, professional musicians, recording costs, miscellaneous expenses, and costs involved with approaching various professional Opera Companies and presenting the finished work

We have a fixed goal of $30,000 for this campaign.  What this means is, if we do not reach this goal, your money will be returned to you.  Even though the goal is $30K, please do not be discouraged to continue donating after the $30K goal is reached.  $50K will allow us to produce an even better demo recording.

Here is how the funds will be applied:

$8,000. Musicians and soloists

$2,000. Conductor

$8,000. – Venue rental and expenses – Snowpond Music Camp  www.snowpond.org

$4,000. – Recording studio time

$3,000. – Post Production – Mixing and Mastering

$3,000. Publicity, Promotion, Promotion 

$2,000.Shopping to qualified Opera Production Studios

TOTAL  $30,000.

Perks

Although I am fully aware that perks are a very important part of any fundraising campaign, I have not gone crazy with tons of different perks.  For larger donations, I am offering valuable original oil paintings depicting scenes from Rostam.  For smaller donations, we have high-quality T-shirts with a screen of original Rostam oil paintings printed on them.  Also, for those who cannot afford a larger donation, we have MP3's of the demo recording and DVD's of the mastered recording if and when it reaches a venue.  I am also offering something I believe to be very interesting.  Free admission vouchers to the Rostam recording session at Snowpond Center for the Arts in Sidney Maine in the Spring of 2018.  Transportation to this event is not included but my feeling is that anyone who has a serious interest in this kind of experience will be willing to spring for the cost of the trip.  I sure hope so anyhow.

Other ways you can help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
Whether you contribute or not:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and send them a link to the campaign.

story:
the extreme keys came together in 1981 to sing a cappella and have a good time (not necessarily in that order), and we haven't stopped since! we love to sing together, especially when it comes to supporting an important cause.

this year, our annual festival will in majority be raising money for the hispanic federation (http://hispanicfederation.org/) after the events of hurricane maria.

hurricane maria devastated puerto rico, leaving many without homes or electricity, even to this day. adequate help has still not been sent to puerto rico, despite the several months that have passed since the hurricane. we hope that lending our voices and raising money for the hispanic federation can lift spirits and, in any way possible, change lives for the better. we hope that this cause is as important to you as it is to us; please donate. 

furthermore, a very small portion (30% or less) of the funds will assist the extreme keys in their spring tour! this march, the extreme keys plan to go on a road trip that will eventually leave us in cleveland, ohio. we will sing with many other a cappella groups and hopefully at many a bryn mawr club! if the idea of catching us perform at a venue near you is motivating, please consider donating (and contact us if you can help make that happen!).

 this concert will be featuring 10+ groups from the tri-college consortium on january 26, 2018, at 6:30 pm in bryn mawr's college hall! if you donate to this indiegogo, you are more than welcome to come -- in fact, we hope to see you there!

story:
the CONCEPT

 

I believe that everything we dream about, everything we see as happiness and fulfillment holds our desire to connect to our true “inner self”: the abundant and limitless source of happiness, joy, love, and bliss. Feeling free and happy is our natural state, the genuine expression of ourselves. We need to keep reminding each other of WHO WE REALLY ARE in order to build a world with more love, trust, faith, support, and oneness – a world with no fear.

I hope to make this album as a gentle reminder to everyone about the beauty and grace of life and the whole existence. I am so enthusiastic to share it with you! Writing music and lyrics was never more inspirational and joyful for me, as it is for this album.

I’ve made an acoustic version of a song called “Take Me To A Place” for you to get a preview of the album. The produced version of it will be included on the album. Please watch the acoustic lyric video: 

 

 

the MUSIC

I will use live recorded instruments and will work at the greatest studios in my country, involving most talented musicians for producing this album (like collaborating with the talented and amazing musicians from National Youth Orchestra). The album’s main direction is pop/indie pop, but I aim to follow my heart and intuition regarding each song particularly. I will use classical instruments combined with instruments for making meditation music because I think it will make the album joyful, uplifting and inspirational.

Music is one of the best ways to communicate our feelings and also one of the best ways to shape them. I believe in music that’s elevating and brings us closer together. That’s why I want to make this album as a celebration of life and a celebration of us. I hope to remind everyone how lucky we are to be a part of the creation, to be able to feel, enjoy, and admire the beauty around and inside us, and how lucky we are to be able to love and express ourselves. The most beautiful accomplishment for me is inspiring people to appreciate life even more after listening to this album and inspiring them to share this feeling with others.

 

the COVER 

The album cover is a copy of one of my paintings, named “AND NOW I SEE”.  This painting is about seeing through the eyes of the “Higher Self” and about the moment of alignment with the power within us. I feel it will perfectly fit the message of the entire album, and I am excited to use it as a cover for something that I have created.

the LYRICS BOOK

It would be a dream come true for me to make this lyrics book. I will organize it in a journal style in order to share my story, my feelings, and some insights and ideas I was writing down in a notebook for a while now. You see, for the last couple of years, I’ve been through a difficult period of anxiety in my life. I guess that’s how the Universe wanted to “wake me up” and help discover myself.  Now I know that going through this kind of experience is a BEAUTIFUL part of life and growth.. but as it’s said in Coldplay’s song “The Scientist” – nobody said it was easy :) 

Hoping that it helps somebody, I want to speak about my experience, and the most important, how thankful I am to it for making me who I am now. Also, I really want to expand upon the lyrics and to share the story behind them. I will add to the book mini drawings, photos of my paintings, and a lot of other interesting things.

Here are some of my paintings:

I want to share my story so everyone who is on the same path would feel they are not alone. In this way, I wish to help everyone to see and bring back the state of joy and harmony that is waiting silently to be seen inside everyone.

 

where the MONEY will go 

The album will use live recorded instruments, thus a lot of expenses will go for recording, session musicians, studio time, mixing, mastering, and all other work a really good production needs. I'll make sure to create this album as high quality for you as possible! Also, I would like to film a music video for the lead single from the album.The physical printing of the album, the printing of the lyrics book, packaging, etc. will also require important financial investments.

 

thank YOU

Thank you so much for your support! I hope you know how much it means to me! I am already happy sharing this idea with you. THANK YOU and let’s do something GREAAAAAAAT TOGETHER!
story_txt: the CONCEPT I believe that everything we dream about, everything we see as happiness and fulfillment holds our desire to connect to our true “inner self”: the abundant and limitless source of happiness, joy, love, and bliss. Feeling free and happy is our natural state, the genuine expression of ourselves. We need to keep reminding each other of WHO WE REALLY ARE in order to build a world with more love, trust, faith, support, and oneness – a world with no fear.I hope to make this album as a gentle reminder to everyone about the beauty and grace of life and the whole existence. I am so enthusiastic to share it with you! story:
Wenn du ein Problem mit der angebotenen Zahlungsmethode hast und lieber per PayPal oder Banküberweisung bezahlen möchtest, dann melde dich bitte direkt bei Marcel!

 

Worum es geht

Ende der 70er Jahre: Punkmusik ist auf dem Vormarsch in der Bundesrepublik – auch in der ostwestfälischen Provinz in Bielefeld. Mit Notdurft entsteht dort eine der wichtigsten Bands, welche auch überregional Gehör findet. Die erste LP von 1982 ist noch heute eine Legende. 

35 Jahre später wollen wir – vier Punkliebhaber aus Bielefeld – dieses Album mit einem Tribute würdigen. Die zwölf Songs der Platte (und ein paar Bonusstücke) sollen dafür von aktuellen Bands in jeweils eigenen Interpretationen neu eingespielt werden.

 

Wer wir sind

  • Marcel Hähnel – Sänger der Band Dr. Luftnot, seit 20 Jahren Betreiber des Labels Überfall Records, bei diesem Projekt hauptverantwortlich für die Kommunikation mit den beteiligten Musikern
  • Chris Kripo – Sänger und Gitarrist der Band Pogopanik, Konzertveranstalter, bei diesem Projekt hauptverantwortlich für die Pressearbeit
  • Thorsten Höning – Sänger der Band Caminos, als Grafiker für das Artwork der Platte verantwortlich
  • Randy Ridder – Tontechniker, nimmt ein Großteil der Stücke im Studio mit den Bands auf und sorgt für einen stimmigen Gesamtsound aller Beiträge

  

Was mit der Kohle passiert

Die für das Projekt anfallenden Kosten sind für das Studio und die Pressung der LP/CD. Unser angegebener Zielbetrag von 2500 € ist so berechnet, dass er für eine einfache Ausstattung der LP und die Basiskosten fürs Studio ausreicht. Was wir darüber hinaus generieren wird genutzt, um die Ausstattung der LP hochwertiger zu gestalten (180 g Vinyl, hochwertigere Innenhüllen, Doppel-LP), ebenso die Ausstattung der CD, und unserem Tontechniker Randy eine menschenwürdige Aufwandsentschädigung zu ermöglichen. Hauptaugenmerk bei dem Projekt liegt auf der LP, sodass es bei knapper finanzieller Unterstützung unter Umständen statt einer gepressten „nur“ eine industriell gebrannte CD geben könnte. 

   

Warum dieses Projekt erfolgreich sein wird

Dieses Projekt liegt in den Händen von Menschen, die sich mit vollem Herzblut seit Jahren in der Punkszene engagieren. Wir bündeln für dieses Projekt unsere vielfältigen Kompetenzen, die wir aus unserer langjährigen Erfahrung als Labelbetreiber, Fanzine-Herausgeber, Mediengestalter, Grafiker, Tontechniker, Konzertveranstalter, Musiker mitbringen. 

Wir wenden uns mit der Promotion an lokale und überregionale Printmedien und Radio.
Wir werben über soziale Medien, Flyer, Poster (die Druckkosten tragen wir selber).
 

Was du noch für uns tun kannst

Auch wenn du uns selber nicht finanziell unterstützen kannst, kannst du uns helfen, indem du unsere Kampagne teilst und bekannt und beliebt machst.
 

Wer auf der Platte mit dabei ist

Caminos, Überflüssig, Micro Bogumil (Abstürzende Brieftauben), Ugly Hurons, Dave & Mighty, Canaima, The Uschi Obermaier Experience, Hans am Felsen, Dr. Luftnot, Pogopanik, PunPunBo, Mururoa Attäck, Zelle-B, Brausepöter, 1982, Beckx (F*cking Angry), The Dukes of Hamburg, Human Hair People, Størsender, Terrorfett …

story:
The Goal

I'd like to make a music video where Donald Trump and Kim Jong Un (puppet versions) sing a ballad from opposite sides of the world of how they want to rule the planet, how sad they are as they have no friends, and of how they want to nuke each others country to high hell.

There will be references to all your favourite issues: 

In Donalds' case: Lying to the public to become elected head of state, not believing in climate change, not paying your employees, not paying tax, grabbing women by the pussy etc.

In Kim's case: Stirring up the hornets nest by constantly firing missiles at the neighbours, having your opponents assassinated (even with vx gas) also lying to your own people etc. etc.

(you get the idea)

What I Need To Do It

I already have all the equipment needed to complete the job except a Kim Jong Un puppet which will cost around between $400 - $2000 depending on the quality.

I'd like to take time off work from my day job to complete this as it will take a lot of time so I need some financial help.

The more money that's donated, the better the video and the more videos there will be!

Please help me fulfil my dream of bringing entertainment to world full time.

Why I Think It's Important

If you're passionate about bringing to light some of the worlds most important issues (and let me tell you I'm pretty damn passionate about this stuff) Then you will understand comedy is perhaps the greatest way to get the attention of millions of people who wouldn't otherwise think about these issues from a fresh perspective.

Even a tiny donation will go along way - with the power of people, we can achieve anything.

story:
Hi I’m Andrew, the creator of Melotivity app. As many of you guys, I love listening to music while working. I start my workday with searching for the music which could fit my current mood, help me concentrate or motivate me to work harder and cope with my big tasks faster. 

Have you had this problem, when you’ve been listening for your favourite track for a while, and then you find yourself unable to concentrate to that important letter because the singer keeps disturbing you? This happened to me a lot, I had to switch the music off and go look for some calm relaxing tunes that would help me concentrate.

Having over 15 years of music making experience I thought - why do I always have to fit with the music’s mood, why not create special music which will fit mine? If  I want to concentrate on a complicated task, I don’t want to be distracted by looking for a suitable track, or if I want to work faster, doing day to day tasks, I want my music to hustle up with me. Here is what I came up with. I’m proud to announce a revolutionary product:

Melotivity. Melody that enhances your productivity.

Melotivity is a Windows app (MAC OS version will be the next stretch goal) 

 

*studies by University of Birmingham, Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute and CMS College of Engineering in Bangalore.

Imagine playing a masterpiece video game where music themes interchange according to the story, they have a huge impact on play motivation and game developers know that. Now we have this effect on day-to-day productivity motivation. A melody to make you achieve your goals.

 

I have huge passion for this project, as writing music is one the most important parts of my life. And since this project is not only about music, but about this interaction between our brain and sound, I'm more then eager to finish what I've started. I will need your help, as I don't know how to code so I need to outsource that with a couple of programmers, we will need about 900$ for that + I will need about 600$ for a new KORG analogue synth, which will be used in the studio along with other synths, guitars, midi devices I already have. 

First of all - 1500$ With this sum already we can launch the Version 1. A PC app that will have just one button - switch on/off. And one music style in it. The ETA for Version 1 is: August-September 2017

Goal 2:

Creating a MAC OS version - we will need 3000$ in total to make that happen. 

Goal 3:

If we gather 5000$ I will add a category choice ability. Now you can decide the overall mood of the music you will listen to today. Each mood will contain 3 hours+ of unique music material. All created by me and my friends/colleagues.

Goal 4:

If we gather 10 000$+, we will create this app from scratch with even more functions. It will fit PC/MAC, have categories of music, also it will have the accelerate mode. At this mode the app will use smart algorithms to increase your speed, making it as smooth and unnoticeable as possible. Also the app will show your your Daily Performance Analysis.

This campaign is a fixed goal campaign, I'm not using the Flex goal setting because the fixed sum of 1500 is the minimal required sum to make all this happen, with smaller funding - I just won't be able to make this dream come true for me and you, my dear backers. So there is literally no risk for you, and I'm confident that we will be able to do that!

story:
Short Summary

Black Malachite has been my passion project and my main way of expressing what I want to express musically for the last year. I've been making music for nearly a decade overall, and I want to put all of my cards in the basket with my fourth album. 

  • My name is Dalton, and I started seriously getting involved with music when I was 12 years old. I started experimenting with my own music when I was 16, and learned how to scream at that age as well.
  • With your help, I can get the materials I need to heighten "Nightfall"'s production values to the standard I feel is necessary to bring the vision I have for this album to life.

What We Need & What You Get

This is what funds will go towards:

  • Production costs, including new VSTs, studio time, promotional advertising costs, submission to streaming and similar music services, and if enough funds are raised, physical production.
  • Additional physical equipment to help with the quality of the album including a new pop filter, new wires, and if enough funds are raised, a better quality microphone.
  • Everyone who donates will receive some form of prize, and personal thanks.
  • If the goal is not reached, funds will still go towards production of the album, they will just be allocated differently to compensate.

The Impact

Nightfall is the most ambitious challenge I have ever taken on, and is the most important album to me musically that I've ever worked on. With your help, I can bring it to life in a way that I couldn't do alone. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing the IndieGoGo around is the best kind of help that I could ever ask for.

And that's all there is to it.
