And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

I've been involved with music since age 11. From being a DJ to being an artist I've experienced many different aspects of the music industry. I have worked in and out several studios throughout New York and Connecticut, I have also performed all around the U.S. That being said, I have been able to grow a solid network to help me reach a substantial amount of people throughout the world. I've released multiple projects so far and have experienced what great marketing can do, as well as the unfortunate results of poor marketing. Each project I've released in the past has had their own budgets, with their own marketing plans. (After all, this is a business).

               After years of funding every project with performance revenue, saved royalties,  and profits from selling merchandise I have always told myself that I would never ask anybody to fund 100% of my project. As time has passed, and the more marketing research for each project completed, I asked myself "What if I only ask for 50% of what I need?", This way I'd be able to work to contribute the other 50% myself, prove to my supporters that I'm reliable, at the same time as developing a stronger support system. I've decided to launch this campaign to not only help me fund my next single but to also give my supporters a way to connect with me and my music directly through a project.                     

The Project

The single will be called "Number One", it is unlike anything I have ever created before. From the start one of my greatest influences was Richie Valens and the rock music of that decade. Moving from Hip-Hop to EDM I've always tried to incorporate that historic sound somehow, whether it be in a melody or the drums. "Number One" not only captures the musical feel I've always wanted to include in my projects, but it is the type of music that I plan to keep creating (if all goes well), it's the beginning of a long road, in which I will need as much support as I can get. 

What Is the Meaning of The Song?

This song speaks to those who have ever seen somebody somewhere and immediately thought (due to appearance, or any other characteristic) "they and I should be together". This then sparks a fantasy in this person's mind creating this perfect world with that person seen, only to find out, in reality, that person is with someone else. (In the song I play the person seen, in the fantasy perspective. I'm a little ugly, so it's a comedic role :D)

Market Potential

Already, the song has major commercial appeal, and has more potential to hit the commercial market than any other song I have written. Through my current network, and the production company that will produce the final record, this song is already planned to be shopped out immediately to outlets ranging from TV Networks to Record labels. (Please Note: Those of you who are familiar with the music industry know that production companies will not waste their time shopping out a song without potential.)

Where Will Your Money Go?

The Final Recording- I have always used my own studio (Studio Red CT) to record all preliminary recordings, as well as some of the final mixes. Due to the love I have for this song and for it's potential, I wanted to make sure I use all the necessary tools possible to produce the best product. I signed a production deal from a studio in New York. I've wanted to record at this studio for a very long time, due to the expertise of those behind it, as well as the top of the line equipment used. Due to current contract litigation's, I am not allowed to publicly announce the name of the studio, but I will give supporters all the details personally once donations have been made. This session will range from ($1,000-$5,000) depending on the duration,what will be added to the song, and for paying the producer and engineer fairly. (Seeing as the maximum range is more than what i'm asking supporters for, I will personally be paying for whatever additional expenses arise such as travel, hospitality, etc.)


The Music Video- I've been wanting to record a music video ever since I wrote my first song! (Keep in mind, every time I write a song, I'm picturing the music video in my head as I write it.) The video for "Number One" already has a location in New York City, and has a set date to shoot. All I'm relying on my supporters for here is the videographer's payment ranging from $500-$1,500 depending on the amount of editing, time it takes to shoot, and how many additional employees are needed on set. (I will personally be paying for the space to rent.)

Marketing- Once the product is ready to distribute my marketing plan will take action. This will cover anything from booking shows, social media ads and promos, to printed press. The category of marketing is so extensive that the options could literally go on forever, Once the project is released, this becomes my life on a day to day basis, doing whatever I can to follow the plan and beyond to get the song heard by as many people as possible. I've set my rough marketing  budget to $2,000 but as I said above it's a very extensive category and can go on forever (meaning as much support as possible will be needed.)

I'm looking for as much support as possible to get "Number One" heard by the most people, and to take it as far as it can possibly go.  If you're reading this, I'm really counting on you, and everyone you know. The financial figures above very briefly demonstrate what goes into each category which is why I'm only asking my supporters to contribute what they can.

If you are a supporter who can't afford a $10 contribution, then please tell 10 people about this, and let me know if you are as excited as I am to hear Number One.
story_txt:
Short Summary
I've been involved with music since age 11. From being a DJ to being an artist I've experienced many different aspects of the music industry. I have worked in and out several studios throughout New York and Connecticut, I have also performed all around the U.S. That being said, I have been able to grow a solid network to help me reach a substantial amount of people throughout the world. I've released multiple projects so far and have experienced what great marketing can do, as well as the unfortunate results of poor marketing. Each project I've released in the past has had their own budgets, with their own marketing plans. (After all, this is a business).
               After years of funding every project with performance revenue, saved royalties,  and profits from selling merchandise I have always told myself that I would never ask anybody to fund 100% of my project. As time has passed, and the more marketing research for each project completed, I asked myself "What if I only ask for 50% of what I need?", This way I'd be able to work to contribute the other 50% myself, prove to my supporters that I'm reliable, at the same time as developing a stronger support system. I've decided to launch this campaign to not only help me fund my next single but to also give my supporters a way to connect with me and my music directly through a project.                     
The Project
The single will be called "Number One", it is unlike anything I have ever created before. From the start one of my greatest influences was Richie Valens and the rock music of that decade. Moving from Hip-Hop to EDM I've always tried to incorporate that historic sound somehow, whether it be in a melody or the drums. "Number One" not only captures the musical feel I've always wanted to include in my projects, but it is the type of music that I plan to keep creating (if all goes well), it's the beginning of a long road, in which I will need as much support as I can get. 
What Is the Meaning of The Song?
This song speaks to those who have ever seen somebody somewhere and immediately thought (due to appearance, or any other characteristic) "they and I should be together". This then sparks a fantasy in this person's mind creating this perfect world with that person seen, only to find out, in reality, that person is with someone else. (In the song I play the person seen, in the fantasy perspective. I'm a little ugly, so it's a comedic role :D)
Market Potential
Already, the song has major commercial appeal, and has more potential to hit the commercial market than any other song I have written. Through my current network, and the production company that will produce the final record, this song is already planned to be shopped out immediately to outlets ranging from TV Networks to Record labels. (Please Note: Those of you who are familiar with the music industry know that production companies will not waste their time shopping out a song without potential.)
Where Will Your Money Go?
The Final Recording- I have always used my own studio (Studio Red CT) to record all preliminary recordings, as well as some of the final mixes. Due to the love I have for this song and for it's potential, I wanted to make sure I use all the necessary tools possible to produce the best product. I signed a production deal from a studio in New York. I've wanted to record at this studio for a very long time, due to the expertise of those behind it, as well as the top of the line equipment used. Due to current contract litigation's, I am not allowed to publicly announce the name of the studio, but I will give supporters all the details personally once donations have been made. This session will range from ($1,000-$5,000) depending on the duration,what will be added to the song, and for paying the producer and engineer fairly. (Seeing as the maximum range is more than what i'm asking supporters for, I will personally be paying for whatever additional expenses arise such as travel, hospitality, etc.)
The Music Video- I've been wanting to record a music video ever since I wrote my first song! (Keep in mind, every time I write a song, I'm picturing the music video in my head as I write it.) The video for "Number One" already has a location in New York City, and has a set date to shoot. All I'm relying on my supporters for here is the videographer's payment ranging from $500-$1,500 depending on the amount of editing, time it takes to shoot, and how many additional employees are needed on set. (I will personally be paying for the space to rent.)
Marketing- Once the product is ready to distribute my marketing plan will take action. This will cover anything from booking shows, social media ads and promos, to printed press. The category of marketing is so extensive that the options could literally go on forever, Once the project is released, this becomes my life on a day to day basis, doing whatever I can to follow the plan and beyond to get the song heard by as many people as possible. I've set my rough marketing  budget to $2,000 but as I said above it's a very extensive category and can go on forever (meaning as much support as possible will be needed.)
I'm looking for as much support as possible to get "Number One" heard by the most people, and to take it as far as it can possibly go.  If you're reading this, I'm really counting on you, and everyone you know. The financial figures above very briefly demonstrate what goes into each category which is why I'm only asking my supporters to contribute what they can. 
If you are a supporter who can't afford a $10 contribution, then please tell 10 people about this, and let me know if you are as excited as I am to hear Number One.

story:
My name is Nouse and I've been making music my whole life. I've been writing songs for about 10 years and I'm finally in an environment where I can achieve my musical goals. I've been working on this album for about two years, overcoming many personal obstacles in the way. These obstacles are the main focus of the album and I can't wait to share this story with you.

Contributions will go toward turning this project from a dream into a reality. I want you, the listener, to hear it the way its meant to be heard, but this costs money! Funds will go towards production, mixing and mastering, paying studio musicians, videography, promotion, and distribution. I believe this album to be something people should hear, something you can relate to, but first, I need to get it to your ears! Promotion is equally as important and the quality of sound!

The perks are given at certain levels of donation and each perk includes the items received in previous perks (i.e. the last perk includes every item offered). I'm very happy to give out these perks, because I'm so grateful for any donations. I really want you to hear this album but I can't release it without your help! 

If you can't contribute or want to want to help out in other ways, please share this campaign with your friends. You can share on Indiegogo and your social media pages. Anything and everything helps!

Thank you all for visiting my page and contributing. I hope you all enjoy this album when it comes out!

story:
Short Summary

It's (relatively) easy to record music from home. All you need is a 1 or 2 channel interface (many people use a Focusrite Scarlett) and a guitar and/or halfway decent mic. My band Jean Shorts Jesus has an EP called Safe to Sleep, which was recorded entirely in our singer's bedroom. However, because we did not have access to drumset recording equipment, he had to use programmed MIDI drums, which are... less than ideal. As a music production major at my university, I have at best limited (3 hours a week ish, including setup and takedown) access to drumset recording equipment in the school studio, and everyone who is not a production major has at best no access. What people need is a convenient, accessible service to record drums for their musical projects. With this equipment, I can provide that service. It will also enable me to propel my own projects and bands forward (see below).

My dream is to make music for a living. I've been playing drums since the 7th grade, and I will continue to do so well after I die. Currently, I play in the OSU Jazz Band, the OSU drum line, Rhythm and Beavs (the OSU traveling athletics band), the OSU Wind Ensemble (as a concert percussionist), and several non-OSU bands like Jean Shorts Jesus (bandcamp), a jazz-influenced indie punk group, and Church Ladies, a funk/RnB/Soul group.

What You Get

First and foremost, you as a user of the internet, regardless of whether you donate, will have access to all of the music I publish, because that's the way the music industry works now. The amount and quality of music I am able to publish is dependent on the success of this campaign.

The primary service I will be offering is simply this: you send me your track, with or without scratch drums, and I will record and send you back a quality recording of drums. I have a fair bit of experience recording drums, but I still have a lot to learn, and this will allow me to expand and develop my skill set. Depending on your preference, I can mix the drums myself and send you back a single stereo track, or I can send you each individual instrument track so that you can mix it or sample it as you desire. As a drummer with around 8 years of experience, I can (if desired) add extra flairs, fills, and frills to give your track that tasty edge.

I also offer drumset lessons (all ages and experience levels).

BONUS: the OSU drumline is phasing out some of their old equipment, some of which I will buy as soon as it becomes available. If you've never listened to marching percussion before, give this a listen. As soon as I get a hold of that equipment, that is yet another flavor of percussive instrument which I will be able to offer.

What I Need

The list of what I need to make this happen is surprisingly short:

  • Mixer/audio interface. My eye currently is on the Allen and Heath ZED-24. This has more channels than I need for just recording my current drumset, but I want to leave room for growth in case I expand my kit or want to be able to record a full studio session.
  • Nice set of drum mics. The Shure PGA 7 ($500) is the mic kit you hear in the song overlaying my campaign video that the school studio owns. This is a solid all-purpose entry level mic kit. I would like to also buy a couple SM57s ($120 when bundled with a mic stand and cable) for auxiliary miking.
  • Set of 3 mic stands ($135) and one bass drum mic stand. If I got those SM57s bundled these wouldn't be extra.
  • Supplies to acoustically treat my basement. I will be DIYing everything to minimize cost, but my estimate to build 3 or 4 bass traps, thick foam or carpet to cover walls, and a couple baffles is $200.
  • Anything extra will probably go to getting some better drum heads (my current ones are pretty old)

All told, this comes out to roughly $2000.

The Bottom Line

Music is basically free now. As consumers, we have the choice to support musicians and artists financially so that they can keep doing what they love. Every piece of music that I record will be publicly accessible via the wonderful thing we call the internet, regardless of whether you, the listener, pays for it or not. By contributing to this campaign you are directly supporting my musical career and enabling me to give you content. With a home studio the amount of music I will be able to create and publish is unparalleled.

Risks & Challenges

The house in which I currently live is not conducive to the realization of this project, which is part of the reason that I'm so excited to move at the beginning of summer 2019. My new house will have a sizeable unfinished basement which will be my new studio's home. I will have my work cut out for me to soundproof and acoustically treat the space.

There is no chance this equipment will go to waste, unless I die or suffer some hypertraumatic injury which prevents me from playing drums ever again. I have ideas out the wazoo for what I want to accomplish with this, so even if I don't have clients who need drums recorded year-round, I will still be using it for my own bands and projects.

I am still a full-time student. Ideally this project will come to fruition at the beginning of Summer 2019 when I won't have to deal with school, but during the school year I may have less time to devote to it.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you know of aspiring artists in any genre who could use recorded drums, please send them my way! At this point, the sky is the limit for what I'm able to record.

story:
Who are you?

My name is Bart and I'm a 20-year-old music producer under the alias バート!
I make music since 2016 with moderate success as I do make sales but not enough that would let me pursue music full time!
My biggest musical accomplishment is having one of my songs "In Your Arms" featured on the BBC Radio in 2017! 

The goal of this campaign is literally a life-changer for me.
I would like to fund my upcoming album "Fragmentation" however this time it would be completely different as I'd be able to completely focus on the album and not on "oh sh*t am I going to starve?"
On top of that, it would let me run a real advertising campaign, and not just sending it to the family on Facebook or begging my friends to give it a like.

If you help me with this campaign, you will literally change my life forever and I will never be thankful enough <3

 

So what are you planning to do with my money?

I'll tell you exactly what I'm planning to do.

  • It will help me pay bills so that I can stay home and actually dedicate the whole day to music rather than 2-3 hours.
  • I will be finally able to run a real ad campaign with things such as posters, videos and most importantly online.
  • Making merch, which includes CD's, vinyl's and t-shirts.
  • Higher quality VST's (plugins for music production software which essentially lets you make specific sounds, kinda like digital instruments).
  • Publishing on more platforms such as Spotify, Apple Music, Google Music, Deezer etc.

Have you ever done this before?

Yes, I have!  (although with no real funds)
I constantly release new music and generally, people are very happy with it, that is how I maintain a steady income from music.
So far my most successful release is an album from 2018 "Neon Escape" as it made the most sales and over 1,000 plays in a single day!

The goal of the campaign is for me to be able to reach a level where I can make music for a living!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest and most obvious risk is "what if you get the funding, but it still doesn't make you be able to earn a living from music?"
 

Its true, I might never be able to make a living from music however that is a risk for me rather than for you.
If I get funded, that means that you bought a product from me (depending on the tier) and no matter what I will deliver it whether I become a full-time producer or not

I want to help, but I can't afford to help financially

Don't worry, I completely understand!
If you'd like to help me out in other ways, you can tell your friends and family about this campaign! Or you can find me on Instagram and just send a nice message, those always brighten up my day :)

story:
Short Summary

We are a group of female artists from New York University looking for funding to create a music video for the song "Glorious" by Olivia Royal.  

“Glorious” is a song performed, written and produced by Clive Davis graduate Olivia Royal. It will be directed by Tisch Film graduate Emily Feng. This video highlights the feminine power within every woman and loosely retells the story of Adam and Eve through a feminist lens. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need funding to help cover basic production costs like 

  • Locations 
  • Equipment rental
  • Costumes 
  • Lighting
  • Transportation
  • Set design

You’ll get the opportunity to support art by a group of talented young women and receive a credit in the video with your donation.

The Impact

In industries where most of the roles are occupied by men we are asserting our creative vision and defying expectations. By supporting this project you’ll be supporting young, female artists embarking on their careers. Each of the members on our team are actively challenging old paradigms about women’s roles in media by calling the shots both on screen and behind the scenes. 

Risks & Challenges

As our team is made up of college students and recent graduates we are all working to find our footing as artists. After searching for funding through school and scholarships and coming up short, we decided not to simply accept the notion of Do It Yourself but to choose to Do It Together. Art is a collaboration and we're inviting you to collaborate with us on the project. This video will be an exciting journey for our whole team and we want to create something that sparks that same kind of excitement in you. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate we would love if you would share this campaign and follow us to keep an eye out for upcoming projects by Olivia Royal, Emily Feng, Brittany Santiago, and Ana Fangayen.

Olivia's Insta: https://www.instagram.com/oliviaroyal.art/

Emily's Insta: https://www.instagram.com/emilyemoly98/

Brittany's Insta: https://www.instagram.com/brittany.h.santiago/

Ana's Insta: https://www.instagram.com/anafangayen/

 

Thank you for all your support!

Olivia, Emily, Brittany, and Ana

story:
We are The Stargazer Lilies.


By joining us in this pre-sale… not only will you be getting well crafted, limited run TSL collectibles… but you will also be helping to support what we hope to be another healthy year of TSL on the road and you will be helping us pave the way to what we hope to be a long career as The Stargazer Lilies. Thank you for your support!

We are offering merch at different price points. The money generated from this sale will go directly to the manufacturing and promotion of the merchandise below:  

* Newly mastered 12" vinyl LP, CD & Cassette which will include songs Fukitol, Ahhh, Bonnie & Clyde and Sunday is Monday.

+ TSL "Lost" tees

+ TSL packages! 

+ MORE!

Any extra funds will go directly to help support our future touring expenses. We have plans for more U.S. + overseas touring in the coming year! We are also in the midst of recording album #3. Extra funds will help us finish that album as well.

If you just can't donate money but want to help us… you can help us spread the word about this pre-sale… help us by sharing our videos, share our tour schedules! Come out and see us live! 

XOXO TSL



Visit our website for all things TSL and get our tour dates here:
http://www.thestargazerlilies.com

Visit our Facebook page here:

https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Stargazer-Lilies/161756103866261

Visit our Instagram here:

https://www.instagram.com/thestargazerlilies/

Watch our "Fukitol" video here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mo_n_XqfFW4

Watch our "Bonnie & Clyde" video here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EqMg2fUwlGE

Watch an un-official "Ahhh" video here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZsgBos9vihg

Watch a live "Sunday is Monday" video here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FURetwYm9Hg
story_txt:
We are The Stargazer Lilies.
By joining us in this pre-sale… not only will you be getting well crafted, limited run TSL collectibles… but you will also be helping to support what we hope to be another healthy year of TSL on the road and you will be helping us pave the way to what we hope to be a long career as The Stargazer Lilies. Thank you for your support!


We are offering merch at different price points. The money generated from this sale will go directly to the manufacturing and promotion of the merchandise below:  

* Newly mastered 12" vinyl LP, CD & Cassette which will include songs Fukitol, Ahhh, Bonnie & Clyde and Sunday is Monday.+ TSL "Lost" tees+ TSL packages! + MORE!Any extra funds will go directly to help support our future touring expenses. We have plans for more U.S. + overseas touring in the coming year! We are also in the midst of recording album #3. Extra funds will help us finish that album as well.
If you just can't donate money but want to help us… you can help us spread the word about this pre-sale… help us by sharing our videos, share our tour schedules! Come out and see us live! 

XOXO TSLVisit our website for all things TSL and get our tour dates here:
http://www.thestargazerlilies.com
Visit our Facebook page here:https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Stargazer-Lilies/161756103866261Visit our Instagram here:https://www.instagram.com/thestargazerlilies/Watch our "Fukitol" video here:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mo_n_XqfFW4Watch our "Bonnie & Clyde" video here:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EqMg2fUwlGEWatch an un-official "Ahhh" video here:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZsgBos9vihgWatch a live "Sunday is Monday" video here:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FURetwYm9Hg

story:
My name is Michelle and I've been singing in choirs and coffee houses my entire life. I have always been extremely passionate about my music and motivated to share it with others.  In 2008 I lost my mom to brain cancer and in 2009 I had a beautiful baby boy named Noah.  Those events caused my passion and motivation to grow even more. Although it seems like yesterday, she's been gone 7 years and my son is now 5 and they both inspire me beyond words each and every day. 

I managed to scrape enough money together to produce an EP several years ago, and while  I am proud of "Until Tomorrow" and the people it reached and continues to reach I feel that God has called me to say more through song.  Now I'm a single mother of a 5-year-old and I don't have the funds to go any further without help.  

That's where you come in.  I have the opportunity to go to Nashville to work with Ed Cash.  (Edcash.com)  The session will cost $4000 for the music and lyrics, mixing, mastering and completed single. Ed and his brother Scott have produced albums for some of the most successful Christian artists- among them Chris Tomlin, Brandon Heath, and Chris August.  It would be truly a career highlight to be able to work with them.  I will pay for my own travel and lodging.  

Even if you can only afford to donate $10 to the cause, it will mean so much to me and, hopefully, to others I will be able to touch through my music.   Thanks so much for your consideration.

To hear some of my previous work feel free to visit www.michellerubenmusic.com and www.reverbnation.com/michelleruben

story:
These are the 3 things you need to know:

1. Dead Berlin is a band from Argentina who has an opportunity to travel to the United States this Spring to share their music!

2. They will journey from East Coast to West Coast, New York to San Francisco, in a van with performing songwriter Emily Kate Boyd.

3. They need your support to make this happen and have only 30 days to raise the money for food and travel.——————————————————————————————————————————-

Hay 3 cosas que necesitan saber:

1. Dead Berlin es una banda de Argentina que tiene la oportunidad de viajar a Estados Unidos esta primavera para compartir su musica.

2. Ellos viajaran desde la Costa Este, hasta la Costa Oeste, Nueva York hasta San Francisco, en una camioneta tocando en vivo junto a la cantaautora Emily Kate Boyd.

3. Necesitan tu apoyo para lograr que esto suceda, solo les quedan 30 dias para juntar donaciones destinadas a alimentos y viajes.

story:
Hi friends,
This is a 2 week fundraiser to help raise funds toward the cost of mastering and promotion of my new album 'Aftermath'. I'm nearly finished with mixing so by the time this campaign comes to an end, the songs will be ready for mastering.

'Aftermath' consists of 10 songs. In my opinion, this is the most moving and powerful collection of songs I've ever done. I've worked extremely hard on it all.

If you would like to pledge, it is appreciated so very much. I have a few perks to choose from for your pledge. Thank you for taking a look and considering. Big hugs and love.
Matt

story:
ROCK AND ELECTRO

We are Raw Black Diamonds, and we love rock and electro music. 
Rock and Electro are very similar: they share the same energy, they are strong and powerful.
What we love about music is the fact that brings people together no matter where they come from, who they are, and this is the essence of Raw Black Diamonds: brings people together in only one energy.

Michael and I worked on a plenty musical project in the past in France. We first collaborated in 2003 on a project called Stop à l'affront it was an album against racism in France, then we work together since, we did my solo album G ne Pa le tan. We also did some shows together in Paris and the Caribbean. We decided to create this band Raw Black Diamonds at the beginning of 2018 and put together all our influences into it such as rock electro hip-hop etc.

Right Now Michael and I are in the studio working on the first single Terrible Mistake (you can hear it on our presentation's video) and also the music video. We know precisely, what we want for the music video, we've been writing down some ideas each day since the beginning of this crazy adventure. Michael already worked on the script of the music video, and I've been working on four songs, there's two more to get to the finish line.

The release of Raw Black Diamonds' EP is on May 19th, 2019 and we would like to release the first single Terrible Mistake and the music video in January 2019, by contributing to this project, you will help us bring out vibrant and positive energy to this crazy world. 

What Raw Black Diamonds Needs & What You Get

For our project, we will need your support for the mix and mastering of the EP and the music video a good camera with the accessories for the shooting, and studio session for post-production. 

Here below more details about what we need:

  • The mix and the mastering of the songs required a studio located in Paris with analog mixing table plus a sound engineer.
  • We need a camera and accessories for the shooting that can help us have a great and nice music video,
  • Studio sessions (music and video)
  • Engineers (for the mix, mastering and post video production,)
  • a  makeup artist, 
  • a hairdresser,  
  • a stylist 
  • an assistant (video shooting)

To support our project you got different perks, such as t-shirt headphone, etc. But guys, if you want to take part in the album and music video pick the perk STAR PACK this is the one you got to contribute to. You wonder why right! You'll star in our music video and be an associate producer on the album. Yeah, that's right! You'll also get a digital download, signed cd, your name printed on the album, Raw Black Diamonds t-shirt, armband phone, Raw Black Diamonds headphone, Bluetooth earphone, 180 gr black vinyl, an associate producer credit.

In the case we didn't reach our entire goal, the funds will finance the single Terrible Mistake.

So, guys, we need your support and your energy to accomplish this marvelous project.

The Impact

Your contribution will make a tremendous difference in our campaign, cause we really believe that there is room for our project on the musical market. 
Make people believe that there is a band called Raw Black Diamonds which is all about music and only music, and our energy could actually help others to face any challenges in life.

To give you an idea of rock and electro song, this is what I did with a DJ called Laurent Wolf in 2004, click on the following link:https://tatianamiath.com/blog/2018/05/02/dj-laurent-wolf-rock-machine-feat-tatiana-miath/.

Risks & Challenges

Michael and I we have a lot of years of experience in music and video production, about 20 years now.

We know for sure that, the main problem can cause a delay in a project is not having enough money to achieve it.

  • On a previous project, we didn't have our own recording studio, and we had to deal with scheduling studio session, with a sound engineer who couldn't make it and we had to replace him. What we learned about this situation it's we had to have our recording studio.

The way we handle our next project was so easy and smooth, we bought all the equipment to build our recording studio and that my friends make the budget go down down down.

  • The next step is the most critical. 
    This phase included other people like makeup artist hairdresser a video assistant etc. And we know if we don't have enough money we will not be able to complete our project. 

Michael and I we already worked on a music and video production, and we made it through the end, so today to lower the budgetary cost, we decided to acquire some equipment. Fortunately, Michael is a good cameraman and also a great photographer so, these parts are covered along with the recording.

If we have the camera with the equipment, We shall need neither a photographer nor a cameraman to shoot the video and made the cover album.

Share Our Project to help us

You can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!!!

Yes!! You can help us by sharing our campaign on social media to your followers and friends, make some noise and spread this vibrant energy that music can give you.

It's simple you just need to use the Indiegogo share tools. (top on the right)

story:
When I decided to give acting a shot 12 years ago, I signed up with Central Casting and forthwith began landing gigs as an extra on movie and TV sets both at studios and on location all over the Metropolitan Los Angeles area. For the next two years, until the recession hit, I took full advantage of this access to closely observe work-a-day and acclaimed directors (e.g., Ron Howard) and actors (e.g., Patricia Arquette) practice their respective crafts. While this experience served as my invaluable seat-of-the-pants apprenticeship in the Hollywood film industry, I eventually decided that my ambitions would be better served by directly transitioning to the role of independent filmmaker. Adventitiously, about that same time, I witnessed Evan Rachel Wood's performance in Across the Universe, and was instantaneously inspired to develop a musical miniseries that, among other feats, would showcase her remarkable talents, both as actor and vocalist. 

By the time I turned the page on my career as a background performer, I was harboring an assortment of beefs about the way the film industry conventionally operates; I felt then as I do now that

1) it is by-and-large male-dominated, all too often to caustic or ham-fisted effect
2) considered as a makeshift social construct, it tends to be overly hierarchical  
3) original concepts are in short supply
4) insularity constrains and compromises verisimilitude 

With these objections in mind, I've adopted specific remedies to be implemented in
the filming of my envisioned miniseries:

1) it will be unabashedly, rhapsodically female-centric
2) egalitarianism and genuine collaboration shall hold sway; actors will liberally improvise dialogue, and cull epiphanies and dreamscapes from their own experience to enrich the proceedings; in the credits, the designation "director" will be replaced by the term "facilitator"
3) expect the unprecedented; here's a hint as to what's in store:

empty
venue
anvils
novel
 
ruminations;
alchemical
coeds
hangar
elation
locomotives;
 
waters:
overwhelming
obstacle?
detoxifier?

here's another hint:

entreated
verbs,
adjectives,
nouns
 
repeal
ambulatory
clauses,
hoist
echolocators'
loopadoopery
 
warp-driving
our
oceanic
dissensions.

4) in addition to young actors, I will be casting non-actors, including actual students, to portray college students in the miniseries. 

With the funds raised from this campaign, the first order of business will be to secure the participation of the three performers I have earmarked to star in both the music video and musical miniseries: Evan Rachel Wood, Courtney Galiano, and Mollie Grey. Courtney and Mollie were both top ten contestants on So You Think You Can Dance. Evan Rachel Wood is currently starring in season 2 of the futuristic HBO miniseries, Westworld. 

I have also slated a number of other accomplished performers to appear in crucial supporting roles (albeit limited in scope) in the musical miniseries: Josh Hutcherson, Fik-shun, Keisha Castle-Hughes, Diane Lane, Alexandra Daddario, LIsa Jakub, Tyce Diorio, Brit Marling, Felicity Jones, Rose McGowan, Matt Damon, Mandy Potinkin, Keegan-Michael Key, Sam Claflin, Jena Malone, Jordan Peele, Jackie Evancho (as herself), Jewel (as herself), Ellen Page (as herself), Mark Harris (as himself, and then some). Almost all of these parts were designed with these performers specifically in mind. 

Once I get commitments from Evan Rachel Wood, Courtney Galiano and Mollie Grey to appear in the music video, we will together launch another campaign to procure funding for this project (current estimate $20,000 - $35,000). Any funds in excess of the amount that it takes to procure the participation of ERW, CG, and MG will be applied to the financing of the music video shoot.

Any funds in excess of the amount that it takes to procure the participation of ERW, CG, and MG will be applied to the financing of the music video shoot.

story:
Welcome

"Sounds Great!" ~ BILLY JOEL, NYC, Bitter End, 2013
 
Sarah Siddiqui aka Beautiful Chemistry is an established singer songwriter, and producer of modern indie folk rock music. She's from Toronto, Canada. She released her new third album , No more Waiting Rooms through her record label Red Winter Records. It was funded by the Toronto Arts Council and IndieGoGo. 
 

She wrote and produced the album. Full album credits are on her website. She is also a special skills musical actor on the side. She was cast for a guitarist role by Danny DeVito for the feature film Death to Smoochy, starring Robin Williams. She has played live with Billy Joel present in 2013, NYC, Bitter End. Her songs are placed in feature films as well.  At on the age of 18 she gained an artist development deal with EMI Publishing Canada. Music has always been her life. More details can be found on her website.  www.sarahsiddiqui.ca 

This campaign is about helping Sarah share her music to listeners across eastern Canada as well as the UK. 

But it's more than playing live and touring, it's about putting music with a real message on the map and making the tour count.  Sarah's album takes listeners on a deep emotional journey relative to mental health, the soul, love and loss.

What She Needs & What You Get

The goal of raising $6500 would mean night and day!

The gigs are getting booked but the overhead of costs of the tour in Canada & Europe such as travel/ food/ accommodations add up for an indie artist.   

You'll get cool merch... signed post cards, mouse pads, t-shirts, CD's, pens, note pads and coffee mugs... all with Sarah's CD Cover printed on it and signed where possible. The merch will be shipped to you anywhere in the world.

What This Will Mean

Indie GoGo donors helped finish this record so Sarah truly can't wait to share this product of which this platform had a hand in creating. The funds will mean that she can full focus on performing great live shows, while promoting the album effectively.

Please share the link with your friends...

story:
Short Summary

Hi we are, Attack the Sound, an Alternative Rock/Pop from Chicago, IL. Founded in 2009, we have performed in local shows throughout our city, small tours outside our city and even released a few singles. Through our hard work and consistency are music has been able to reach beyond our city and even our country with our latest single "LOVE IS WAR" bringing in over 39,000 views (and counting) to our music video and even winning us a BEST OF THE MIDWEST 2020 AWARD for Best Cinematography this past January!

Now, we feel it's time to really push our talents and create an Extended Play of our music.

We have partnered with Grammy Award Winning and legendary producer and instrumentalistI Isaiah Sharkey to assist us in our latest production for our upcoming EP expected to release FALL 2021.

Due to the pandemic, we have not been able to perform local shows like we normally would which is usually a way we raise funds to support our recording, marketing and merchandise production cost.

What We Need & What You Get

This is where your help comes in. We want to bring the BEST possible project for you to enjoy and it takes funding. With your support, you will be helping us cover the cost of the following 

  • Studio time
  • Recording
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Marketing

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Recording a project like this require a lot of detail and attention that we as a band have never experienced. Teaming up with Isaiah Sharkey is not cheap, but to it allow us the oversight of someone who knows what it takes to make a hit record. As we walk through Narwhal studio you can see lining the walls all the hit records by the best names in music and it makes you excited to work there. Paul and Slavic are in top form for mixing and mastering.
  • The perks we have put together is based on our rebrand and new merch. You will be amongst the first to receive it and wear is as a badge of honor as a member of the Sound Squad.
  • If we can't reach out goal, all proceeds will still go toward the project as we continue to find other ways to accomplish paying for the album

Risks & Challenges

Because of COVID, we have to be very strategic in how we record. Because are band consist of 8 members, plus management, recording and filming staff, spaces can get crowded which means we have to spread out how many people are allowed in the studio at a time. 

Because of this it requires:

  • More studio hours to ensure enough recording time and mixing
  • Cleaning supplies to ensure equipment had been properly cleaned in-between sessions

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to support the band, but times are rough at the moment? We understand. If you can't donate, we ask if you could share this campaign for us to at least FIVE people you know who can. And that's all there is to it!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hi we are, Attack the Sound, an Alternative Rock/Pop from Chicago, IL. Founded in 2009, we have performed in local shows throughout our city, small tours outside our city and even released a few singles. Through our hard work and consistency are music has been able to reach beyond our city and even our country with our latest single "LOVE IS WAR" bringing in over 39,000 views (and counting) to our music video and even winning us a BEST OF THE MIDWEST 2020 AWARD for Best Cinematography this past January!
Now, we feel it's time to really push our talents and create an Extended Play of our music.
We have partnered with Grammy Award Winning and legendary producer and instrumentalistI Isaiah Sharkey to assist us in our latest production for our upcoming EP expected to release FALL 2021.
Due to the pandemic, we have not been able to perform local shows like we normally would which is usually a way we raise funds to support our recording, marketing and merchandise production cost.
What We Need & What You Get
This is where your help comes in. We want to bring the BEST possible project for you to enjoy and it takes funding. With your support, you will be helping us cover the cost of the following 

Studio time
Recording
Mixing
Mastering
Marketing


Break it down for folks in more detail:

Recording a project like this require a lot of detail and attention that we as a band have never experienced. Teaming up with Isaiah Sharkey is not cheap, but to it allow us the oversight of someone who knows what it takes to make a hit record. As we walk through Narwhal studio you can see lining the walls all the hit records by the best names in music and it makes you excited to work there. Paul and Slavic are in top form for mixing and mastering.
The perks we have put together is based on our rebrand and new merch. You will be amongst the first to receive it and wear is as a badge of honor as a member of the Sound Squad.
If we can't reach out goal, all proceeds will still go toward the project as we continue to find other ways to accomplish paying for the album


Risks & Challenges
Because of COVID, we have to be very strategic in how we record. Because are band consist of 8 members, plus management, recording and filming staff, spaces can get crowded which means we have to spread out how many people are allowed in the studio at a time. 
Because of this it requires:

More studio hours to ensure enough recording time and mixing
Cleaning supplies to ensure equipment had been properly cleaned in-between sessions

Other Ways You Can Help
Want to support the band, but times are rough at the moment? We understand. If you can't donate, we ask if you could share this campaign for us to at least FIVE people you know who can. And that's all there is to it!

story:
Short Summary

I'm México72, an electronic music producer from the South of Mexico, from a city called Oaxaca. I've started this project in 2011 with the purpose of experimenting with sound and Latin American music.

In 2014, my first CD "Tornameda Latina" came out as one of the first electronic albums from the South of Mexico and now I'm almost finishing the  material for my second CD which will be called "Negro Santo". 

----

Soy México72, un productor de música electrónica del Sur de México, de la ciudad de Oaxaca. Empecé este proyecto en el 2011 con el propósito de experimentar con el sonido y con la música latinoamericana.

En el 2014, salió mi primer disco "Tornamesa Latina" como el primer álbum de música electrónica del Sur de México y ahora estoy terminando mi segundo material discográfico de nombre "Negro Santo".

What We Need & What You Get

I need your monetary support to release my new CD. The founds will be used as follows:

- Design of cover and CD: US $2000

- Assembling of 1000 CDs: US $1700

- Perks for campaign: US $3000

And I'll use the rest of the raises to invest in a new music video for the CD.

In return of your support I'll give you my special México72 gifts and also my new CD "Negro Santo".

----

Necesito ayuda monetaria para sacar mi nuevo disco. Los fondos se usarán para lo siguiente:

- Diseño de la portada y el disco: US $2000

- Maquila de 1000 CDs: US $1700

- Regalos para la campaña: US $3000

El resto de lo que gane lo invirtiré en un nuevo videoclip.

A cambio de su ayuda voy a dar diferentes regalos y el resultado de mi trabajo.

The Impact

This project is important for me and also for all my fellow musicians from Oaxaca. Our work and our state has always been overlooked in Mexico in many things, including the independent artistic production, while we have so much culture and so many talented people. I'd like to show to the world that there are many valuable creators here and that we have a great culture. By this means, I want to encourage music production in my town. 

Last year, my track "Dandy Sonidero" was the first New Latin Cumbia or Electronic Latin Music video from the south of Mexico and now my goal is to keep progressing in my production in general.

-----

Este proyecto es importante para mi y también para todos los demás músicos de Oaxaca, ya que nuestro trabajo y nuestro estado siempre han sido desplazados del país en muchas cosas, incluyendo la actividad artística independiente, mientras que aquí tenemos tanta cultura y tanta gente con talento. Quiero mostrarles a todos que existen creadores valiosos en este punto geográfico y que contamos con una gran cultura y así estimular la producción musical en mi ciudad.

El año pasado, "Dandy Sonidero" de México72 fue el primer videoclip de música electrónica (Nu Latin) del sur de México y ahora mi meta es seguir mejorando la calidad de la producción en general.

Risks & Challenges

The major risk of not achieving my goal is not being able to release a material that I have been working on very hard for the past two years. None the least, I believe that this campaign will make my project known for a bigger audience.

----

El mayor riesgo de no alcanzar mi objetivo en esta campaña es no poder sacar a la luz el producto de mi trabajo de dos años. Aún así, creo que esta campaña es importante para dar a conocer mi proyecto a un público más amplio y variado. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that for some people it may be heart to contribute monetarily, but at least I'd be very thankful if you share this cause through social media. 

I also invite you to follow my work on facebook, instagram and souncloud where you'll able to see my progress and hear my music. 

----

Entiendo que para mucha gente puede llegar a ser difícil contribuir con dinero, pero estaré eternamente grato si me ayudaran a compartir mi causa a través de las redes sociales.

También los invito a seguir mi trabajo por facebook, instagram y soundcloud, en donde podrán ver mi progreso y escuchar mi música.

story:
Hey guys it's Tyra Sanchez, winner of RuPaul's Drag Race and I'm creating my first visual album! The album includes club bangers, deep cuts and inside look into my life as a drag superstar. The music provides motivation for it's listeners with insight on how to overcome haters, relationships and self doubt. The visual album contains adult situations and explicit lyrics. It is intended for a mature audience in nature.

 

THE SUMMER TURN UP IS REAL

 

PARENTAL ADVISORY EXPLICIT CONTENT

The album is not to be underestimated. The visual album contains explicit lyrics not suitable for children. The album is intended for those with a mature mind.

 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR CONTINUED ENCOURAGEMENT! YOUR SUPPORT IS TRULY APPRECIATED!

story:
"It's not that you want to sing, it's that you HAVE to sing" -  my mentor, the Jazz & Blues vocalist Joe Williams

To  quote a famous comedian, "I started out as a child" - a professional child performer, that is. My performing career got sidetracked by 27 years in the U. S. Army (starting with the Vietnam War and ending with the Gulf War), but since retiring, I have returned to performing. I have traveled and entertained in the Boston/Cambridge area where I live, in New York City, all over the United States and in Europe.

Friends and fans everywhere I have performed have been encouraging me to make what I hope will be the first of many music CDs, After consulting with many of my friends who are musicians who have recorded and based on their experiences, it seems that $25,000 is what it would cost to record the music CD (paying the  musicians, paying for the recording rights, paying for a sound engineer, paying for time at a recording studio, etc.). Frankly, I do not have $25,000 extra in my bank account (heck, I'm a retired Army Sergeant on a pension!).

I'm not asking your financial help for living expenses (like I said, I have my pension) but rather for the opportunity to record and share my music. All the songs that will go on this first music CD (I hope there will be more CDs in the future) will be songs that have been written or co-written by friends, past and present.

For more YouTube videos of my singing (and of several songs that hopefully will be on the CD), check out https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCGjucoLhb3fAbI... and https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC1NtlQqLQETes1... -  my two YouTube channels.

story:
With just 2 weeks left to the deadline, and as the campaign didn't generate enough interest, I proceeded to refund everyone who chose to support us.
Refunds were issued based on the payment method used to make the contribution, and may take three to five business days to process.

To the one who supported this campaign, thank you! I really appreciate it!

I will now move to Plan C, this means that I will be contacting labels to release the new work.
If I don't succeed with Plan C then it means this work will only see daylight through digital services like Spotify,iTunes, bandcamp and so on.

I will keep you all updated.

Doom on!
Miguel


-----------///-----------



Just a few months after releasing A Waltz for Apophenia, A Dream of Poe is recording a new album at the SPS Studios.

Officially, the writing process for this new album started in September 2016. At that time, I had no intention of continuing with the writing process as I was focused on preparing the band for the live shows in Bucharest and Edinburgh.

Once the live shows were out of the way, I just wanted to relax and not think about music. That didn’t last long as I started to come up with new riffs and decided to record them for a possible use at a later date.

Unfortunately, or fortunately, I started to get very excited with the new riffs. They rapidly developed from simple riffs to full songs. Some of the new tracks have been written on the piano, so it's like going back to my roots.

This new album will contain six songs. Five are already completed, with the majority of the instrumental recorded. The last song is being written by Kaivan Saraei.

For the first time since 2006, we will be using Edgar Allan Poe poems. The poems we chose are “Spirits of the Dead” and “Fairy Land”. Paulo Pacheco, as usual, is in charge of writing the lyrics for the other songs. Kaivan will once again be in charge of writing and record the vocal melodies whilst I’m writing and recording the growls.

I want this album to be a special one. To achieved that, I need to have total control over its format, release date, and so on. This costs a significant amount of money, which is impossible for me to fund in its entirety.

My intention is to have the new album released by the end of 2017 or the first months of 2018!

 

So here is my proposal:
Help me release this new album and reach even more people by crowdfunding it!

By donating £10 you will help us with the design, manufacturing and promotional costs. Our target is £1500, so all we need is 150 people to back us up. I would like to think of it like if it was a pre-order.

In return, you will get a signed copy of the album and you will also have your name on the booklet!


What happens if we don't reach the target?

If we don't reach our target it will still be released, the format and the way it will be released will depend on how much money is raised.
If it reaches values of around £1000 then it is still a go, if less than that, I'll consider what has been raised and see if it is still possible to have a quality product out. In case it is not, then thanks to a feature on indiegogo, and before the campain comes to an end on the 13th July, I will be performing the refunds to everyone who supported us on this campain. 

In that last case scenario, the album would then be released by a label (if any shows an interest) or digitally only on bandcamp, Spotify, iTunes and so on.

 

I hope you have enjoyed this small preview of the new songs and I’ll be very grateful to have your support for this new release!

Doom on!

story:
Camerata Panamá

La aparición de la Camerata Panamá en la escena musical panameña, ha marcado un hito en la vida cultural de la ciudad, confirmando el crecimiento musical del país. Conformada por músicos panameños y extranjeros, Camerata Panamá se dedica al estudio y difusión del repertorio para conjunto de cuerdas, desde el barroco, hasta el siglo XXI.

Estamos recaudando fondos para la realización de 3 conciertos, como inicio de nuestra temporada 2019. Estos conciertos nos permitirán difundir la música de del barroco hasta el siglo XXI, en los cuales tendremos como solistas a artistas panameños e internacionales.

Esperamos alcanzar un público de 1200 personas aproximadamente, sumando los tres conciertos.

Gracias a sus contribuciones podremos acercar más personas, especialmente jóvenes, a la música académica, bien sea como audiencia o como ejecutantes, ya que Camerata Panamá es una plataforma para jóvenes músicos, que no tienen oportunidad de tocar en orquesta.

Aqui mostramos como se distribuirán los fondos recaudados:

Afortunadamente contamos con un equipo humano completamente dedicado a hacer la mejor música posible, así como la personas que nos apoyan tras bambalinas.

Si no puedes contribuir económicamente, por favor comparte la información de nuestra campaña con otras personas, posibles donadores, para tener más posibilidades de recaudación.

story:
Hello!

My name is Vladimir and I am a pianist, composer and music improviser.

I created this campaign to raise funds for the production of a very innovative (as well as effective!) songwriting, improvising and music composition instructional program resulting from many years of testing and personal teaching experience!

=-=-=

How Is This Course Different Than A YouTube Tutorial?

=-=-=

First of all, in this course I intend to reveal the true essence of how to create original music on a piano/keyboard (and other instruments).  This course is not about learning more theory methods or technique exercises. It will be focused entirely on cultivating genuine creativity and composition ability. Furthermore, the principles revealed can also be utilized on any instrument and thus can benefit a musician of any background or discipline. (Great if you're a guitarist, but dabble on the keys for example!)

Let it be known that this course is not only meant for classical or jazz musicians. It is equally (and perhaps even more so) applicable to electronic music producers, hip-hop beatmakers, pop songwriters and other genres of any modern music (rock and etc).

Essentially, anyone who wants to create their own original melodies, songs or pieces would benefit enormously from this course!

The ultimate premise and intention with this project is to show aspiring and existing musicians alike that creating original songs and musical parts is not dependent on inherent talent or amount of theory knowledge.

Throughout the course, I will demonstrate that “musical talent” is actually available to anyone who can familiarize themselves with playing the piano/keyboard in perhaps a somewhat uncommon, yet highly intuitive and natural way.

The program will help one shape an effortless music composition approach that quickly turns idea impulses or melody fragments into completed written songs or (if you prefer) endless improvisational flows of captivating music and progressions!

There is nothing like this currently available. Quite serendipitously, the only reason I am able to share these musical insights today is due to a very unusual personal life journey and music education experience.

Check out "My Origin Story" further below for more details!

=-=-=

:: With Your Contribution You Are Creating ::

=-=-=

  • A music creativity/composition course that is incredibly simple, yet brilliantly effective. 
  • Captivating professional video production value so you feel great watching and learning!
  • Professional sound mixing and visual editing/design
  • A whole new generation of ultra-creative musicians (and original music!) empowered by the authentic techniques shared in this course.

=-=-=

:: Break Down Of Anticipated Costs ::

=-=-=

  • Studio and location rental 
  • Musical instrument rentals
  • Video production resources (camera + etc. rentals) 
  • Sound and video editing 
  • Design, visual resources and creation 
  • Publicity and marketing related resources (photography, licensing, etc.)
  • Labor and that pure “hustle muscle”
  • Time spent making mistakes and learning from them (I'm not perfect, I wish I was haha!)

=-=-=

:: How To Best Contribute :: 

=-=-=

This is actually my favorite part because in this campaign I can offer so many different options for contributing! My intention is to leave no contributing man or woman behind so please, please take advantage of the wonderful perks and rewards I am offering as part of this campaign!!

Here are my favorites...

  1. Contribute $50 and receive a 45min+ phone coaching session with me to discuss your musical/creative stuck points and ways to resolve them! If you are someone who experiences musical writer’s block, this could be the game-changer you need. (This is $75 less than my normal private lessons!)
  2. Contribute $120 and get a custom-made-for-you video lesson and piano study routine makeover that will empower your music output enormously! (Also includes a 30min+ consultation call!)
  3. Contribute $150 and get a private one-hour live masterclass from me (available both virtually or locally in New York area)
  4. Contribute $200 and experience a live-streamed piano performance. Great for restaurants outside the local area or as an innovative unique special event at a yoga studio or spa retreat!
  5. Contribute $300 and I will record and produce for you a 2-3 minute solo piano piece in that beautiful romantic, relaxed yet cinematic style that you love! Perfect as a Valentines gift for a loved one or as evening-time piano chill or meditation.
  6. Contribute $500 and get a 4-pack of private, custom-tailored lessons. You can choose either 4 pre-made custom videos or 4 one-hour live lessons. And don't worry I will take really great care of you regardless of what level of proficiency you are at. Pure beginners to highly advanced producers are welcome!

Check out more perks to the side of this description box!

=-=-=

:: My Origin Story ::

=-=-=

The piano today is an ever-present life-long companion to me, yet things didn’t start out that way at all. 

As a child, I found myself captivated by sounds and musical instruments, but because no one around me (not even my family, friends or relatives) shared my interest I never really gave music or piano much of a second thought. Sports and gaming quickly became my favorite childhood pastimes and although I listened to music all the time, the idea of playing piano seemed almost taboo to me. In that mindset, I didn’t want to learn the piano because it seemed like a lot of work for too little reward.

Then, when I was 21, a friend introduced me to a piece of music from Frederic Chopin and for some reason it suddenly ignited a very strong drive and desire in me to learn the piano, despite being at an age which many “experts” considered to be “too old and late for a pianist”.

At first, I dedicated myself to learning just that one first piece that inspired me, however... not longer after, I found myself excited enough to keep going with a second piece, then a third, and...

Before I knew it I found myself taking lessons with an internationally recognized piano teacher and enrolled at a top-level university music program.

Until... I quit...

All those lessons, methods, classes, theory assignments, textbooks, counter-point challenges... phewww..

At a certain point, I simply recognized I was training to become a musical academic and not at all the free, emotionally passionate and expressive creative pianist I dreamed to be.

After getting off that standard academic track, I decided to play the piano only for enjoyment and to me at first that meant jamming around and improvising in the way that I found exciting and fun.

No more exercises, methods, trainings, etc.

To my surprise... not that long after and without really trying, I found myself playing again and making progress on the piano far quicker and more effectively than I ever did during my academically-minded years.

Melodies, chord progressions, and other musical ideas seemed to flow faster, easier and more abundantly than ever before. It was something I couldn’t quite understand, until I took some time to reflect and really analyze what had changed.

After taking some time to really dive deep and noticing what was working and what was not, I was able to recognize certain, highly effective mindsets in my musical training.

Many of my study habits actually appeared to be rather uncommon amongst other musicians, yet I found them to be the very core reason behind my creative dexterity and abundance. 

That self-study as well as sessions upon sessions of experience working with my own students privately has now given me the confidence and enthusiasm to share this on a more public level! 

This is what this course and program is all about!

=-=-=

:: Special Note ::

=-=-=

Those who donate $300 or more in any capacity will be granted access and membership upon the completion and release of this music creativity course!

As a unique and highly specialized, valuable program, the actual launch membership price will be much higher (at $500 or more) so if you are thinking about getting serious about your piano, producing or songwriting chops, this is a superb opportunity to get yourself signed up for a huge, huge discount!

With your generous contributions and support, this course is expected to launch by end of April 2020 or even sooner!

=-=-=

:: A Word Of Thanks ::

=-=-=

Nice... you’ve made this far in the reading and I wish to say thank you! 

If you are not able to contribute at this time, please share this campaign with your friends, family and social media followers!

A vital goal of this campaign is also to connect like-minded, driven and dedicated musicians and sometimes even a single facebook share can open the doors for untold opportunities! Both for the campaign and for the musician at the other end!

Copy and paste this link here to share: https://igg.me/at/vemusic

And.. you're invited to visit and listen to my music on these platforms!

Spotify :: SoundCloud :: YouTube :: iTunes

More videos and content is planned so stay tuned and be sure to subscribe and check back soon!

=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

Thank You Very Much!
story_txt:
Hello!
My name is Vladimir and I am a pianist, composer and music improviser.
I created this campaign to raise funds for the production of a very innovative (as well as effective!) songwriting, improvising and music composition instructional program resulting from many years of testing and personal teaching experience!
=-=-=
How Is This Course Different Than A YouTube Tutorial?
=-=-=
First of all, in this course I intend to reveal the true essence of how to create original music on a piano/keyboard (and other instruments).  This course is not about learning more theory methods or technique exercises. It will be focused entirely on cultivating genuine creativity and composition ability. Furthermore, the principles revealed can also be utilized on any instrument and thus can benefit a musician of any background or discipline. (Great if you're a guitarist, but dabble on the keys for example!)
Let it be known that this course is not only meant for classical or jazz musicians. It is equally (and perhaps even more so) applicable to electronic music producers, hip-hop beatmakers, pop songwriters and other genres of any modern music (rock and etc).
Essentially, anyone who wants to create their own original melodies, songs or pieces would benefit enormously from this course!
The ultimate premise and intention with this project is to show aspiring and existing musicians alike that creating original songs and musical parts is not dependent on inherent talent or amount of theory knowledge.
Throughout the course, I will demonstrate that “musical talent” is actually available to anyone who can familiarize themselves with playing the piano/keyboard in perhaps a somewhat uncommon, yet highly intuitive and natural way.
The program will help one shape an effortless music composition approach that quickly turns idea impulses or melody fragments into completed written songs or (if you prefer) endless improvisational flows of captivating music and progressions!
There is nothing like this currently available. Quite serendipitously, the only reason I am able to share these musical insights today is due to a very unusual personal life journey and music education experience.
Check out "My Origin Story" further below for more details!
=-=-=

:: With Your Contribution You Are Creating ::
=-=-=

A music creativity/composition course that is incredibly simple, yet brilliantly effective. 
Captivating professional video production value so you feel great watching and learning!
Professional sound mixing and visual editing/design
A whole new generation of ultra-creative musicians (and original music!) empowered by the authentic techniques shared in this course.

=-=-=

:: Break Down Of Anticipated Costs ::
=-=-=

Studio and location rental 
Musical instrument rentals
Video production resources (camera + etc. rentals) 
Sound and video editing 
Design, visual resources and creation 
Publicity and marketing related resources (photography, licensing, etc.)
Labor and that pure “hustle muscle”
Time spent making mistakes and learning from them (I'm not perfect, I wish I was haha!)

Contribute $300 and I will record and produce for you a 2-3 minute solo piano piece in that beautiful romantic, relaxed yet cinematic style that you love! Perfect as a Valentines gift for a loved one or as evening-time piano chill or meditation.

story:
The Black Wizards are a band of heavy fuzzadelic blues: no gimmicks, just pure soul, emotion and lots of fuzz. They're not trying to be pioneers or break any frontiers, they're just trying to keep the blues alive and play it like the old masters once did.

Jimi Hendrix, Cream and Black Sabbath are such a big influence in our music, so if you like sixties and seventies psychedelic blues/rock you should check us out. But we are also influenced by the new blues/heavy rock such as Jack White, The Dead Weather, Kadavar and Graveyard. 

This is a pretty solid project and we are working hard to reach our goals and take our music as far as possible. This isn’t a trivial hobby this is the way that we live and that we want to live. 


About the project

This project aims to raise funds for the very first full-lenght of The Black Wizards. It will contain eight or nine groovy tracks for you to enjoy the ride. Our goal is to produce a psychedelic and powerful listening experience.  All the funds will be used to record, mix and master the album. 

We had released "Fuzzadelic" in february 13th. We've been touring a lot in Portugal and a brief passage through Spain and we are planning a tour across Europe promoting the album.
If you can't afford the contribute you can still help us out by sharing our campaign and if you know some cool places to play don't hesitate to contact us.

THANKS!

story:
Who am I?? I am "Era", nice to meet you...  

I'm a solo hip-hop/rap artist from the UK, and I've been writing and recording since the age of 13. I've always been extremely passionate about my music, and now I'm ready to take it to the next level, with a debut album release.

My songs and lyrics come from the heart, and from past, personal experiences. I take real events and situations that I see in every day life. I feel people can relate to my music. I'm original, and not like other artists.

I truly believe that my lyrics are different. That my perspective, and way of thinking, when translated into music, is different, and better than anything else out there.

In the past, I've had issues with my self-confidence. But when I write, when I perform, these doubts go away. The support I receive from my family, fans has enabled me to overcome these doubts, and with your help, I believe I can continue to do so.

What I am trying to achieve....

I am trying to raise £8,500. Enough funds to enable me to record and release my debut album "The Division". The funds that I raise, through your help, will cover:

  • Recording Studio Time (& musicians)
  • Music Video (or two if I ask them nicely)
  • Physical product (that I can sell in UK record stores - hopefully)
  • Digital Distribution
  • PR & Promotional activity - I need to be heard.
I will be using some local partner companies to help me (to try and keep the costs down), with the main expense being the PR & Promotional Campaign. After all, whats the point of recording an AMAZING debut album, if nobody knows about it?
The end result?? "The Division"....

I have been writing lyrics since I was very young, and the material I have for this album will be truly different to anything you have heard before.
I am passionate, committed and dedicated to this material. I've had great feedback from live events so far (but great feedback alone, won't help me get this album recorded and released).
Just a thought.... Think about your favourite Hip-Hop or Rap artist? Got one? Right.... Now think, imagine if you were there at the start? Would you help? Imagine you were listed in the "thank you" section of the album notes? Imagine you had a personally signed copy? Awesome? I agree, so help me? 

It's not going to be an easy road....

I am fully aware that this process will not be easy. It is going to be a long road.

But I'm ready. 

As I've mentioned, I've had issues in the past with my self confidence, but my music takes that away. When I write, I'm a different person. When I perform, I'm a different person.

I have good people around me, who will help with the time and effort needed to complete this project.

I truly believe that my music can make a difference.

I'm not just after your money... :)

Its 2015, and times are hard, I know this.

If you are unable to help me financially, then help me by spreading the word? Share my page? Share my youtube videos? 

Love Hip-Hop? Love new music? Can you help me by completing some fund-raising activity of your own?

Every band, and every artist on Indiegogo are grateful for your help, and support.

None more so than me.

You could change my life forever. Will you?

story:
We successfully reached our target for the ‘Electric & Alive’ Album here on Indiegogo. Thank you everyone! Now we are ready to go on tour! First stop: INDIA

Join us for the ‘Electric & Alive’ World Tour....♬♫


EMPOWERMENT THROUGH MUSIC

"At the very grassroots of human civilization, a revolution is taking place—the revolution of the Massive Vibe uniting all."- Queen Be! - Production & Lyrics

Music has the power to inspire, connect and change the world, reaching everyone, everywhere.

  • Imagine lyrics that go straight to the heart and light up the mind.

  • Imagine visuals that empower your strengths, gifts and talents.

  • Imagine a show that evokes your capacity to be of immense benefit.  

Massive Vibe Live! is a global concert series empowering the world through a new form of music, magnetising lyrics, visuals and dance.


 

  We had an incredible response to Massive Vibe Live! concerts on our pre-tour in March 2015. We have since received many invitations to perform again in India on a much larger scale.

“The music was so empowering… I will never forget it.” A.B Mumbai

“truly enigmatic, powerful and blissful… This movement is sure to change the world we live in.” J.B. Mumbai

 


To further enliven the empowerment of Massive Vibe Live! We offer:

  • Meetups with the artists

  • Access to powerful audios and visuals

  • A global social network of likeminded people awakening their talents and seeing how they can be contributed to the world.

        

Watch the newly released music video, Great Cheer:

   

   


And.... 'You are the Shining Light of Benefit Bright' !
   
   



Many universities in India put on cultural and music festivals that engage audiences of over 50,000 students. We are booked to perform at many Student Festivals and will host a series of university tours with performances and interactive Meetups.

        


We are independently funded, 100% crowdfunded. For the India Tour we require funds for:

  • Filming and broadcasting equipment - $4000

  • Music Equipment - $6000

  • Distribution and PR company in India - $5000

  • Total: $15,000

 


We’ve got some amazing perks for you. It's the least we can do to thank you for your support.

If you are as excited about this project as we are, don't hold back with your generous contributions ♥ You are welcome to contribute any amount you like in the 'CONTRIBUTE HERE' box above.


Every contribution is appreciated, however you can also spread the Vibe by sharing this campaign through your social media networks. 

            CLICK TO TWEET | Facebook |  Twitter |  Instagram  |  YouTube


Stay tuned for updates. Enjoy the perks. Thanks for your support! 


The music video Crazy Wise, made this year in Mumbai!

story:
New York based Caught Up In A Dream is raising funds to record a new EP:

  • The band has released a debut EP, 'Mountains & Milestones'
  • The EP was produced/mixed by Mike Hart
  • "Reoccurring Arguments" music video is out now
  • The band is raising funds to record a new EP w/ Ace Enders
  • http://www.aceendersproduction.com/
Help the band by donating today! Without you, this record wouldn't be a possibility.

What I Need

Here's why I'm asking for $3000:

  • Record/Mixing = $3000
  • Mastering = $500
  • Food & Lodging = $1000 (approximately)
  • Packaging = $1500

As you can see, there are around another $3000 worth of expenses I'm not asking your help with. I want to match what you donate!

What You Get

I have six levels of donations:

  • $5 = digital download of the record before it's released and a digital download of 'Mountains & Milestones'
  • $20 = digital + physical copy of the new EP + 'Mountains & Milestones' digital + physical copy + a limited run T-shirt
  • $50 = all of the above + handwritten lyric sheet + Skype concert (4 songs) + thanks in the liner notes
  • $100 = all of the above + a second limited run T-shirt + CUIAD coffee mug
  • $250 = all of the above + 1 song written by the band for you (home recording)
  • $1000 = all of the above + free guest list for shows for the rest of your life

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate? Here's how you can help:

  • Share this page on your social networks!
  • Come to a show! I'd love to see you.
Buy 'Mountains & Milestones' (name your price) at: http://caughtupinadream.bandcamp.com
