story:
We are Next Door To Heaven band

Hello everyone!

We are Next Door To Heaven - a band from St.Petersburg. Our band was formed in September 2014. Our first album was on the top on Google Play, we've got very nice reviews on it and now hope to finally shoot a good video for the main song on this album-"Let's dream".

Our first-ever video didn't achieve the best result we've expected mostly because our budget was the tiniest ever seen. That's why this time we have to ask for your help and we hope you will help. Have a nice day!

story:
ARTIST:

CARLENE GRAHAM - Singer / Songwriter / Producer

Hello everybody!

For the last 2.5 years, I have been touring worldwide with the Spanish musical Forever King Of Pop - endorsed by Latoya & Jermaine Jackson via The Jackson Family Foundation. We toured Spain, France, Germany & Mexico twice. Due to Covid-19 the tour has been postponed until 2021/2022. 

With 21 years of professional experience working with some of the biggest names in the music industry such as Madonna, Shakira & Dionne Warwick, some of my performance highlights to date, include: Singing acapella at The House of Commons in London at the Black Women Mean Business Convention for MP Diane Abbott (2001), Tsunami Appeal Concert at The Royal Albert Hall (2004), "Stars In Their Eyes" on ITV as Gloria Gaynor (2004), Primavera Sound of Barcelona (2006), Glastonbury with Spiritualised (2007), Wizink Centre Madrid - Forever King of Pop (2018), Centro Cultural Teatro 1 CDMX, Mexico (2019), Casino de Paris (2019) & Verti Music Hall, Berlin (2020) to name a few!

 

2020 has seen very little work since February, & cancelled bookings until further notice. Like so many artists out of work, I have had to create & establish a new way of life. So during lockdown I wrote, recorded & produced 3 albums & 2 singles from home - with Errol Ross on Music Production.

We are using basic equipment to do this. Our gig equipment to be exact. We have had to utilise our (old) iMac, Mackie Mixer, Focusrite Scarlett, Shure SM58, & HK Speakers, combined with our music & production skills, to create :

  • Online - 1st album released worldwide on Friday 10 April 2020
  • Quarantine Edition - 2nd album released worldwide on Friday 12 June 2020
  • Hurt Before - 1st single released worldwide on Tuesday 14 July 2020
  • Sunshine - 2nd single released worldwide on Friday 7 August 2020
  • Love Code - 3rd album released worldwide on Friday 4 September 2020

 

            

 

There began our journey in Music Production together...

 

PRODUCTION TEAM:


ERROL ROSS - Producer / Bass Player / Singer / Teacher of Music Technology

       

Errol Ross has been in the music business for over 40 years, & is known for having produced "Too Much Pressure", the debut album by British Ska Band: The Selecter. This production earned him his Silver & Gold discs for sales of over 60,000 & 100,000 records. 

In March 2020, Errol Ross released his first single: Mystery Lady, from his forthcoming album in 2021! It is available for download on all your favourite digital stores now!

 

CARLENE GRAHAM - Vocal Arrangements / Producer / Sound Engineer

Vocals are my thing! I love all elements of vocal production, whether performing or producing. I learned about sound engineering when I was 14 years old, as the first student of Errol Ross. I completed a course in MIDI Basics & Music Production. It has stuck with me! Creating these albums & singles have been a joy, something that I wish to continue for life! 

These singles from 2017 - 2019 got me excited & eager to begin writing & producing again! All are available for download on your favourite digital stores now!

      

 

We want to update our limited facilities & create a professional home Recording Studio with Industry quality sound.

Equipment needed:

Computer & Software
• Special Edition iMac 
• Pro Tools HD DAW
• Pro Tools Keyboard
• Logic X Pro DAW
• GarageBand DAW
• Cables & connectors

  

Digital Mixing Desk
• Digital Mixing Desk
• Combo studio desk
• Cables & connectors

Vocal Rack
• Neumann Microphone 
• Shure Microphones
• Focusrite Audio Interface
• Avalon Vocal Compressor
• Pop Filter
• Cables & connectors

Audio / Vocal Rack 
• Vocal Processors
• Compressors
• Various Multi Effect Processors
• Cables & connectors

  

Studio Rack 
• Sennheiser HD Pro Headphones
• Headphone Amplifier
• Pro Patchbay
• Cables & connectors 

Studio Monitors
• Allen / Yamaha monitors
• Acoustic Pads
• Speaker stands
• Cables & connectors

    


Plugins
• Smart EQ2
• Smart compressor
• Smart reverb         

 

We want to use our new studio to continue creating & releasing music, as well as providing the following services to other artists & musicians, some of which we already provide:

• Recording
• Editing
• Mixing
• Mastering
• Video Editing
• Backing Vocals
• One to one consultancy

How can we be of service to others?
A lot of artists & musicians are unable to pay the high rates charged by professional recording studios. Especially with the devastating events of 2020, & its affect on the music & entertainment industries.

Artists & musicians are resorting to home studios & production teams to develop their music & songs. Some of those artists & musicians will also require production advice & training. We are here to provide music production services & advice.

You can find our music, merchandise & services listed in the perks section!

Who can benefit from it?

Musicians
Songwriters
Vocalists
Producers
DJs

When will we start?
The project is already running. During the lockdown period we have written, recorded, mixed, mastered and released 3 albums and 2 singles. We have much more in store.

Where are we?
We are based in Spain but we work with artists, musicians & producers worldwide. We collaborated with producers & artists from London & France for: Quarantine Edition (album), Sunshine (single) & Love Code (album). We only need internet connection so the audio files can be sent from anywhere in the world. We can do the rest in our studio.

What happens if we don´t reach our entire goal?

We will use a proportion of the funds to continue recording, paying the production costs involved, marketing & promoting.  The rest will be used to upgrade the equipment that we are able to, to enable us to better our sound & expand our services to other artists & musicians. No matter what happens, we will keep creating & releasing our music!

Flexible Funding

This campaign is set up with flexible funding, meaning that all money that you guys put towards our project, will be used. Should the amount raised fall under our goal, the project will still move forward. 

Other ways you can help...

We want to reach out to as many people as possible & would appreciate you sharing our project on your Social Networks & to anybody that you think can benefit from our services.

Thank you very much!

story:
The quest to make Good Thing continues! 

In the first round we raised $7, 265. After Indiegogo took their cut I ultimately netted $6,590.56 of my goal of $15,575. Turns out crowdfunding during a worldwide pandemic is hard! 

But, I'm powering forward. This record will be made. May have to make some adjustments along the way, but it will happen. 

I pretty much laid it all out in the explanation of Good Thing in the first campaign, so I'll refer you to that if you are just catching up with this. I probably said too much! So, check it out if you have any questions. 

The two month campaign was tough, but enlightening. One thing that really came into shape was the weekly live webcasts that I started doing to highlight Good Thing.  I had some incredible special guests.............Robert Reynolds from The Mavericks, Garry Tallent from Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band, Sean Snook, Johnny Mackinnon from The Roadtrippers, Jude Johnstone...........pretty amazing friends and musical cohorts.  The interaction with my friends on Facebook during the webcasts was a real lift each Sunday and running the new songs past everyone in realtime was invaluable. 

So, I'll continue that. 

I'm currently in Texas after making the journey from London. I'll start heading toward Nashville and will start recording sometime next week. I'll live webcast those sessions, so make sure you tune in on my Facebook page. 

The Perks.

I streamlined the perks a bit this time. Cds, Vinyl, t-shirt, and a selection of Backyard Concerts are available. A personal Facetime/Zoom concert is also an option now. Make sure to scroll all the way to the bottom for the Backyard Concerts and Executive Producer option. Grab one now and let's push it over the edge!

Vinyl of all the rage..................

My debut, Fear Nothing, came out on A&M Records on Cd..........completely missing vinyl. This will be my first record to be printed on vinyl. I'm so fired up about that. This is the record player I got for Christmas. Cannot wait to spin Good Thing on it! Grab your vinyl copy!

 

Other ways to help:

Share on Facebook and Twitter. Make it personal. Tell them why they should check it out.  Thanks!

story:
OVERVIEW

We are creating our own style increasing our skills and seeking uncommon sounding and nuance. Our band recorded 15 demo songs via home studio out of 32 songs that we composed. We are aiming to record 8 songs that would be included in the album at professional sound studio and make 2 video clips.

Our Beyond Passion album has 8 songs!

This song you hear is the single the album is named after. Beyond Passion is all about our passion for music, life and praise for Our Creator.

Let’s shine the album Beyond and Passion brightly in the society through supporting us!

 

 

BAND HISTORY

Spoonfork is a Mongolian downtempo & indie rock girl band formed in January 2014 by two girls who play live performances and serve as a worship team at the church. From August 2018 we started recording our songs using our home studio and give a show at some places.

Saya is the main vocalist and lead guitar, and Saik is the bassist and vocalist. We compose our song lyrics, music and record by ourselves.

 

THE PLAN

All of the songs are already composed and recorded as a demo. We are planning to record those demos again at the acoustic studio and will do a mixing&mastering. Once the recording is finished we will make a video clip for 2 songs from the album. All the 8 songs are completed we will release the CD.  Then we will organize album launching event. 

 

THE SONGS

Most of our songs are dedicated to the Lord. When we were facing the difficulties we composed those songs as a prayer and expressing our gratitude to the Lord 'cause He showed us the ways to get over and brought us inner peace and joy of life. 

 

 

THE BUDGET

Estimated amount is $14,000 to make the album, Beyond Passion.

So, here’s how the money would be spent:

  1. Studio Recording - $3000
  2. Mixing & Mastering - $3000
  3. Producing & Marketing - $3000
  4. Video Recording - $4000
  5. Video Edit - $1000

 

 

THE MONEY

  • If we raise USD14,000 and beyond we can make this album into something unique and groundbreaking.
  • If we raise beyond USD30,000 we can able to organize the concert that will spread the good news about Our savior.

 

THE IMPACT

Our songs are composed in both English and Mongolian and we will deliver each song combining modern sounding and types to our listeners. We wish that our album would become courage and example to plenty of hidden talents.  We believe that we can reach our dream and fulfill our goals by developing ourselves steadily, work persistently and composing without being discouraged.

Find out more songs from https://soundcloud.com/spoonf

story:
SONS OF MOTOWN

The Legend Continues...

The Temptations: The original boy band. The core of Motown. The inspiration behind countless songs, and recording groups.
These icons of smooth moves and groove also created five juniors.
David Ruffin Jr, Melvin Franklin Jr, Paul Williams Jr, Rich Street Jr, and Glenn Leonard Jr have picked up the past from their fathers, and are bringing it all to the present.

Introducing the Sons of Motown: The band of boys made by the original boy band.
Coming together to bring you their stories in an epic Docu-series, and to carry on the legendary music with a global tour, and studio tribute album.

This campaign is giving the world a once in a lifetime opportunity. We're asking you to aide in bringing back the soul of Motown through the living product of The Temptations: their sons. Melvin Franklin Jr is currently pursuing a degree in business. David Ruffin Jr, and Paul Williams Jr have extensive experience in the music industry. The five men combined each have our own unique take on what it's like to live in the presence of legends, and we insist on giving you the artistic standard that will fully honor our fathers' legacy. 

In order to ensure we give you the gold standard set by our fathers by the voices that only we can offer, we need to keep the artistic licenses so crucial to creating the heart of the art we are here to off in our collective hands.

That is why we come to you, the incredible crowdfunding crowd, and offer you some amazing perks to be a part of this intimate, unique collaboration. Your jumping in on the proverbial ribbon cutting for this group with donations and shares will see us giving you OUR voice...and not that of a corporation. 

What We Need & What You Get

To start this massive project off, we are raising $500,000. 

To those of you that know the ins and outs of the music industry, we understand you're seeing this as a low figure. We however are confident that as word gets out and we are able to start bringing you all what we've been working on behind the scenes, it's gonna be a GREAT place to start. PLUS, we want to involve all of you in some perks that can fulfill any...temptation. (Motown humor. ;) )

$150,000 going to overall production costs with the docu-series.

$120,000 will go into studio recording costs. 

$50,000 for accommodations and transportation.

$25,000 for location fees

$23,000 for band rehearsals

$20,000 for merchandise

$20,000 for perks

$15,000 for legal fees

$10,000 for musical director

$10,000 for choreographer

$7,000 for wardrobe

And we are factoring in the rounded 10% in processing fees to the awesome folks at Indiegogo.

​PERK PLUSES!

We are really excited to offer you the spectacular perks we've lined up for you all!

We've got everything from limited edition t-shirts unique to this campaign, opportunities for behind the scenes footage, live one on one chats with the group, in-house artist renderings of Sons of Motown, autographed hard copy CDs and vinyl, to the complete Sons of Motown VIP experience where you'll spend a day leading up to backstage passes to a concert with memories made you won't find anywhere else!

We've even got some amazing goal-reached perks for the public with a music video starring YOU, our fans and fans of our fathers, live Q&A's, and a very special home stretch surprise!...with a once in a lifetime perk offered once the campaign has met it's goal for a very lucky winner!

It should be noted that this is an "All or Nothing" campaign. If we go short even a dollar, all funds are returned to the donors, and we either go back to the drawing board...or even possibly go our separate ways. 

It takes a very special kind of commitment, hard work, determination, and talent to pull off a rock solid musical group. Thank heavens (with a shout out to all of our fathers who've passed on to heaven at this point, and an appreciation for who is still with us) we learned from the best. 

We are here to bring you the type of magic our fathers started bringing the world back in 1963. 

We are deeply thankful to all who contribute to this campaign; everywhere from donations to getting the word out there. Please share away regardless of whether you can monetarily support our goal, and remember to use Indiegogo's awesome share tools! 

Get ready! 

'Cause here. we. COME

Sending you all the very best,

Paul Williams Jr, Melvin Franklin Jr, David Ruffin Jr, Glenn Leonard Jr, and Rich Street Jr

SONS OF MOTOWN.

Get ready!

Paul Williams Jr, Melvin Franklin Jr, David Ruffin Jr, Glenn Leonard Jr, and Rich Street Jr
SONS OF MOTOWN.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Art Joslin, and I am seeking funding to record my 4th CD. This project, titled "But Not For Me - Love Songs from the Great American Songbook" will feature 10 songs that will warm your heart, and remind us why we fell in love. Originally trained as an opera singer, I have been singing these songs for nearly 40 years. Before my wife passed from cancer in 2017, we would perform many of these songs together (she played piano), and sometimes we danced until the early hours. She is the reason I want to record some of our favorites.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The funding for this project is $18,000. Here is what that money will provide:

  • Studio Time - Finding the right studio to record a project of this size is difficult. Luckily, there are two studios in Michigan - 1 in Ann Arbor, and 1 in Detroit, that can provide the right atmosphere for us. A minimum of two days in the studio for tracks, and at least one day for vocals (maybe two).
  • World-Class Studio Musicians - 15 of the finest professional session musicians Detroit and Ann Arbor have to offer will be recording this project. Assembling a Big Band for 5 of the 10 songs is not cheap. The other 5 songs require a jazz combo.
  • ​Phenomenal Arranger & Music Director - I have hired one of the best jazz arrangers in the Midwest to bring fresh musical ideas to these great standards.
  • A Great Engineer - not every engineer can run a studio and mix these type of songs. One that is well-versed with jazz, and songs from the Great American Songbook is needed to give the project a polished finish.
  • Secure Publisher Rights - permission must be obtained for licensing the recording of someone else's work. This is expensive. It is unethical to use someone else's musical work without proper compensation. This is controlled by BMI and ASCAP.
  • Mixing the Project - It takes an acute ear to mix a project of this size and style to get the right balance between the instruments and the vocals. Mixing includes additional studio time with the engineer, music director, and me.
  • Mastering - When the final project is mixed, it must be mastered before it can be sent off to a CD replication house. This requires even more studio time, the engineer, and the music director.
  • Graphic Design & Photo Shoot - A graphic designer will design a pleasing cover and jacket using all new photos specifically for this CD project.
  • CD Replication - The master is sent to a replication house for replication, printing, and packaging.

 

The Impact

Please allow me to give you a little history of why I love these songs so much, and why I would love to record these 10 songs and share them with you:

  • I met my beautiful wife in the summer of 1983 and the thunderbolt hit me. Not only was she a sweetheart, but she was one of the finest pianists I've ever known. Classically trained in piano, and I in voice, we performed together for nearly 35 years. One of the pure joys of my life.

    Tragically, she passed away of cancer in 2017, silencing a talent and gift that was truly from God.

    We shared a love of jazz standards and songs from The Great American Songbook. We danced together as much as possible to these great songs of the greatest generation.

    So, I decided to record a CD of ten songs from that very Songbook. These are some of my and my wife's favorites by composers such as Hoagy Carmichael, Johnny Mercer, George & Ira Gershwin, Irving Berlin, Duke Ellington, and others. They represent songs that generate, for me, memories and feelings of love lost, dancing together, and of course, heartbreak.

    Over the years, people have written me emails, notes, letters, and Facebook posts asking when I was going to record these songs. 

  • I've had years of experience singing back-up vocals and making recordings in recording studios. I know my way around the studio, and live performance, so you won't have to worry about wasted time and money!

 

Risks & Challenges

Of course, the challenge will be to fund this project. Here are the options:

  • Fully Funded - The project gets started with a tentative completion date no later than May 1st, 2020 (at the  very latest).
  • Over Funded - If the project is over-funded, I will use the excess funds to add a few musicians to the mix, have more CD's replicated, etc.
  • Partially Funded - I would use whatever funds are available to begin the project. I would try to find more ways to fund the project to it's completion (work at BK, Taco Bell, sell apples on the corner, etc.).
  • Not Funded - or not funded enough to start . . . I really hope this doesn't happen???!!!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Spread the Word - Get the word out to as many as you can. Please share this campaign on Social Media and tell your friends.

Thank you so much for your consideration and God Bless You!

story:
Preview the Album

The album is done! You can listen to a few sound samples at https://ladycannon.bandcamp.com/album/fortunes-.... 

 

What You Get

Each purchase level covers the costs of the item purchased and includes an amount that goes toward the fees of musicians, sound engineers and visual artists involved in the project. And it comes with a bonus: the warm, fuzzy feeling you get, knowing you are helping me broadcast this project far and wide.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to contribute but not financially? Here are some ways you can help:

  • Tell your friends and family about Lady Cannon.
  • Stream Lady Cannon on your listening platform of choice: Spotify, Pandora, Apple Music, etc.
  • Connect with Lady Cannon on social media platforms to follow our story and join the fun!

story:
20% rise in domestic violence in 2020
Let's help the charities in helping victims!

 

Who am I?

I'm Lilac Sheer, a singer-songwriter, musician & vlogger. I've released 4 albums and always saw my creation as a tool to convey messages of empowerment and personal development.  I also vlog several times a week on my YouTube channel, discussing similar topics.

As a child I knew all too well the feeling of helplessness, never knowing who would bear the consequences of laughing too hard, interfering too much or not doing enough. And when the consequence isn't necessarily related to what we do or don’t do, the lesson we take with us is that we are always at fault, never good enough, and always deserving of the disrespect, which leads us in a vicious cycle to seek the same emotional or physical treatment in future relationships.

Why now?

In these tumultuous times, while we rely on the home, our safe haven, to protect us from the virus threat outdoors, in other homes, victims of domestic violence abuse find themselves trapped 24/7 under the same roof with their perpetraor and women and mothers are being murdered at an unprecedented rate.  The UN recently reported a 20% increase in domestic violence cases since the onset of Covid-19, with organisations & rescue shelters struggling under the load and are in urgent need of donations.


What can we do together?

With your support, we'll release next month a protest song & animation video aimed at raising awareness and generating donations in light of upcoming International Domestic Violence Awareness Day [November 25th]. This is a not-profit project, whereby the song and videoclip will be used as a fundraising tool for Solace Women's Aid, an organisation dedicated to rescuing women and children suffering from domestic violence and enabling them to enter a new life by providing asylum, shelter, professional care and vocational training.


What is your part as a supporter?

With your support, I'd be able to finalise post-production, publish the song and produce a music video. As an events performer I've had no income since March, yet I wholeheartedly believe that the timing is right and crucial for this project to see the light of day, in order to create a social impact and moral boost.  You are an essential part of this project - Together we will finalise the following: • Mix • Master • Video clip • Distribution • Promotion


What is our message to the community?

Let's say no more.  Let's stand together as a society and say enough.  And while governments are urging musicians to change profession - let's remind everyone the power of artistic expression in changing hearts & minds and it's ability to create real change, even  (and maybe even more so) when times are hard.


I want to release the song with you!  What's the next step?

All you have to do to help release the song & music video, is to purchase one or more of the perks from the campaign list.  Remember - Any donation, large or small - Is viable & important. If you order any of my CDs - these will be sent to you immediately as the campaign ends (throughout December) so it won't take long to receive your goodies.

After purchasing your perks, invite your friends to take part in this exciting process with us - Together, we'll be able to do a real service for the community and make a difference.


Stay safe & sane ♥️ thank you for considering this cause

story: We are the 70's cult band The Heavy Metal Kids, responsible for creating a rock sound which infused Glam, Punk, Progressive, Classical, Rock and Theatre. The Heavy Metal Kids have previously released 4 studio albums and 4 live albums with DVDs capturing the band across every era of it's existence. The band has influenced a wealth of people from the likes of Johnny Rotten to Lady Gaga. It's stark image has always been iconic and its rocking live sound a thing of living legend. We want to record for you a new album. We also have a DVD of our much loved frontman Gary Holton which contains an archive of never seen before photos and footage. Help us finish and release our new album.

Help us finish and release our new album.

story:
This is Omar Tyree, the New York Times bestselling author who used to be the youngest author, writing and selling books in my early 20s over 20 years. Now I’m The Oldhead, who still has a lot to say about what’s going on in our community. Problem is, folks don’t have time to read like they used to. Fortunately for me, I understand how to write and deliver poetry and music, which I’ve been doing behind the scenes for a lonnnnggg time. Now I’m coming back to my vocals skills and roots with an incredible third album, "The Oldhead Just Spoke". Why? Obviously, the youth culture has now taken over popular music. Problem is, they’re not saying anything that still needs to be said to our people. I plan to change that with a new mission and a stable of young artists. So for all The Believers of Positive Power Music (PPM), I offer you an opportunity to purchase 18 incredible song for digital download, a physical CD, have you name listed in the foldout booklet, include a recorded vocal shot-out on an appreciation record, advertise your business inside the booklet, purchase and sell 50 CD copies of your own, and the grand finale, co-write and produce one of the featured songs with me.

"The Olhead Just Spoke", is not just an album, it’s a movement to get our young people to respect the funky truth of age and wisdom. Then I can write, produce and develop more meaningful content for my younger artists. But don’t just take my word it for it, click on the Free song link and listen to an inspirational track yourself - "Make Em Believe" featuring my 1st young protégé, Ana Morris . And learn to support Positive Power Music for years to come!

 

https://soundcloud.com/user-187246677/make-em-b...

story:
PLEASE MEET ME.

My name is Aza Jezile, alias Deep Aztec and I am a  South African born and based electronic music live act / record label owner.


I was exposed to a wide variety of music as an infant and the closest I could get to Jazz music was through Deep House. At the age of 13 I started to learn how to beat match and at the age of 16  started producing my own music and gigging in clubs along side respected DJ/artists like DJ Mbuso , Liquideep,Cisco , Culoe De Song and Black Coffee, just to mention a few.

After 6yrs of producing I got an offer to sign with a German imprint (Sensual Sounds), followed by a contract with UK Turn Left Recordings where I signed my debut release "A message to Larry Heard". Further there were releases  with Nomadiq Music (SA) and Chronoworld Records (Italy) as well as Proton Limited Label and Watergate Records in 2017.

I played at several profile festivals in South Africa and popular events locally such as : Rocking The Daisies ,Vice City, Afrika Burn and ULTRA Festival.

https://soundcloud.com/deep_aztec

https://www.facebook.com/deepaztec/

THE IMPACT.

"The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes."

I always believed in music being a way to express our unity within most different facilities of culture, origin and lifestyle. With highest pleasure to the opportunities having given, I would love to extend my range of inspiration as much as sharing my understanding of music outside of South Africa.

Europe, for the genre I produce music iN, plays a main role and I would love to understand, learn, create, explore and discover on an international level and by that contribute towards music as much as my culture. Making this world a better place is in each ones hands and I can only give so little to it, but that little be sharing the love to music without any boarders.

South Africa, as much as any other country within this universe has still so much sleeping talent and it is part of my journey to open the eyes to that as much as sharing my knowledge and supporting talent with what I am allowed to learn and achieve. 

WHAT I NEED.

My aim is to raise EUR 1000.

The funds raised will cover the cost of buying three international flights for  transporting me from Cape Town to Berlin.

Without your help there is no way I can do this. All contributions will be gratefully received as much as I would deeply appreciate your help by sharing this campaign to become part of my musical journey.

On an international level my name in music is not at a stage (yet) for promoters to pay for my international flights, which is the reason why I like to get them funded. To enable me taking gigs in Europe during the summer, as much as going to the studio with several artists overseas.  

WHAT YOU GET.

Among the usual perks and the deepest appreciation, you will get a signed vinyl of my last release  "Marco Resmann - Babylon Side ft. Deep Aztec & Black Soda"

I also love to offer you an exclusive interview and sure free guestlist for any of my gigs played as well as I offer to dedicate one of my unreleased tracks to you.

THANK YOU.

LOVE.

AZA.

story:
SUMMARY

For those who don’t know me, I am Vixen Noir, a Los Angeles-based singer, songwriter, recording and performance artist, producer, director, as well as a performance empowerment coach. I’ve been a lifelong Artist but only burst onto the music scene in 2013 with my debut single, Dangerous, finally in pursuit of my dream to be a SupaStar entertainer who empowers LGBTQ, POC, Women and Girls worldwide. I have since released an EP, several singles including my latest, MothaFucka, and wowed audiences from San Francisco to Sydney Australia.

Over the last 10 years, I’ve experienced a profound renaissance as a Black, Queer, Woman, Activist and Artist. I am now ready to share my journey through new music and videos that I hope will inspire self-love, love and respect for others, courage, healing, transformation, and the acceptance and celebration of gender and sexual diversity. I call this new endeavor, The ‘Rebirth of Vixen’ Project. I’ve divided it into two parts. PART 1: MothaFucka Remix Project and PART 2: A new 7-song EP, titled ‘Rebirth’.

PART 1: MothaFucka Remix Project, is the focus of this campaign. I am finally answering the call to rebirth my latest single, MothaFucka, as a club anthem remix, which pays homage to Black Transwomen while giving them much needed visibility. The remix will be produced by Jasmine Infiniti, a Black transwoman DJ/Producer, and feature Genuwine Beauty, a Black transwoman rap artist. (Pictured below lft to rt)

An accompanying music video will feature a cast of 8 Black Transwomen, uphold them in the most honorable and authentic light, and pay tribute to those who are no longer with us. Through this project we hope to also inspire the elimination of transphobic hatred and ignorance. So far, Fern Rose Mitchell, Dayna Catchings, Melanie Loraine Bryant, Kaityanna Delarosé Phillips, Jerri Lee and Chela Demuir-Cartier are confirmed to feature in the music video. (Pictured below top to bottom, lft to rt) We are in the process of securing the remaining 2 cast members.

Why make the MF Remix Project a platform for Black Transwomen voices?

If there’s one thing I’m deeply passionate about, it’s my Black LGBTQ family! And my Trans Sisters, for whatever reason, have always held a very special place in my heart! And it breaks my heart and angers me, the alarming rate at which Black Transwomen are harmed and murdered in this country! Startling! Through this project, I want to provide an opportunity for these women to say whatever they need to or want to say to the world. I want society to see and respect Black Transwomen as magnificent and brilliant human beings with valuable contributions to make to this planet like everybody else.

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

(PLEASE NOTE: To help us meet our pre-production and Sep 8 shoot day costs of $3113, we gladly welcome contributions via PayPal to vixen_noir@hotmail.com and Venmo to @Vixen-Noir. This will allow us more immediate access to funding, and ensure a successful project. THANK YOU.)

All we need to fulfill this project is $5,500. After much research, negotiation, juggled schedules and more I found the most reasonable resources possible (from super discounted to volunteer) and a shoot date that fits everybody’s schedule! Whew! September 8, 2018 is the day! We have everything in place and ready to go. Now all we need is your support to make it happen. From $5 to $5000, every amount counts! Your patronage will help cover the following costs:

For the Remix

  • DJ/Producer (to remix the song)
  • Artist fees for the feature rap artists
  • Recording studio time
  • Mastering the finished remix
  • Cover art design
  • Distribution (online stores and music sites incl. iTunes, Amazon, Spotify, iHeart Radio, etc.)
  • Promotion (online and release party)

For the Music Video

  • Video Producer/Cameraman/Editor
  • Stipends for 8 video cast members
  • Space rental (pre-shoot workshop & day of shoot green/dressing room)
  • Craft services (food & beverages for pre-shoot workshop & day of shoot)
  • Supplies/Materials (Poster boards, markers, glue, first aid kit, etc.)
  • Costumes (incl. a crown for each cast member and additional costume items and accessories)

PERKS!

To show our appreciation, we have some great perks lined up! Downloads of the remix and/or the music video before released to the world; special limited design MothaFucka T-shirts, behind-the-scenes photos of the cast in action, and more! For a $5000 contribution, you can be the Executive Producer of this project, be credited as so on the remix and the music video, along with other special perks. And for $300 you can sponsor a cast member to be in the music video, ensuring her voice is heard; including costume needs, local roundtrip transportation to and from shoot, meals/beverages and a stipend. How awesome is that?! MORE PERKS COMING!

THE IMPACT WE HOPE FOR

With the current climate of ongoing police brutality, discrimination, institutional and societal racism and transphobia, hate crimes and the alarming number of Black transwomen being murdered, it is our hope that the MothaFucka Remix Project can make a difference. It is our hope that through this project, we are able to reflect and uplift the brilliance, beauty, strength and power of Black Transwomen and resonate the message, #BlackTransWomensLivesMatter, loud and clear to the world!

We are all 200% committed to this project, and would be ecstatic to have you be a part of this journey with us! If we are not able to raise the entire $5500, the quality, the content and the participation of all who are committed to this project will be greatly compromised and we may not be able to effectively bring it to fruition, if at all.

However, if you aren’t able to contribute at this time, don’t fret! SPREADING THE WORD is a HUGE help. Indiegogo makes it really easy for you to share this campaign with your community via social media and email. I know that if we all pull together in strength and numbers, we will be successful!

Thank you.

With love and gratitude…

Vixen and the MF Remix Project Crew
story_txt:
SUMMARY
For those who don’t know me, I am Vixen Noir, a Los Angeles-based singer, songwriter, recording and performance artist, producer, director, as well as a performance empowerment coach. I’ve been a lifelong Artist but only burst onto the music scene in 2013 with my debut single, Dangerous, finally in pursuit of my dream to be a SupaStar entertainer who empowers LGBTQ, POC, Women and Girls worldwide. I have since released an EP, several singles including my latest, MothaFucka, and wowed audiences from San Francisco to Sydney Australia.
Over the last 10 years, I’ve experienced a profound renaissance as a Black, Queer, Woman, Activist and Artist. I am now ready to share my journey through new music and videos that I hope will inspire self-love, love and respect for others, courage, healing, transformation, and the acceptance and celebration of gender and sexual diversity. I call this new endeavor, The ‘Rebirth of Vixen’ Project. I’ve divided it into two parts. PART 1: MothaFucka Remix Project and PART 2: A new 7-song EP, titled ‘Rebirth’.
PART 1: MothaFucka Remix Project, is the focus of this campaign. I am finally answering the call to rebirth my latest single, MothaFucka, as a club anthem remix, which pays homage to Black Transwomen while giving them much needed visibility. The remix will be produced by Jasmine Infiniti, a Black transwoman DJ/Producer, and feature Genuwine Beauty, a Black transwoman rap artist. (Pictured below lft to rt)

An accompanying music video will feature a cast of 8 Black Transwomen, uphold them in the most honorable and authentic light, and pay tribute to those who are no longer with us. Through this project we hope to also inspire the elimination of transphobic hatred and ignorance. So far, Fern Rose Mitchell, Dayna Catchings, Melanie Loraine Bryant, Kaityanna Delarosé Phillips, Jerri Lee and Chela Demuir-Cartier are confirmed to feature in the music video. (Pictured below top to bottom, lft to rt) We are in the process of securing the remaining 2 cast members.

Why make the MF Remix Project a platform for Black Transwomen voices? 
If there’s one thing I’m deeply passionate about, it’s my Black LGBTQ family! And my Trans Sisters, for whatever reason, have always held a very special place in my heart! And it breaks my heart and angers me, the alarming rate at which Black Transwomen are harmed and murdered in this country! Startling! Through this project, I want to provide an opportunity for these women to say whatever they need to or want to say to the world. I want society to see and respect Black Transwomen as magnificent and brilliant human beings with valuable contributions to make to this planet like everybody else.
WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET
(PLEASE NOTE: To help us meet our pre-production and Sep 8 shoot day costs of $3113, we gladly welcome contributions via PayPal to vixen_noir@hotmail.com and Venmo to @Vixen-Noir. This will allow us more immediate access to funding, and ensure a successful project. THANK YOU.)
All we need to fulfill this project is $5,500. After much research, negotiation, juggled schedules and more I found the most reasonable resources possible (from super discounted to volunteer) and a shoot date that fits everybody’s schedule! Whew! September 8, 2018 is the day! We have everything in place and ready to go. Now all we need is your support to make it happen. From $5 to $5000, every amount counts! Your patronage will help cover the following costs:
For the Remix 

DJ/Producer (to remix the song)
Artist fees for the feature rap artists
Recording studio time
Mastering the finished remix
Cover art design
Distribution (online stores and music sites incl. iTunes, Amazon, Spotify, iHeart Radio, etc.)
Promotion (online and release party)

For the Music Video

Video Producer/Cameraman/Editor
Stipends for 8 video cast members
Space rental (pre-shoot workshop & day of shoot green/dressing room)
Craft services (food & beverages for pre-shoot workshop & day of shoot)
Supplies/Materials (Poster boards, markers, glue, first aid kit, etc.)
Costumes (incl. a crown for each cast member and additional costume items and accessories)

PERKS!
To show our appreciation, we have some great perks lined up! Downloads of the remix and/or the music video before released to the world; special limited design MothaFucka T-shirts, behind-the-scenes photos of the cast in action, and more! For a $5000 contribution, you can be the Executive Producer of this project, be credited as so on the remix and the music video, along with other special perks. And for $300 you can sponsor a cast member to be in the music video, ensuring her voice is heard; including costume needs, local roundtrip transportation to and from shoot, meals/beverages and a stipend. How awesome is that?! MORE PERKS COMING!
THE IMPACT WE HOPE FOR
With the current climate of ongoing police brutality, discrimination, institutional and societal racism and transphobia, hate crimes and the alarming number of Black transwomen being murdered, it is our hope that the MothaFucka Remix Project can make a difference. It is our hope that through this project, we are able to reflect and uplift the brilliance, beauty, strength and power of Black Transwomen and resonate the message, #BlackTransWomensLivesMatter, loud and clear to the world!
We are all 200% committed to this project, and would be ecstatic to have you be a part of this journey with us! If we are not able to raise the entire $5500, the quality, the content and the participation of all who are committed to this project will be greatly compromised and we may not be able to effectively bring it to fruition, if at all.
However, if you aren’t able to contribute at this time, don’t fret! SPREADING THE WORD is a HUGE help. Indiegogo makes it really easy for you to share this campaign with your community via social media and email. I know that if we all pull together in strength and numbers, we will be successful!
Thank you.
With love and gratitude…
Vixen and the MF Remix Project Crew

story:
The Music

I've been lucky enough to be in a place where I'm surrounded by incredible musicians, producers, and artists I get to call friends. We've all put so much heart and soul into this project already, and I hope you all get to see how much passion we have! This album is something new for me. It's a fun and funky project that ties in many different genres and writing styles. It has some songs that will make you dance, and some tunes that will make you really think. I'm excited to share it with you all!

Your Support

Your support is crucial to make sure this album is the best it can be!

Our Goal:   1,500

What We Do With Your Support:   It goes to studio time, musician compensation, artwork, mixing, and mastering.

Challenges

The album will have to be put on hold until I can make the funds for this project.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support the project financially, no worries! Come to a show, share a post, follow me on Spotify and social media @katelizabeth108!

story:
Ok!!! So to kick this AMAZING project off the ground we only need 840 people to donate $1 $1!!!! thats just one whole dollarly doo!!! Woo, not much...or one generous donater can donate $420...fourtwenty!!!... twice

So you ask….what are you doing with ma dollar! I worked hard for that dollar!

Yes, yes you did.

So, Preemo Trash and I are introducing to this Grand City of BrisVegas the Roving Ravers...or the Raving Rovers….its your Burn Baby.

So what is Roving Ravers???

Inspired by the San Francisco Decentralised Dance Party (DDP), the DJ is connected to a transmitter which is transmitting a radio signal. The radio signial is being received by 30+ Boom boxes making the streets JUMP and BUMP and CRUMP!!!

OK! Good, you’re still with me? Next we assemble! In our funkiest get up and/or whatever the heck we want to dress in to express ourselves however we want!

And then we Rove! And We Rave! We take the boom boxes where ever we want (Preemo and myself are already organising a few different routes we can take and places we can stop in at!!!

If you know what this is, you’ll love it! If you dont know what this is….you’ll possibly love it more because its something new and fun for you!!!

$20 and up gets you the opportunity to personalize one of these Boom Boxes and give it your own unique flavour!

Any other questions about how this will work contact myself (Halfy) Or Preemo Trash!

Thanks For Your Assistence.

There is fun to be done

story:
Beat 106 Scotland

In November 1999 Scotland's Music Revolution playing Today's Best Music was launched. It was the station that featured some of Scotland's best home grown DJs and produced some of the most memorable club nights in Scotland.

How do I know ? I was there. My name is Richard Wilkinson and I helped launch Beat 106 back in 1999. It's time to bring the hugely influential brand back into the Scottish music and radio landscape.

This campaign is to bring the station back initially as an app and online based radio station so that everyone can listen to the station non just in Central Scotland but everywhere and anywhere.

Whether you were there at Club 106 nights across Scotland's premier clubs listening to Trevor Reilly, Stevie Kerr, Lisa Littlewood, Paul Mendez, Colin Tevendale, Simon Foy, Scott Mackay and many more. Whether you were at T in the Park listening to the Beat Bus in the campsite. Whether you were at Love Beat Live or any of the live events that Beat 106 hosted, it was THE radio brand that defined a generation of young Scots before it was sold (to the English !). Scotland needs it radio identity back and Beat 106 will be the station for all dance music lovers but we need you to make it happen !

What We Need & What You Get

Building a radio station sadly costs money but it needn't cost the earth:

We would like £25,000 to build a station that includes building the app to listen to the station and to design website for you to listen to it too. We need equipment, a play out system and the requisite technology to get that radio station on air and into your ears ! Any extra money raised will go to live events we have planned through 2020 and beyond. If we raise a massive amount more than the £25,000 target we'll look to developing a basic permanent studio at a location in Central Scotland so that we can have guests, live DJs and so much more.

Everyone that contributes £30 or more gets 1 invite to our live launch event sometime in Q2 2020 at a time and location tbc.

Everyone that contributes £50 or more gets 2 invites to our live launch event sometime in Q2 2020 at a time and location tbc.

Everyone that contributes £100 or more gets 2 invite to all Beat 106 Scotland's proposed live events in 2020.

Anyone who donates £1000 or more and if the target reaches £100,000 or more will get a studio tour at some point in the future after the station launches. They will also get 2 invites for life to every Beat 106 Scotland event.

This radio station will go ahead whether the target is reached or not. All contributions are welcome and greatly received no matter how big or small.

Contributors who wish to go to our live events must be 18 years or over or fulfil the age requirements and restrictions of the requisite live music venues.

The Impact

Beat 106 made a massive social impact when launched in 1999 at it's peak it was listened to by over 500,000 listeners (Source RAJAR):

A radio station that you can take with you wherever you go.

A radio station made in Scotland, based in Scotland, with Scottish owners.

A music format that is no longer delivered on traditional analogue radio in Scotland.

A radio station without the same regulations that a traditional analogue station has.

Risks & Challenges

At the moment it's just one person planning on delivering this project. With your support I'd love to be able to hire live presenters (some of the DJs mentioned above and more), producers, sales staff. The original Beat 106 launched with a budget of nearly £2 million and was sold to a radio group in London less than year after launch for just under £34 million. It's a costly and complicated business launching and running a radio station but from small acorns we'll build an essential radio service for Scotland's dance music loving audience.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if you can't help financially, you can help by listening and by doing the following!

Spread the word, search for Beat 106 Scotland on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram and help us raise money by sharing this page or simply click these links below"

Instagram - www.instagram.com/beat106scotland/

Twitter - www.twitter.com/Beat106Scotland

Facebook - www.facebook.com/Beat106Scotland/

Website - www.beat106scotland.com

E-mail us at info@beat106scotland.com for more details !

Save www.beat106scotland.com in your website bookmarks.

Download the app when it launches in Q2 2020 and listen !

I can't wait to bring this amazing radio station back and for you to enjoy listening to it.

I can't wait to bring this amazing radio station back and for you to enjoy listening to it.

story:
FEED TOUR - PERUGIA - DOMENICA 12 APRILE 2015 H.15.00

Domenica 12 Aprile 2015 alle ore 15.00 al locale 100dieci Cafè in collaborazione con Radiophonica, SECONDA TAPPA del Feed Tour, il primo spettacolo itinerante sul mondo di Youtube, realizzato da Tallio Netto, Dellimellow, Boban Pesov, Bob e HdTutorials.

Uno spettacolo di 2 ore ma non solo...

Infatti compreso nell'ingresso di 12 euro, a parte lo spettacolo, ci sarà un buffet visto che l'orario dello show si presta per un aperitivo collettivo.

PROGRAMMA 

Dellimellow e Tallio Netto realizzeranno 3 interventi ciascuno, mentre Boban Pesov disegnerà due vignette. Inoltre come OSPITE SPECIALE avremo DARIO MOCCIA che realizzerà due interventi deliziando la platea.

A fine giornata, verranno estratti a sorte alcuni partecipanti all'evento e vinceranno le vignette disegnate da Boban Pesov.

La tappa di Perugia vedrà come presentatore BOB che avrà l'onore di iniziare e terminare la serata.

ARGOMENTI TRATTATI

DARIO MOCCIA

1 - Youtube : Fumetti e Razzismo

2 - Il fallimento dei contenuti di qualità su Youtube

DELLIMELLOW

1 - Spam: da Carl Marx a Daniele Andreani

2 - Da grandi poteri derivano grandi responsabilità

3 - Rumble in the Jungle - Youtuber vs Facebook Star

TALLIO NETTO

1 - La mano delle psicosette sul mondo di Youtube, come riconoscerle in poche facili mosse 

2 - Youtube Story : La principessina Gemma Del Sud 

3 - Da Youtuber a Giorgio Mastrota

BOBAN PESOV

1 - Morte definitiva del Creator

2 - Satira su Youtube?

BOB

1 - Intro e fine serata sul tema " Content Creator "

INFORMAZIONI GENERALI

100dieci Cafè , Via Alessandro Pascoli 22, Perugia

http://www.100dieci.it/

Contatti : feedtour@gmail.com

Radiphonica http://www.radiophonica.com/

IMPORTANTE!!!

Nel momento dell'acquisto dell'ingresso, completate coi vostri dati reali in modo che il 12 Aprile siate in lista per accedere allo spettacolo.

In caso di cessione dell'ingresso acquistato ad amici o di altri problemi contattate lo staff alla mail 

feedtour@gmail.com

NON SARÀ POSSIBILE ACCEDERE SENZA AVER PRIMA ACQUISTATO L'INGRESSO TRAMITE L'INDIEGOGO.

NON SI PUÒ ACQUISTARE L'INGRESSO IL GIORNO DELLO SPETTACOLO

BUS ( MILANO - PERUGIA e ROMA - PERUGIA )

Per coloro che sono interessati a venire alla tappa di Perugia e abitano nei pressi di Milano e Roma, stiamo organizzando dei bus che partiranno dalle due città e arriveranno al locale per poi portarvi a casa dopo lo spettacolo.
Il servizio è a pagamento ( in base al numero di richieste ) e garantito al raggiungimento di un numero minimo di posti.
Per info sui costi e orari, contattate BOB alla mail
hello@liuzzosfactory.com

L'evento è garantito al raggiungimento di almeno 250 posti sui 300.
In caso di non raggiungimento della quota minima, tutti i soldi verranno restituiti automaticamente dal sito

story:
BETH MCKENNA JAZZ ORCHESTRA - HOME: MONTRÉAL - HELP US RECORD THE WHOLE SUITE!


Beth McKenna Jazz Orchestra - "START" (FIRST recording) - Live Premiere January 8th, 2015 - Sala Rossa

Beth McKenna Jazz Orchestra - "Home: Montréal" (SECOND recording) - Live Premiere March 24, 2016 - L'Astral


(BMJO's "START" Premiere - Recording Release - January 2015)

START is available for FREE DOWNLOAD on www.bethmckenna.ca and SoundCloud!

MONTREAL'S PUBLIC REACTION TO BMJO'S FIRST RECORDING - "START"!
"TOP 3 - MONTREAL JAZZ ARTIST OF THE YEAR 2015" - CAMUZ
"TOP 5 - BEST JAZZ ACT - MONTREAL - 2015" - CULTMTL

--------------------------------

Beth McKenna Jazz Orchestra is premiering an exciting brand new suite (seven movements) in March 2016. An original jazz-rock fusion work written by McKenna, "Home: Montréal" features an 18 piece ensemble of some of Montreal's most in demand and versatile musicians, including Grand Prix du Jazz 2015 (FIJM) winner, Rachel Therrien. 

The suite reflects on 7 inspirational, iconic and influential locations in the city. We need your help to record all seven movements (7 tracks) so we may record the full suite to share, instead of a 4-track incomplete-suite studio demo recording to give to help get this work shared internationally in conjunction with our live premiere on March 24th, 2016! 

We've decided that we need to surpass the requirements of our grant project (4 tracks for the CALQ), since that would produce an incomplete CD, so we are working via crowdfunding to record the remainder of the music written for this project, still releasing it to the public for easy access (free platforms) as of March 24th, 2016. Without your help, this can't happen!

----------------------------------

Band Members - "Home: Montréal" - 2016

Musical Director/Compositions - Beth McKenna

Saxes:
Alexandre Dion (Lead Alto Sax, Soprano Sax, Flute)
Genevieve Gauthier (Alto Sax, Flute)
Annie Dominique (Tenor Sax, Clarinet)
Claire Devlin (Tenor Sax, Clarinet)
Paul Carter (Bari Sax, Bass Clarinet, Clarinet)

Trumpets:
Dominic Rossi (Lead Trumpet)
Frédéric Bourgeault (Trumpet)
Rachel Therrien (Trumpet)
Martine Labbé (Trumpet)
Rémi Cormier (Trumpet)

Trombones:
Taylor Donaldson (Lead Trombone)
Karine Gordon (Trombone)
Hélene Lemay (Trombone)
Christopher Smith (Bass Trombone/Tuba)

Rhythm:
François Jalbert (Guitar, Effects)
Jonathan Turgeon (Piano, Synth, Effects)
Émile Farley (Electric Bass)
Peter Colantonio (Drums)

----------------------------------

Help Beth McKenna Jazz Orchestra debut "Home: Montréal" as a full-length 7-track recorded suite!

Number of tracks for Home: Montréal as a full suite = 7 tracks (2 sessions)

Funding are needed to produce 3 more tracks, one more day of studio--to record the ENTIRE suite of "Home: Montréal" for sharing worldwide and promoting/further growing this project---while also promoting jazz-rock/contemporary jazz fusion as a new genre! (2 recording sessions)

Funding shortfall needed to record and produce the three tracks (Movement 3, 4 and 6) needed to complete "Home: Montréal" as a professional artistic project --- with all 7 tracks -----before the launch on March 24th, 2016: $7,500

---------------------------------

ABOUT THE PROJECT ---------

MONTREAL. One of the most incredible cities in the world. Bilingual,
multicultural, historically colourful and unique its own from any other place on the planet. Inspirational and the driving force for Beth McKenna Jazz Orchestra's (BMJO) newest work, "HOME: MONTRÉAL".


Photo credit - B. McKenna

Moving forward from our first non-commercial demo recording CD, "START", which was inspired mainly by life experiences and transitional periods, Home: Montréal is a completely new work that observes Montréal in a very unique perspective and illustrates it as seven jazz-rock soundscapes of the city, in dynamic, energetic and epic music of multiple genres that changes and transforms throughout each movement. 

The music of Home: Montréal brings Montreal via very colourful and textural musical illustration to the concert hall and listeners anywhere in the world. With 7 inspirational and very unique places in the city represented, listeners all over the world can get explore the incredible city from McKenna's music and soundscapes in "Home: Montréal".

BMJO is recording our 2nd project, "Home: Montreal", over an hour of epic, adventurous contemporary-jazz/cinematic jazz music for 18-piece jazz orchestra, bringing together many of Canada's greatest upcoming professional musicians based in Montreal, QC. 

The piece is composed through seven movements (musical chapters), developed and interpreted by Montreal musicians and performers, but the piece is challenging, intense, demanding and one that stands out from other jazz orchestra literature in such a unique way, with driving indie rock, jazz, pop, groove and popular music influences.

Photo credit - B. McKenna

How would we describe "Home: Montreal"? - Home: Montreal is inspired by Darcy James Argue's Brooklyn Babylon in concept---being a multi-movement work that illustrates a perspective artistically through music. Home: Montreal breaks away from the "norms" in big band, away from the "old-school" traditional and classic sound of Duke Ellington, Count Basie and Glenn Miller, towards pulling in influences of rock, indie, fusion, groove, R&B, soul and modern contemporary jazz. Beth's compositions are written to reach wider audiences, creating greater demand for jazz as a genre and sustainability for jazz musicians. 

The purpose of Home: Montreal is to create a piece that takes the listener to the city without leaving the concert hall, and illustrates the city for any listener, regardless having ever visited Montreal. The music is open to interpretation, and BMJO's development of this work makes it an authentically Montréal performance, 100%, by the professional artists who live and thrive here. 

Photo credit - B. McKenna

The music, which changes and evolves dramatically as an adventure through each movement, thrills listeners and engages them with changing through-composition and soaring textures throughout the work... each movement a multi-section work of its own. Beth employs the use of electronics, effects, modern non-traditional jazz orchestra writing practices and new contemporary techniques to further extend her writing palette in this work. Beth's writing style is very unique, pushing her musicians in their abilities, their stylistic and artistic performance and in their work together as an ensemble, many of them working together for the first time.

We've run into a VERY CHALLENGING situation with this project, and we need to ask for YOUR help!!---  The work for developing, composing and producing "Home: Montréal" has evolved and developed into so much more so quickly from it's initial conception and planning, to the full seven movements that it is today, that we need to ask the public for their support so we can present this project and share it with audiences as a full work, in it's full format!

Our current project budget allows only for one day of recording in the studio, and our newest work, "Home: Montréal", will need at absolute minimum, two days of studio for the full ensemble in order to record all seven tracks! (This doesn't include separate small sessions to track overdubs and some of the solos if needed!) 



Photo Credit - R. MacDowell


HOME: MONTRÉAL ------------------------------------------

Our 2nd recording will feature seven tracks that features many members of BMJO, including prominent recognized Quebec artists including: 

Rachel Therrien (Winner - Grand Prix du Jazz 2015 - Montreal Jazz Festival, Rachel Therrien Quintet), 

Jonathan Turgeon (Jonathan Turgeon Trio), 

Alexandre Dion (Kalmunity), 

Claire Devlin (McGill Jazz Orchestra I), 

Annie Dominique (Annie Dominique Quintet), 

François Jalbert (Tunnel, John Jacob Magistery) and 

Rémi Cormier (Nikki Yanofsky, The Liquor Store). 

Christopher Smith (Orchestre Symphonique de Sherbrooke, Faculty - Vanier College Music Program)

Beth McKenna Jazz Orchestra has in the past, included former Montreal-based members who have also led promising careers in the Canadian jazz scene including 

Guillaume Martineau (Revelations CBC Radio-Canada 2015-16), 

Simon Pagé (Bernard Adamus, Joel Miller), 

Hichem Khalfa (Kalmunity, The Brooks, Hichem Khalfa Quintet) and 

Averil Parker (Averil Parker Quartet, Montreal Backbeat Showband).


Background Information on BMJO and "Home: Montréal"

  • BMJO was founded and established by Beth McKenna in June 2013 at the age of 23, soon after graduation from McGill's Schulich School of Music with a Bachelor of Music (Jazz Sax) and Bachelor of Education, at a crossroads and wanting to make a positive and big difference in the jazz community while establishing herself as a big band leader. 
  • Now into this project's third year, we're looking for some extra funding and help from all of our supporters, to make our goals for our second project a full-length reality and deliver top-quality music and production quality that will take this project to the next level and beyond! 
  • The music is entirely written by McKenna, and BMJO features musicians who are some of the most versatile and skilled players in the city---who perform professionally on a regular basis in symphony orchestras, musical theatre, jazz, rock, R&B, improvisational music, classical, who are leaders of their own ensembles, writing and producing their own music.

Photo Credit: R. MacDowell

  • This project was funded by the Conseil des Arts et Lettres du Quebec's "Grants for Up-and-Coming Artists: Music" for TWO consecutive years 2013-14 and 2014-15 in the "Up-and-Coming Artists - Music - Creation/Exploration/ Research" grants, but in order to fully record this full suite to the best it can possibly be this year and fully share it with everyone, we need to record over two days (7 tracks totalling over one hour of music).

  • This project's CALQ grant budget covers recording for one day---which only will allow time for 4 tracks to be recorded... we want to instead record a full-length suite spanning the entire suite of "Home: Montreal", consisting of 7 tracks, over an hour of intense contemporary-jazz/fusion music for this all-Canadian, professional large jazz ensemble.
  • This recording will be used for sharing and audience development with the public, for promotion and booking of future concerts and festival bookings as well as future grant-funded initiatives and development for this ensemble. The recording will also be shared as much as possible worldwide on non-commercial platforms after March 24th, the premiere date for "Home: Montréal".

  • This project is far from anything else that has been experienced in Montreal, and is a huge initiative in Montreal's arts and cultural scene. The project has involved many of Montreal's freelance musicians from different generations as rehearsal subs and collaborators, benefitting more than the 18 musicians involved in the core ensemble.
  • This project has received support, influence and mentorship from some of the best jazz artists in the Canadian and NYC communities, working with: 
  • 2x GRAMMY Nominee Darcy James Argue (Darcy James Argue's Secret Society)
  • 2x JUNO award winner Christine Jensen (L'Orchestre Nationale de Jazz de Montréal, Christine Jensen Jazz Orchestra)
  • GRAMMY award winning composer Jim McNeely (Thad Jones, Mel Lewis Big Band, Vanguard Jazz Orchestra, BMI Composers Workshop) and 
  • Montreal's own John Roney (Effendi Jazzlab, John Roney Trio). 
  • I've also received inspiration and influence from meeting in person with GRAMMY award winning bandleader and composer, Maria Schneider as well in NYC in November 2015, discussing the project and writing. 
  • My writing and the music in the project can be best described as a mix of contemporary jazz influences (Brad Mehldau, Christine Jensen, Maria Schneider, Pat Metheny, Keith Jarrett, Radiohead, Donny McCaslin), mixed together with popular music idioms to reach wider audiences and to take the listeners on an intense, driven and adventurous soundscapes visit through Montreal, without leaving the concert hall. 
  • The music has drastically evolved and become much more focused, intense and colourful from START, where we grew as musicians, artists and performers--as well as myself as a composer and bandleader.
  • With your help and financial support for this project, I'm really excited to make this a reality and tell the full story about Montreal through music, rather than a short, intense 3-4 track, dramatic cliffhanger of a recording, that cuts the ensemble short on showing and sharing the full compositional and very colourful, epic and adventurous work of Home: Montréal!

What We Need & What You Get--------------

  • We need your support for funding support and the financial backing for a second session of recording studio time, so we can record and finish this project in its full setting. 
  • This means the money to pay the fees for hiring the 18 professional BMJO musicians for a second studio session (+$ for studio rental + engineers), plus the mixing, mastering, production and other fees associated with producing a recording project with 19 musicians! 
  • We want you (the audience and listeners!!!) to be a part of this!! We want to share this incredible experience with you as much as we possibly can!

    Your help and support, is the only way that Home: Montréal will become a full-length 7-track complete recording of the entire suite--- a project extension from the growth of our initial four tracks ---while simultaneously building awareness and support for this project!

PERKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT!--------------

-------------The band and I are offering lots of cool BMJO project perks as a small thank you for your support, to help fund a second recording session to track this full suite---So we can share the whole thing with the Montreal public as well as listeners around the world!-------------


  • "START" - $5 - A special thanks on www.bethmckenna.ca!
  • "1-WEEK-SNEAK-PEEK" - $15 - HEAR 3 "Home: Montréal" MOVEMENTS BEFORE THE PREMIERE! + Website thanks!
  • "HOME: MONTRÉAL" - $25 - HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + Website thanks!
  • "DEPARTURE" - $50 -  HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + AND BAND-SIGNED CONCERT POSTER + Website thanks!
  • "PIE-IX/VIAU" - $100 - 1hr LESSON W/BETH (Sax, Clarinet, Flute, Composition, Improv, Theory) + HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + BAND-SIGNED CONCERT POSTER + Website thanks!
  • "IN-PERSON SNEAK PEEK!" - $100 - INVITATION TO BMJO REHEARSAL + HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + SIGNED CONCERT POSTER + Website thanks!
  • "PLATEAU-MONT-ROYAL" - $150 - LESSON + REHEARSAL + HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + SIGNED POSTER + Website thanks!
  • "OLD PORT/OLD MONTREAL" - $250 - 1 SCORE + PARTS FROM HOME: MONTREAL OR START, BMJO REHEARSAL OR PRIVATE LESSON + A FULL PREVIEW OF THE SUITE: ALL TRACKS for "Home: Montreal", RELEASED 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + SIGNED POSTER + Website thanks!
  • "AFTERNOON IN PARC LAFONTAINE" - $300 - 2 COMPLIMENTARY VIP RESERVED-SEATING TICKETS TO "HOME: MONTRÉAL PREMIERE" + THANKS PRINTED IN CD LINER NOTES + INVITATION TO BMJO REHEARSAL + HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + SIGNED POSTER + Website thanks!
  • "CUSTOM COMPOSITION" - $400 - NEW WORK WRITTEN FOR YOU (FOR QUARTET, REHEARSAL RECORDING, FINISHED SHEET MUSIC PROVIDED), 2 COMPLIMENTARY VIP RESERVED-SEATING TICKETS TO "HOME: MONTRÉAL PREMIERE" + THANKS IN CD LINER NOTES + INVITATION TO BMJO REHEARSAL + HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + SIGNED POSTER + Website thanks!
  • "WE TAKE REQUESTS!" - $500 - ARRANGEMENT OF ANY PIECE OF YOUR CHOICE (Pop, rock, R&B, classical, etc. etc. etc., by any artist), FOR JAZZ QUARTET (lead sheet and rehearsal recording provided) + 2 COMPLIMENTARY VIP RESERVED-SEATING TICKETS TO "HOME: MONTRÉAL PREMIERE" + THANKS PRINTED IN CD LINER NOTES + INVITATION TO BMJO REHEARSAL + HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + SIGNED POSTER + Website thanks!
  • "DOWNTOWN" - $1,000 - Beth McKenna QUARTET PRIVATE CONCERT (in-person venue must be 1.5hrs from Montreal... No USA--can perform concert via Skype) + 4 COMPLIMENTARY VIP RESERVED-SEATING TICKETS TO "HOME: MONTRÉAL PREMIERE" + INVITATION TO BMJO REHEARSAL + HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + SIGNED POSTER + Website thanks!
  • "ARRIVAL" - $2,000 - ASSOCIATE PRODUCER CREDIT ON CD + INVITATION TO 2nd RECORDING SESSION + 4 COMPLIMENTARY VIP RESERVED-SEATING TICKETS TO "HOME: MONTRÉAL PREMIERE" + INVITATION TO BMJO REHEARSAL + HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + SIGNED POSTER + Website thanks!
  • "ELE(CTRO)PHANT" - $3,500 - BM JAZZ ORCHESTRA - ARRANGEMENT OF A PIECE OF YOUR CHOICE (Any piece at all of your choice, any genre, artist, etc.) - RECORDED IN REHEARSAL (with score and parts provided) + ASSOCIATE PRODUCER CREDIT + 4 COMPLIMENTARY VIP RESERVED-SEATING TICKETS TO "HOME: MONTRÉAL PREMIERE" + INVITATION TO BMJO REHEARSAL + HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + Website thanks!
  • "DECISION FOR OTHERS (YOU!)" - $5,000 - HOME: MONTRÉAL, 8TH MOVEMENT WRITTEN ABOUT A LOCATION IN MONTREAL OF YOUR CHOICE. INCLUDES SCORE AND PARTS, PERFORMED AT LAUNCH ON MARCH 24th + LIVE CONCERT RECORDING + ASSOCIATE PRODUCER CREDIT + 6 COMPLIMENTARY VIP RESERVED-SEATING TICKETS TO "HOME: MONTRÉAL PREMIERE" + INVITATION TO BMJO REHEARSAL + HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + SIGNED POSTER + Website thanks!
  • "BMJO - DIEHARD FAN!" - $7,500 - PRODUCER CREDIT, PERSONAL INVITATION TO 2ND RECORDING SESSION + HARD-BOUND COPIES OF ALL OF THE FULL-ENSEMBLE SCORES + PARTS TO EITHER "HOME: MONTRÉAL" OR "START" +  6 COMPLIMENTARY VIP RESERVED-SEATING TICKETS TO "HOME: MONTRÉAL PREMIERE" + INVITATION TO BMJO REHEARSAL + HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! +  SIGNED POSTER + Website thanks!
  • "BMJO - EXECUTIVE PRODUCER" - $10,000 - EXECUTIVE PRODUCER CREDIT ON CD. LIVE BMJO PRIVATE CONCERT, PERFORMING REPERTOIRE FROM START AND HOME: MONTRÉAL + HARD-BOUND COPIES OF ALL OF THE FULL-ENSEMBLE SCORES AND PARTS TO HOME: MONTRÉAL AND START (ALL SIGNED BY BETH) + PERSONAL INVITATION TO 2ND RECORDING SESSION + 8 COMPLIMENTARY VIP RESERVED-SEATING TICKETS TO "HOME: MONTRÉAL PREMIERE" + HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! +  SIGNED POSTER + Website thanks!

The Costs To Make "Home: Montréal" a Full 7 Track Recording: 


PROFESSIONAL MUSICIANS: $3600 dollars+ (Paying 18 BMJO musicians an honourarium for their time and efforts on the project)

STUDIO TIME: $1500 dollars+ (Rental: Studio Piccolo, Montreal - 1 day with full ensemble, trumpet soloist overdubs: Doxas Studios)

EDITING/MIXING/MASTERING: $600 dollars+

REHEARSAL STUDIO RENTAL: $400 dollars+ (Depending on rehearsal hours required to prepare music for recording)

CD PRODUCTION/PRINTING: $800 dollars+ (CD is included free for guests at the March 24th premiere, and to use for further promotion, festivals, venue performances, growth and development grants for this group--available free online after the 24th)

OTHER PRODUCTION & PROJECT PROMOTION FEES: $$$+++++
INDIEGOGO FEES: ~7-10%


STRETCH GOALS-----------------------


If we were to surpass our goal....---there's more that can be done with this project!

$500 above goal ---- Funding for professional quality video production of a concert video of "Home: Montréal" at L'Astral as promotional and development material for future BMJO concerts. (Legato Productions)

$1,000 above goal ---- BMJO premiere concert shot with 360 degree camera. (Legato Productions) - One of the first jazz concerts to be filmed in 360 degrees, fully immersive video experience online, available for free worldwide on YouTube.

$2,000 above goal ---- Booking additional "encore" concert later in 2016 in Montreal at Salle de Gésu or the Segal Centre for the Performing Arts, with additional new repertoire.

$3,500 above goal ---- BMJO performance booked in 5e Salle for early 2017 (Place des Arts), with additional new repertoire.

$6,000 above goal ---- BMJO performance in Toronto, Quebec City or Sherbrooke, with additional new repertoire.

$10,000 above goal ---- Record "Heading West" or "Ele(ctro)phant" as a single, in studio with string quartet. (See video)
$15,000+ above goal ---- Collaborate with professional videographers to re-create Home: Montréal as an evolved multidisciplinary project --- projected video, set to musical collaboration.

Photo for "Home: Montréal" - Photo - Tam Lan Truong


Taken at our "START" premiere at Sala Rossa  - Photo Credit - Eric Berteau - Camuz.ca


The Impact----------------

This project is one that is unlike anything else in the music industry today, but "Home: Montréal" was initially inspired from Darcy James Argue's Brooklyn Babylon in general broad concept of programmatic music inspired by visual subjects and re-telling stories through music. The idea behind our music is to engage our audiences, to fuse rock, pop, contemporary jazz, groove, world, and film music... with the big band! 

OUR GOAL: We're taking Jazz Orchestra and modern contemporary jazz back to the mainstream, performing music that is multiple-genres, reshaping jazz away from the classic tradition and building it as a popular genre! We want to make big band and jazz orchestras popular again, especially by sharing our music with listeners who typically follow mainstream artists. The band is an incredibly diverse cross-section of the Montréal jazz scene, featuring men and women, a split of anglophones/francophones and an all-Canadian roster of regular members of the band!

By contributing to this, BMJO's 2nd project, not only will you be supporting Montreal artists, but helping with a monumental and very unique MONTREAL-based and inspired musical work to reach audiences worldwide. Releasing the suite with only 4 tracks will leave it representing only "half" of the suite I originally wrote, inspired by 7 places in the city.

  • This project is one of the most innovative jazz projects that pushes towards the mainstream music community in Montreal, to date
  • Is unique to the incredible city of Montreal, but the music of the project is so diverse, multifaceted and accessible/multi-genres, that it will attract audiences beyond those who are jazz listeners. 
  • Continued success after BMJO's first recording, "START", with a complete evolution in the ensemble's sound, Beth's writing and musical style.
  • Will help to affect change in the jazz community and expand on jazz as a style and genre.

Risks and Challenges----------------

Like any project, there are risks and challenges. 

  • We have the networks, connections, presence and reputation on the Montreal and Canadian music scene to have this music distributed and to make a great impact!
  • If we fall short on funding, we will only be able to record an extra track or two to make it an incomplete recording of the suite to share, instead of all 7... means we would be doing a partial day in studio, etc. 

January 2015 interview with Richard Dagenais, Global Montreal Morning News

  • We have STRONG professional connections with major media and communications links for solid promotion of this project via social media, radio, TV, YouTube, BandCamp, online distribution, and internet radio. We have already started to develop a following for this ensemble. This suite is one that is intense, emotional, driving, epic, and adventurous, featuring some of Montreal's top artists in the jazz community, it will continue to receive airplay and a following. 
  • From START, BMJO was named in the Top 3 for "Montreal Jazz Artist of the Year 2015" - CAMUZ and Top 5 for "Best Jazz Act" - CultMtl. With Home: Montréal, we will only grow from here! Home: Montréal is a HUGE evolution from START, and we cannot wait to premiere this to the public!

  • Results - Montreal Jazz Artist of the Year 2015 - CAMUZ.ca


Other Ways You Can Help Make This a Success!!! ---

Not able to contribute financially to help us get to our goal and record this as a full 7-track CD? There's still other ways in which you can help!

  • Share our video and this campaign on social media (Twitter, FB, Instagram, Pinterest, via e-mail, etc.)! We REALLY need the word out to get this finished!
  • Pass this along to media/bloggers/TV/Radio outlets (ESPECIALLY in Montreal and in the Canadian jazz scene!) to get the word out!
  • Plan to come to the March 24th premiere of Home: Montreal at L'Astral, and invite your friends to come with you! - TICKETS ARE AVAILABLE online and at L'Astral as of February 1st, 2016!
Thank you so much, we're grateful for the support in helping us reach our funding goal! We look forward to premiering "Home: Montreal" live, at L'Astral on March 24th, 2016!
