BETH MCKENNA JAZZ ORCHESTRA - HOME: MONTRÉAL - HELP US RECORD THE WHOLE SUITE!


Beth McKenna Jazz Orchestra - "START" (FIRST recording) - Live Premiere January 8th, 2015 - Sala Rossa



Beth McKenna Jazz Orchestra - "Home: Montréal" (SECOND recording) - Live Premiere March 24, 2016 - L'Astral




(BMJO's "START" Premiere - Recording Release - January 2015)


START is available for FREE DOWNLOAD on www.bethmckenna.ca and SoundCloud!



MONTREAL'S PUBLIC REACTION TO BMJO'S FIRST RECORDING - "START"!"TOP 3 - MONTREAL JAZZ ARTIST OF THE YEAR 2015" - CAMUZ"TOP 5 - BEST JAZZ ACT - MONTREAL - 2015" - CULTMTL
--------------------------------
Beth McKenna Jazz Orchestra is premiering an exciting brand new suite (seven movements) in March 2016. An original jazz-rock fusion work written by McKenna, "Home: Montréal" features an 18 piece ensemble of some of Montreal's most in demand and versatile musicians, including Grand Prix du Jazz 2015 (FIJM) winner, Rachel Therrien. 
The suite reflects on 7 inspirational, iconic and influential locations in the city. We need your help to record all seven movements (7 tracks) so we may record the full suite to share, instead of a 4-track incomplete-suite studio demo recording to give to help get this work shared internationally in conjunction with our live premiere on March 24th, 2016! 
We've decided that we need to surpass the requirements of our grant project (4 tracks for the CALQ), since that would produce an incomplete CD, so we are working via crowdfunding to record the remainder of the music written for this project, still releasing it to the public for easy access (free platforms) as of March 24th, 2016. Without your help, this can't happen!
----------------------------------

Musical Director/Compositions - Beth McKenna

Saxes:Alexandre Dion (Lead Alto Sax, Soprano Sax, Flute)Genevieve Gauthier (Alto Sax, Flute)Annie Dominique (Tenor Sax, Clarinet)Claire Devlin (Tenor Sax, Clarinet)Paul Carter (Bari Sax, Bass Clarinet, Clarinet)

Trumpets:Dominic Rossi (Lead Trumpet)Frédéric Bourgeault (Trumpet)Rachel Therrien (Trumpet)Martine Labbé (Trumpet)Rémi Cormier (Trumpet)

Trombones:Taylor Donaldson (Lead Trombone)Karine Gordon (Trombone)Hélene Lemay (Trombone)Christopher Smith (Bass Trombone/Tuba)

Rhythm:François Jalbert (Guitar, Effects)Jonathan Turgeon (Piano, Synth, Effects)Émile Farley (Electric Bass)Peter Colantonio (Drums)

Averil Parker (Averil Parker Quartet, Montreal Backbeat Showband).


Background Information on BMJO and "Home: Montréal"

BMJO was founded and established by Beth McKenna in June 2013 at the age of 23, soon after graduation from McGill's Schulich School of Music with a Bachelor of Music (Jazz Sax) and Bachelor of Education, at a crossroads and wanting to make a positive and big difference in the jazz community while establishing herself as a big band leader. 


Now into this project's third year, we're looking for some extra funding and help from all of our supporters, to make our goals for our second project a full-length reality and deliver top-quality music and production quality that will take this project to the next level and beyond! 
The music is entirely written by McKenna, and BMJO features musicians who are some of the most versatile and skilled players in the city---who perform professionally on a regular basis in symphony orchestras, musical theatre, jazz, rock, R&B, improvisational music, classical, who are leaders of their own ensembles, writing and producing their own music.



Photo Credit: R. MacDowell


This project was funded by the Conseil des Arts et Lettres du Quebec's "Grants for Up-and-Coming Artists: Music" for TWO consecutive years 2013-14 and 2014-15 in the "Up-and-Coming Artists - Music - Creation/Exploration/ Research" grants, but in order to fully record this full suite to the best it can possibly be this year and fully share it with everyone, we need to record over two days (7 tracks totalling over one hour of music).
This project's CALQ grant budget covers recording for one day---which only will allow time for 4 tracks to be recorded... we want to instead record a full-length suite spanning the entire suite of "Home: Montreal", consisting of 7 tracks, over an hour of intense contemporary-jazz/fusion music for this all-Canadian, professional large jazz ensemble.


This recording will be used for sharing and audience development with the public, for promotion and booking of future concerts and festival bookings as well as future grant-funded initiatives and development for this ensemble. The recording will also be shared as much as possible worldwide on non-commercial platforms after March 24th, the premiere date for "Home: Montréal".




This project is far from anything else that has been experienced in Montreal, and is a huge initiative in Montreal's arts and cultural scene. The project has involved many of Montreal's freelance musicians from different generations as rehearsal subs and collaborators, benefitting more than the 18 musicians involved in the core ensemble.



This project has received support, influence and mentorship from some of the best jazz artists in the Canadian and NYC communities, working with: 
2x GRAMMY Nominee Darcy James Argue (Darcy James Argue's Secret Society)
2x JUNO award winner Christine Jensen (L'Orchestre Nationale de Jazz de Montréal, Christine Jensen Jazz Orchestra)
GRAMMY award winning composer Jim McNeely (Thad Jones, Mel Lewis Big Band, Vanguard Jazz Orchestra, BMI Composers Workshop) and 
Montreal's own John Roney (Effendi Jazzlab, John Roney Trio). 

I've also received inspiration and influence from meeting in person with GRAMMY award winning bandleader and composer, Maria Schneider as well in NYC in November 2015, discussing the project and writing. 



My writing and the music in the project can be best described as a mix of contemporary jazz influences (Brad Mehldau, Christine Jensen, Maria Schneider, Pat Metheny, Keith Jarrett, Radiohead, Donny McCaslin), mixed together with popular music idioms to reach wider audiences and to take the listeners on an intense, driven and adventurous soundscapes visit through Montreal, without leaving the concert hall. 



The music has drastically evolved and become much more focused, intense and colourful from START, where we grew as musicians, artists and performers--as well as myself as a composer and bandleader.




With your help and financial support for this project, I'm really excited to make this a reality and tell the full story about Montreal through music, rather than a short, intense 3-4 track, dramatic cliffhanger of a recording, that cuts the ensemble short on showing and sharing the full compositional and very colourful, epic and adventurous work of Home: Montréal!


   What We Need & What You Get-------------- We need your support for funding support and the financial backing for a second session of recording studio time, so we can record and finish this project in its full setting. 
This means the money to pay the fees for hiring the 18 professional BMJO musicians for a second studio session (+$ for studio rental + engineers), plus the mixing, mastering, production and other fees associated with producing a recording project with 19 musicians! 


We want you (the audience and listeners!!!) to be a part of this!! We want to share this incredible experience with you as much as we possibly can!Your help and support, is the only way that Home: Montréal will become a full-length 7-track complete recording of the entire suite--- a project extension from the growth of our initial four tracks ---while simultaneously building awareness and support for this project!




PERKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT!--------------

-------------The band and I are offering lots of cool BMJO project perks as a small thank you for your support, to help fund a second recording session to track this full suite---So we can share the whole thing with the Montreal public as well as listeners around the world!-------------


"START" - $5 - A special thanks on www.bethmckenna.ca!

"1-WEEK-SNEAK-PEEK" - $15 - HEAR 3 "Home: Montréal" MOVEMENTS BEFORE THE PREMIERE! + Website thanks!

"HOME: MONTRÉAL" - $25 - HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + Website thanks!


"DEPARTURE" - $50 -  HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + AND BAND-SIGNED CONCERT POSTER + Website thanks!


"PIE-IX/VIAU" - $100 - 1hr LESSON W/BETH (Sax, Clarinet, Flute, Composition, Improv, Theory) + HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + BAND-SIGNED CONCERT POSTER + Website thanks!

"IN-PERSON SNEAK PEEK!" - $100 - INVITATION TO BMJO REHEARSAL + HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + SIGNED CONCERT POSTER + Website thanks!

"PLATEAU-MONT-ROYAL" - $150 - LESSON + REHEARSAL + HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + SIGNED POSTER + Website thanks!


"OLD PORT/OLD MONTREAL" - $250 - 1 SCORE + PARTS FROM HOME: MONTREAL OR START, BMJO REHEARSAL OR PRIVATE LESSON + A FULL PREVIEW OF THE SUITE: ALL TRACKS for "Home: Montreal", RELEASED 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + SIGNED POSTER + Website thanks!


"AFTERNOON IN PARC LAFONTAINE" - $300 - 2 COMPLIMENTARY VIP RESERVED-SEATING TICKETS TO "HOME: MONTRÉAL PREMIERE" + THANKS PRINTED IN CD LINER NOTES + INVITATION TO BMJO REHEARSAL + HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + SIGNED POSTER + Website thanks!


"CUSTOM COMPOSITION" - $400 - NEW WORK WRITTEN FOR YOU (FOR QUARTET, REHEARSAL RECORDING, FINISHED SHEET MUSIC PROVIDED), 2 COMPLIMENTARY VIP RESERVED-SEATING TICKETS TO "HOME: MONTRÉAL PREMIERE" + THANKS IN CD LINER NOTES + INVITATION TO BMJO REHEARSAL + HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + SIGNED POSTER + Website thanks!

"WE TAKE REQUESTS!" - $500 - ARRANGEMENT OF ANY PIECE OF YOUR CHOICE (Pop, rock, R&B, classical, etc. etc. etc., by any artist), FOR JAZZ QUARTET (lead sheet and rehearsal recording provided) + 2 COMPLIMENTARY VIP RESERVED-SEATING TICKETS TO "HOME: MONTRÉAL PREMIERE" + THANKS PRINTED IN CD LINER NOTES + INVITATION TO BMJO REHEARSAL + HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + SIGNED POSTER + Website thanks!

"DOWNTOWN" - $1,000 - Beth McKenna QUARTET PRIVATE CONCERT (in-person venue must be 1.5hrs from Montreal... No USA--can perform concert via Skype) + 4 COMPLIMENTARY VIP RESERVED-SEATING TICKETS TO "HOME: MONTRÉAL PREMIERE" + INVITATION TO BMJO REHEARSAL + HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + SIGNED POSTER + Website thanks!


"ARRIVAL" - $2,000 - ASSOCIATE PRODUCER CREDIT ON CD + INVITATION TO 2nd RECORDING SESSION + 4 COMPLIMENTARY VIP RESERVED-SEATING TICKETS TO "HOME: MONTRÉAL PREMIERE" + INVITATION TO BMJO REHEARSAL + HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + SIGNED POSTER + Website thanks!


"ELE(CTRO)PHANT" - $3,500 - BM JAZZ ORCHESTRA - ARRANGEMENT OF A PIECE OF YOUR CHOICE (Any piece at all of your choice, any genre, artist, etc.) - RECORDED IN REHEARSAL (with score and parts provided) + ASSOCIATE PRODUCER CREDIT + 4 COMPLIMENTARY VIP RESERVED-SEATING TICKETS TO "HOME: MONTRÉAL PREMIERE" + INVITATION TO BMJO REHEARSAL + HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + Website thanks!


"DECISION FOR OTHERS (YOU!)" - $5,000 - HOME: MONTRÉAL, 8TH MOVEMENT WRITTEN ABOUT A LOCATION IN MONTREAL OF YOUR CHOICE. INCLUDES SCORE AND PARTS, PERFORMED AT LAUNCH ON MARCH 24th + LIVE CONCERT RECORDING + ASSOCIATE PRODUCER CREDIT + 6 COMPLIMENTARY VIP RESERVED-SEATING TICKETS TO "HOME: MONTRÉAL PREMIERE" + INVITATION TO BMJO REHEARSAL + HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! + SIGNED POSTER + Website thanks!


"BMJO - DIEHARD FAN!" - $7,500 - PRODUCER CREDIT, PERSONAL INVITATION TO 2ND RECORDING SESSION + HARD-BOUND COPIES OF ALL OF THE FULL-ENSEMBLE SCORES + PARTS TO EITHER "HOME: MONTRÉAL" OR "START" +  6 COMPLIMENTARY VIP RESERVED-SEATING TICKETS TO "HOME: MONTRÉAL PREMIERE" + INVITATION TO BMJO REHEARSAL + HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! +  SIGNED POSTER + Website thanks!



"BMJO - EXECUTIVE PRODUCER" - $10,000 - EXECUTIVE PRODUCER CREDIT ON CD. LIVE BMJO PRIVATE CONCERT, PERFORMING REPERTOIRE FROM START AND HOME: MONTRÉAL + HARD-BOUND COPIES OF ALL OF THE FULL-ENSEMBLE SCORES AND PARTS TO HOME: MONTRÉAL AND START (ALL SIGNED BY BETH) + PERSONAL INVITATION TO 2ND RECORDING SESSION + 8 COMPLIMENTARY VIP RESERVED-SEATING TICKETS TO "HOME: MONTRÉAL PREMIERE" + HEAR ALL MOVEMENTS for "Home: Montreal", 2 WEEKS BEFORE LIVE PREMIERE! +  SIGNED POSTER + Website thanks!
 




The Costs To Make "Home: Montréal" a Full 7 Track Recording: 



PROFESSIONAL MUSICIANS: $3600 dollars+ (Paying 18 BMJO musicians an honourarium for their time and efforts on the project)


STUDIO TIME: $1500 dollars+ (Rental: Studio Piccolo, Montreal - 1 day with full ensemble, trumpet soloist overdubs: Doxas Studios)

EDITING/MIXING/MASTERING: $600 dollars+

REHEARSAL STUDIO RENTAL: $400 dollars+ (Depending on rehearsal hours required to prepare music for recording)


CD PRODUCTION/PRINTING: $800 dollars+ (CD is included free for guests at the March 24th premiere, and to use for further promotion, festivals, venue performances, growth and development grants for this group--available free online after the 24th)


OTHER PRODUCTION & PROJECT PROMOTION FEES: $$$+++++


INDIEGOGO FEES: ~7-10%



STRETCH GOALS-----------------------

If we were to surpass our goal....---there's more that can be done with this project!
$500 above goal ---- Funding for professional quality video production of a concert video of "Home: Montréal" at L'Astral as promotional and development material for future BMJO concerts. (Legato Productions)

$1,000 above goal ---- BMJO premiere concert shot with 360 degree camera. (Legato Productions) - One of the first jazz concerts to be filmed in 360 degrees, fully immersive video experience online, available for free worldwide on YouTube.

$2,000 above goal ---- Booking additional "encore" concert later in 2016 in Montreal at Salle de Gésu or the Segal Centre for the Performing Arts, with additional new repertoire.


$3,500 above goal ---- BMJO performance booked in 5e Salle for early 2017 (Place des Arts), with additional new repertoire.


$6,000 above goal ---- BMJO performance in Toronto, Quebec City or Sherbrooke, with additional new repertoire.



$10,000 above goal ---- Record "Heading West" or "Ele(ctro)phant" as a single, in studio with string quartet. (See video)


$15,000+ above goal ---- Collaborate with professional videographers to re-create Home: Montréal as an evolved multidisciplinary project --- projected video, set to musical collaboration.

Photo for "Home: Montréal" - Photo - Tam Lan Truong



Taken at our "START" premiere at Sala Rossa  - Photo Credit - Eric Berteau - Camuz.ca



The Impact---------------- This project is one that is unlike anything else in the music industry today, but "Home: Montréal" was initially inspired from Darcy James Argue's Brooklyn Babylon in general broad concept of programmatic music inspired by visual subjects and re-telling stories through music. The idea behind our music is to engage our audiences, to fuse rock, pop, contemporary jazz, groove, world, and film music... with the big band! 
OUR GOAL: We're taking Jazz Orchestra and modern contemporary jazz back to the mainstream, performing music that is multiple-genres, reshaping jazz away from the classic tradition and building it as a popular genre! We want to make big band and jazz orchestras popular again, especially by sharing our music with listeners who typically follow mainstream artists. The band is an incredibly diverse cross-section of the Montréal jazz scene, featuring men and women, a split of anglophones/francophones and an all-Canadian roster of regular members of the band!
By contributing to this, BMJO's 2nd project, not only will you be supporting Montreal artists, but helping with a monumental and very unique MONTREAL-based and inspired musical work to reach audiences worldwide. Releasing the suite with only 4 tracks will leave it representing only "half" of the suite I originally wrote, inspired by 7 places in the city.

This project is one of the most innovative jazz projects that pushes towards the mainstream music community in Montreal, to date

Is unique to the incredible city of Montreal, but the music of the project is so diverse, multifaceted and accessible/multi-genres, that it will attract audiences beyond those who are jazz listeners. 

Continued success after BMJO's first recording, "START", with a complete evolution in the ensemble's sound, Beth's writing and musical style. Will help to affect change in the jazz community and expand on jazz as a style and genre.



Risks and Challenges----------------

Like any project, there are risks and challenges. 


  We have the networks, connections, presence and reputation on the Montreal and Canadian music scene to have this music distributed and to make a great impact!
If we fall short on funding, we will only be able to record an extra track or two to make it an incomplete recording of the suite to share, instead of all 7... means we would be doing a partial day in studio, etc. 



January 2015 interview with Richard Dagenais, Global Montreal Morning News



We have STRONG professional connections with major media and communications links for solid promotion of this project via social media, radio, TV, YouTube, BandCamp, online distribution, and internet radio. We have already started to develop a following for this ensemble. This suite is one that is intense, emotional, driving, epic, and adventurous, featuring some of Montreal's top artists in the jazz community, it will continue to receive airplay and a following. 




From START, BMJO was named in the Top 3 for "Montreal Jazz Artist of the Year 2015" - CAMUZ and Top 5 for "Best Jazz Act" - CultMtl. With Home: Montréal, we will only grow from here! Home: Montréal is a HUGE evolution from START, and we cannot wait to premiere this to the public!

Results - Montreal Jazz Artist of the Year 2015 - CAMUZ.ca 


Other Ways You Can Help Make This a Success!!! ---
Not able to contribute financially to help us get to our goal and record this as a full 7-track CD? There's still other ways in which you can help!  Share our video and this campaign on social media (Twitter, FB, Instagram, Pinterest, via e-mail, etc.)! We REALLY need the word out to get this finished!
Pass this along to media/bloggers/TV/Radio outlets (ESPECIALLY in Montreal and in the Canadian jazz scene!) to get the word out!
Plan to come to the March 24th premiere of Home: Montreal at L'Astral, and invite your friends to come with you! - TICKETS ARE AVAILABLE online and at L'Astral as of February 1st, 2016!


Thank you so much, we're grateful for the support in helping us reach our funding goal! We look forward to premiering "Home: Montreal" live, at L'Astral on March 24th, 2016!

story:
Our Deal--We Love Music!  We Love Helping!

No Convention is a band that's about more than just making music.  There's been a lot of talk throughout the years about how rock is dying or dead, the music industry is an impenetrable fortress unless you are uber connected, blah, blah, blah.  We disagree, and we're gonna prove it!

We've released a new album, titled "Welcome To Hollywood", and it's  the most raw, honest, balls-out rock 'n roll music this world has seen in awhile.  We're taking the album on the road this Summer, criss-crossing the US.  Along with putting a lot of smiles on peoples' faces and proving that rock is indeed alive and well, we're also gonna help out one of the most worthy causes on the planet: the fight against drug abuse in our society.

No Convention will donate 30% of our profits from this campaign, and the tour it will fund, to the Foundation For A Drug Free World (www.drugfreeworld.org).  The Foundation is a nonprofit public benefit corporation that empowers youth and adults with factual information about drugs so they can make informed decisions and live drug-free.  Additionally, their Truth About Drugs campaign consists of activities that anyone can join which popularize drug-free living. These activities are simple, effective and can involve people of all ages.  We will literally take all of our proceeds from the campaign and the tour (the total amount we raise and make from playing shows, merchandise sales, and anything else), subtract our campaign and tour expenses, take 30% of that number, and give it to The Foundation.  AAAAAND . . . we'll have a bunch of swag and info on their programs to pass out both at shows and while we're on the road between venues!

We'll be visiting approximately 25 cities over a 33 day period, playing venues of varying sizes, and spreading the word about our band and our pledge to help the Foundation For A Drug Free World wherever we go!

Making The Tour & What You Get For Helping

We need to raise $40,000 to break even on expenses.  Here's some of the stuff we'll be getting with all that crazy dough:


  • Tour Vehicle & Maintenance
  • Gas
  • Merch (t-shirts, CD's, and so on . . .)
  • 2 Man Road Crew 
  • Groceries
  • Promotional Costs - including fulfilling perks for the campaign and giving Indie Go Go their cut
  • A little guaranteed money for the band so we can keep our lights on when we get home :)
  • And more!

We've already got shows booked in San Diego, Sacramento, Memphis, Phoenix, Tucson,  Buffalo, and Washington D.C., and we're currently working on dates in the following localities:

Las Vegas, Austin, Dallas, New Orleans, New York City, Denver, Chicago, and more!!!

And then, there's the perks . . . 


How would you like No Convention to do a special acoustic show at your house or party?  Or maybe you have a business and would like your logo plastered on all of our promotional and merch items for the whole country to see?  Heck, maybe you're in a band and would love for Johnnie Ferro of No Convention produce and mix a track for you?  Well, the right donation can make any of these things possible!  Other killer rewards include:


  • PDF's of all of the music and lyrics from the "Welcome To Hollywood" album
  • A commemorative tour picture book with lyrical excerpts from the "Welcome To Hollywood" album and pics from the road
  • A DVD with over 90 minutes of footage documenting the tour
  • An electric guitar signed by the band
  • Dinner with the band before one of our shows
  • Signed merch
  • And so much more!!!


The Impact

Every member of No Convention has dedicated themselves to the success of this band, the revitalization of rock 'n roll, and the cause of helping as many people as we can with our music.  We're taking the opportunity to bring our nasty little rock album on the road while helping those in need re-gain life with the money we raise for the Foundation For A Drug Free World.  

To put this in to perspective, there are an estimated 208 million people consuming illegal drugs internationally.  Obviously, this is not a small problem, and that number doesn't even begin to touch the people illicitly using and abusing prescription medications.  If we can help even one person go the other way, or dig themselves out of the hole they've gotten themselves into with drugs, our efforts would be more than justified.  And we can easily touch hundreds, if not thousands and beyond, if we get the buzz for this tour and the Foundation For A Drug Free World happening fast and big!!!  

Contributing to a cause like The Foundation in and of itself is awesome and a huge help, even on an individual basis.  What's really great about this campaign and about your donating to The Foundation via this campaign, is that you'll be helping to build something that will take the word on the streets, grass roots style, and get masses of people behind the campaign across the country.  Instead of helping one person, or even 10 people, we're gonna make it so that your contribution helps hundreds, and maybe even thousands or millions!

Again, we completely believe in this cause and we're all totally on-board!  Who wants to help?

Risks & Challenges

As awesome as tours are (and they REALLY are!), they are also not necessarily the glamour job that a lot of people think of.  We're gonna be spending the majority of our time in cramped quarters driving across country.  That's 7 guys driving, sleeping, eating, hanging out, in a crowded space for the majority of a 33 day tour.  Not undoable, but a bit daunting to say the least.


There's also the challenge of raising these funds, as we do need the entirety of our goal to make this work.  


Aside from that, we're looking forward to our first cross-country tour and we're excited for the benefits it'll have both for our band and the many that we're gonna help through our donation to the Foundation For A Drug Free World! 


How can we be so confident?  Aside from our working out our budget to a tee and being fully dedicated to the tour and The Foundation, we've got some marketing tricks up our sleeve to get this campaign funded.  This includes creating partnerships with companies to sponsor our band (see Perks) as well as cross-promote the campaign, putting together a HUGE hash tag campaign to get tons of visibility on social media, getting in touch with local governments and police teams to help promote and set up events geared toward reaching the masses, and being super resourceful with our "road conditions" to make them totally workable.


Other Ways You Can Help

We totally understand that, while everyone wants to help, not everyone is able to throw some dough at our project.  THAT'S OK!


Here's a few things you can do to help that don't involve money:


  • Share the campaign ALL OVER social media (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc.)
  • Participate in the #MusicNotDrugs hashtag campaign for the tour by using thaty hashtag on Social Media
  • Send out email blasts to all of your friends and family
  • Leave a comment on the campaign page - it helps to boost our visibility on Indie GoGo!
  • Make a flyer and make it your profile pic on social media
  • Anything else you can think of to tell people about what we're doing and get them to the campaign page :)

We're super excited to do this, and after reading what this campaign is all about, we hope you're as excited as we are.  Thank you so much for your help, and for believing in us!

Much Love,

No Convention

story:
Listen some samples from the album!







"There are many tales to be told, but even more sounds to be heard."


Almost everyone must have once played or heard about typical fantasy/adventure games where protagonist has to slay a dragon, an evil god or something that ilk.

When these first typical RPG games were published they were great success. Never the less, soon after many other developers started to follow their example and create similar game. Since then the Role-Playing Games genre was born.

Tales of Sound and Music is following the same example of the first RPG games, but not as a game. It's a vast music album project created by Elias Luukkanen.

Contents

This is a high-quality royalty-free music pack which has over 15 different songs and themes played with orchestral instruments. But that is not the end of it, there are over 4-6 different versions/variations from each song played with different instruments which makes them as a separate unique songs.

By that all combined there are over 45 songs in this album, which is quite a lot!

                                  

Creator of the Project

Elias is young Finnish self-taught composer with great ambition to make composing as his full time job. Even though of his age he has already participated in many kind of projects as a composer. 

                                                            Check out his website:

 www.eluukkanen.com

Elias has created the music, but Roxana Hasanat has made the beautiful cover art for this album. Visit her website to see her wonderful art and games!

http://thelegendofauferre.com/

             Let the composer tell about himself

"My name is Elias Luukkanen. I'm 18-years old Finnish composer with huge passion for music creation. I started composing when I was only 9 years old. Even though I'm young I have been in successful projects in a role of a composer.

Nowadays I study in a Sibelius High-School in Helsinki, partly as a pianist and a composer and I often work with other musicians to bring live to my compositions.

When composing, I want to create music apart from the mainstream. As myself I think that music is a "language of feelings" which everyone can understand. Music has endless opportunities, never there will be a day when there's no difference between songs. There are always going to be something unique, fresh and new."


Information about the album

The plan is to sell this royalty-free album widely to all kinds of game developers, especially for indie developers. Royalty-free music is one of the greatest music markets in the world, as example the trailer music markets.

Royalty-free soundtrack sales are little bit smaller, but slightly developing area, because there is a great demand for music among the indie developers. Its lot easier and profitable to just buy royalty free songs without hiring an actual composer with high cost. If you analyze as example game projects here in Indiegogo you can easily notice how much money hiring a composer can really cost. 

So basically anyone who buyes this album can freely use the music and publish their game including the soundtrack without royalties of anykind.

Why this project is in Indiegogo?

Briefly explained

There are 3 main reasons...


Reason 1 (25% from the budget)

Marketing

If we want to have people’s attention for this album, there must be enough money for it. Marketing is not free from expenses and definitely not cheap. There are dozens of ways to market this product widely as example many various sites where we can sell this music album. 


Also the creating of our own website where this product will be sold is one of the top priorities. At the moment the website has already been developed. 

Please, take a look. 

www.eluukkanen.com

Reason 2 (20%)

Future Development

Elias Luukkanen:
"Well, there two different reasons why this is 20% from the main budget. First of all, I work alone, but I’m also studying and working along the composing. It is really stressful to only just study along the job. Not recommended to anyone.

But also high-quality composing equipment can be expensive. Do you have any idea how much it can be? Expenses can easily rise up to 5000$, because composing programs (DAW), and Virtual Instruments (VST) are really expensive. In other words, with your help, we're able to create unique. 20 % from the 3500$ could really help me to keep up the composing.

So if this project succeeds I strongly believe I'm going to use this section of budget to buying more equipment. But the point the least that I can do is to try to cover the previous costs.

Reason 3

Your Influence to this Project (20%) 

It would be fantastic to have real people to give their inspiration and influence to this very project. I have worked with different people in projects connected in music, and the most valuable thing in it is the collaboration itself. It has taught me many useful skills, gave me new thoughts and more experience.

Three ways to support this project:

1. Your feedback counts

By commenting your thoughts, criticism or supportive message on the comment section, you help me to improve as a composer. In many cases the feedback more valuable than money.

2. Share on Social Media

If you're interested about this project, share it on social media.

By spreading the word, you ensure the project's success! Your support matters.

Follow me in Facebook!

Follow me on Twitter!

Subscribe my channel in Youtube!

Follow me in Google+!

3. Contribute and Earn one of the perks!!!

There are many different ways to do that and as you will see there are multiple Perks for that purpose. Some of the names have been taken from typical RPG characters roles; some of them are quite reasonable.

List of Perks



1$ Special [1000] (1$)

There is a special reward which is called One Dollar Special. In real world you wouldn´t  do anything with having just a 1$, but in this project every penny is appreciated.

Reward(s):

1.  You will get a link, where you will be able to listen whole album for a one week.

2.  Your name will be put in the wall of honor as a donator (credited in the webpage)

3.  You will receive a Special "thank you" email

4.  You will have a change to vote your favorite song from the album, and if your favourite track wins, you'll get it in mp3 file.

These rewards are unique and one of a kind, you cannot have them in any other way but to donating just a one dollar. But it's recommended that you should also see other rewards as well before making any decisions.



Basic Perk (5$)

It's not bad to just donate only few dollars, because every single one of them will be definitely needed/used. This reward contains many different prices, take a look!

Reward(s):

1.  You'll receive a "thank you" email

2.  Your name will be put in the wall of honor as a donator (credited in the webpage)

3.  You will get 50% discount from the completed album.*

4. You will receive personal email message containing information of the phases of the project.

5. I will start following your social media accounts


First among equals (Early bird) 10$ [10]

Are you the first here, eh? 

So go for it, there is -15$ special discount from the album for 10 first contributors.

Reward(s):

1. First ten contributors will receive full digital copy of the album containing all 45 tracks.

2. You’ll also receive special Early Bird email message and your name will be put on the wall of honor as a




Non-playable character, NPC (15$)

Your life is easy as it can be, but at the same time it will be always the same every day and night, you're lucky if you can speak more than one speech in your pathetic life. That's the life of NPC, but it isn't as miserable as it seems because of these humble rewards.

Reward(s):

1.  80% price off from completed album*

2.  You’ll gain access to development blog.

3.  Your name will be put in the wall of honor as a level 2 donator (credited in the webpage)

4.  Get your own ToSaM (Tales of Sound and Music) - Wallpaper


* You will get a discount code on your email, and you can use it to get the discount. The price of the completed album is around 30$



Part of Something Everlasting 20$ [50]

Both, sounds and colors describe something unique in a way that words cannot. 

Reward(s):

1. With this reward you will have a physical poster (size 11x17) containing artwork from the album, grateful message and every poster will be signed by Elias Luukkanen

2. Your name will be put in the wall of honor as a level 2 donator (credited in the webpage)



A Person Who Donated - (includes ToSaM- album) (25$)

In gaming world it's easy to become chosen hero of glory. By donating just 25 $ you will experience something that no other easily got heroism can grant you:

Reward(s):

1.  You’ll get the digital download of the completed album!

2.  You will have a change to vote your favorite song from the album.

3.  Your name will be put in the wall of honor as a level 3 donator (credited in the webpage)



House of Valor - (includes ToSaM- album) (35$)

You have fought your way to the honor, you can donate this project to its fulfilment.

With your generous contribution, this world will be a better place to live. 

Reward(s):

  1. You’ll get the you'll get the physical CD!

  2. You will have a change to vote your favorite song from the album.

  1. Your name will be put in the wall of honor as a donator Level 4 (credited in the webpage)


Finders Keepers 50$ [1]

You have found a treasure chest containing not just potions, swords or magic crystals. There's something better... And only one can claim this price!

Reward(s):

1. You'll get two of my previous albums for free (digital download)

2. You'll recieve physical ToSaM playing cards

3. Your name will be put in the wall of honor as a donator Level 4 (credited in the webpage)


Fortuna´s Favour (100$) - (includes ToSaM- album) [5]

Life is risky, don't you think? So why would you not try your luck with this reward? The rules are simple; with every goal achieved there will be one added price to this reward. If you win, you'll save a bunch of money.

Reward(s):

1.  Digital download of the completed album - Physical CD when the + goal is achieved - Collectors Edition CD Box when the last goal is achieved

2.  One ToSaM wallpaper - Digital artwork book (pdf) when the + goal achieved - physical poster when the last goal is achieved

3.  When + goal is achieved, you'll get a black t-shirt containing ToSaM logo

4.  When + goal is achieved, you'll get unique ToSaM playing cards.

5.  Your name will be put in the wall of honor as a donator Level 5 (credited in the webpage), when + goal is achieved, your title will be “Fortunate Contributor”


Triumphant Moment (100$) - (includes ToSaM- album) [5]


Every honorable person should be praised for his deeds. If you support this project by purchasing this perk, your name will be remembered through the ages because of the wonderful fanfare which will be made just for you!

Reward(s):

1.  You will get an original 15 seconds victory fanfare made just for you!

2.  You’ll get the digital download of the completed album!

3.  Your name will be put in the wall of honor as a donator Level 6 (credited in the webpage)



ToSaM Collector’s Edition (150$) [45]

There are special perks for special people like you. What wouldn’t be better way to contribute for this project than getting a unique ToSaM Collector’s Edition – album on you shelf! It’s one of a kind and only 50 of them will be ever made.

Reward(s):

1.  You’ll get ToSaM Collector’s Edition (album) including physical 2 CD Box containing noted piano sheet, information letter with the story behind the album, CD 1 containing first 8 song (+ variations), CD 2 other 7 song (+ variations) + extra tracks! Each album will be signed by Elias Luukkanen.

2.  If last goal is achieved, you’ll also get ToSaM T-shirt and ToSaM playing cards.

3.  Your name will be put in the wall of honor as a donator Level 7 (credited in the webpage)


Knight of Generous Donations (250$) [6]

A knight with a wondrous tales, what an honor! Thus shall be your name singed through the lands. Your heroic deeds will not be forgotten.

1.  You’ll get 30 seconds long singed tale about you in medieval style! You (or the composer) will write a lyrics about your quest to find whatever you wish! There will be added some instruments such as mandolin, violin, flute and drums.

2.  You'll get the physical CD of the album!

3.  Your name will be put in the wall of honor as a donator Level 8 (credited in the webpage)



King of Sounds and Symphonies (500$) [1]

Long live the King! As a ruler of Sound and Symphonies there shall be made a worthy composition for your glory!

Reward(s):

1.  You’ll get an original 1 minute composition made just for you which is made in album’s style! Instrument combination: piano, violin, and flute. You also get a piano sheet from the composition!

2.  You’ll get ToSaM Collector’s Edition (album) including physical 2 CD Box containing noted piano sheet, information letter with the story behind the album, CD 1 containing first 8 song (+ variations), CD 2 other 7 song (+ variations) + extra tracks! Each album will be signed by Elias Luukkanen.

3.  Your name will be put in the wall of honor as a donator Level 9 (credited in the webpage)


Hero of Clíche Franchises [10] (800$)

So you have chosen to be an ordinary bold RPG hero? It will cost you but it's worth of it, 'cause you are gonna save the world! (And this project as well)

Reward(s):

1. All other perks (-limited)

2. You are able to order your own original song from the composer.

Name, genre and instrument combination is up to you to decide. Work with the composer by discussing about them by using email or Skype. You have a change to have your very own song in any music style needed. It's a rare opportunity which gives you a change to be part of a unique process. Have you ever worked with composer? All of authority is in your hands!

You can choose from these instrument combinations and plans.*

1.  Regular: Solo Piano, Violin, Guitar, Cello or Flute (choose one) - Up to 5 Minutes -

2.  Beat: Electronic Instruments - Up to 3 Minutes -

3.  Vocal: Solo/Choir - Up to 3 Minutes**

4.  Group: Band Instruments (+ singer (optional)) - Up to 3 Minutes**

5.  Composers Freedom (Decide the Mood)- Up to 6 Minutes

*songs estimated length depends from the plan. As you have chosen one composing plan and combination you are not able to change it in middle of process. Choose it wisely.

** You're able to write your own lyrics or composer can write them, it's up to you.

3. Your name will be put in the wall of honor as a donator Level 10 (credited in the webpage)


All is Yours! (4000$) [1]

That’s literally what the title says. You will have one amount of each perks just by donating this sum. All limited rewards included. So you have decided to donate more than the minimum goal? You alone made this project successful, so we are offering one another special reward to you.

1.  One amount of each perks, including limited ones!!!!!!!!!!!

2.  Your name will be put to albums cover, in every ToSaM album whether it is digital or physical!!!




First the Risks, then the Challenges:

As in every project, there are risks and challenges. It would be lying to say that there's no risk at all. Of course the worst scenario you could imagine is that seas could dry, an atomic bomb could explode or the worst - Indiegogo would have a bankrupt. Only after then the future of this project would be unsure because of these circumstances.

But in truth I'm putting all my effort for this project. It will be finished properly in time because there is only few songs still to be composed. In other words, album is almost completed.

The main challenge is to get prizes of the album done in time, + all other extra song rewards.

Shipping of physical perks is new to me, but I working on it. But the finishing of the album will not be an overwhelming challenge.

After all, challenges are made to make life interesting.


Wow, you really did read the whole campaign information! Thank you very much!

Elias Luukkanen


Special thanks for animations to the intro video!

VSXu website

3. Your name will be put in the wall of honor as a
donator Level 10 (credited in the webpage)



All is Yours! (4000$) [1]
That’s literally what the title says. You will have one
amount of each perks just by donating this sum. All limited rewards included.
So you have decided to donate more than the minimum goal? You alone made this
project successful, so we are offering one another special reward to you.
1. 
One amount of each perks, including limited ones!!!!!!!!!!!
2. 
Your name will be put to albums cover, in every
ToSaM album whether it is digital or physical!!!








First the Risks, then the Challenges:
As in every project, there are risks and challenges. It would
be lying to say that there's no risk at all. Of course the worst scenario you
could imagine is that seas could dry, an atomic bomb could explode or the worst
- Indiegogo would have a bankrupt. Only after then the future of this project
would be unsure because of these circumstances. 
But in truth I'm putting all my effort for this project. It
will be finished properly in time because there is only few songs still to be
composed. In other words, album is almost completed. 
The main challenge is to get prizes of the album done in time,
+ all other extra song rewards.
Shipping of physical perks is new to me, but I working on it. But the finishing of the album will not be an
overwhelming challenge.
After all, challenges are
made to make life interesting.

  Wow, you really did read the whole campaign information! Thank you very much!



Elias Luukkanen



Special thanks for animations to the intro video!VSXu website

story:
all items will be shipped once the campaign ends!!!!! (tapes and everything)


a collection of dreams and experiences that were meant to make you feel and move...

Hello, My name is Justin from the dream pop project: High Sunn. So this is my new 12 track full length LP titled: Natural Instinct.  The album reflects on my personal experiences with terrible relationships, isolation, heartbreak, a small glimpse of love, and complete confusion as a teenager trying to survive in high school. The full length was recorded in the bedrooms of Justin Cheromiah and Tristin Sovannarath. This release is the most thought out and best one yet in my opinion. It took us hours upon hours to create this pile of romantic cries. 


cassettes being released by:

-grabbing clouds records: https://www.facebook.com/grabbingclouds -CHUD records: http://chudrecords.com/

THE ALBUM WILL BE RELEASED sometime in MAY!

Since I am just a high school student with no job, I cannot do the vinyl release alone sadly. I hate asking people for help, but I would greatly appreciate any assistance in making the vinyl release possible. 

DETAILS:
-100-200 run of vinyl

-yellow colored

-album is finished and being released in may!

-vinyl production(end of summer/august)

-once the project is funded, i will order the pressings ASAP

-no matter what...these will be produced, even if I have to go broke.

-the video above is a single from the new album

MUCH LOVE and PEACE,

Justin Cheromiah

story:
I am Grenadian singer and guitarist Christel La Guerre. For many years the opportunity to produce music I can call my own was just a dream, until I met Richard Pitt. Together with Selwyn Pitt and Eddie Bullen we created a masterpiece. Now that the album is finally out we need your help in pushing the project worldwide. 

We need $7000 to partner with a Public Relations firm that will distribute and provide promotion for the album.

Once the funding is complete, they will create a social buzz, official website and connect me with the people who want to hear my music.

If you don't know Grenada is a very small island in the Caribbean sea, and the support I've received thus far is exceptional from my loyal supports. My goal is to have my music known worldwide hence partnering with this PR firm is vital in ensuring the future of the album is very successful.

Show your support by contributing and share this with all your family and friends. Follow my journey on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Snapchat and Periscope @christel473.

story:
Are you a piano lover who also love traveling but bothered with huge cost of transporting your instrument?

Does the thought that piano is able to carry around anywhere just like guitar ever come cross your mind?

Our project now make it possible to travel with your piano easier and lighter!   

This is how the story begins... 

The idea came up to my mind last year when I was heading to Australia, I started to play piano since i was three, I love music and wish I can have my piano with me all the time, just like those who travel around with their guitars. 

 Unfortunately, all portable pianos in the market fail to fulfill my needs. So, I try to think about how a piano can travel with me as convenient as other instruments. After few months, a solution with magnetic keyboards Tifen key came to the world. We can now enjoy and create music everywhere!  

 

How does our Tifen key possibly work?

Our prototype playing with a popular free music software in midi signal

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nxjAcuD4Z9I

At this moment, Design momentum in Australia had produced the first prototype and it looks good and works fantastic. It's definitely a good and news to all the keyboard players, piano players and synthesizer players.

Below please find detailed specifications of “Tifen key” ::

 All keys are standard piano keys and the main-body has 12 keys (one octave),

 music played by the keys can be transmitted to any music software in tablets / computers via usb, bluetooth or midi.

 

  In addition, there are two types of modular attachable to the main body with magnets. 5 keys（c,c＃.d,d＃

 and 7 keys（f,f＃.g,g＃.a,a＃.b）

As the piano is detachable, you can store it in your bags or suitcases. It is also extremely light so it is a real portable piano in the market so far!

However, as you may noticed, Team "Tifen key" isn't a branch or sub of any big enterprise, we just a group of people whom has a great ambious about our product just maybe like you guys do?

AND WHY WE ARE HERE?

In 1709, the very first piano was invented by a harpsichord maker named Bartolomeo di Francesco Cristofori in a small town in Italy, it looks absolutely heavy and huge.

Piano wasn’t seems so different till 1929 when the Neo-Bechstein electric piano was built. Piano has became a member of technology.

We are living in perhaps the most exciting time in history to buy, own or play that eternal instrument, the piano. 

And now, we are here to start a new page of the evolution of Piano.

Dream will never come ture if te first step has never been taken, 

We are so close, but just one and the most important step to be needed which is your support as the manufacturer has the minimum amount requirement at 100 sets of the piano modulars. 

If we have 100 or more than 100 backers the price will be reduced which will make Tifen key more popular and affordable, and you will definetly received a small refund, which also means more backers less costs! 

That is why we are here and need your support!

In the near future, we are going to produce a portable durable piano case stand (it s a case with unique design which can be transformed to a piano stand for“∞”

 

Product design sketch: together with 2x5keys modular and 2x7keys modular

 Apart with with 2x5keys modular and 2x7keys modular

Now , you might have quection

Could it be simplified, so that extension units are octaves only? Are the keys velocity sensitive?

The prototype is just a first look of the portable piano, it is still under development to fine-tune it to be the best and most convenience one for the users, such as bottom, key touching, etc.  

There is possibility for the extension keys to be in an octave. Again, it depends on how it convenience the users and we will also seek all the contributors' advise soon. So far, the prototype works awesome with no delay, and the key response is good.  

 

We are not company,  we just music lover and willing to have a piano convince us.  But the minimum production is 20up. So we are here to ask for support to fulfill the ome. If you love our product,  please support us.  You will recive the greatest because this is what i need too

Although we have begining concept of how it works.  But you guys are welcome to leave me that could improve this piano.  I am piano player. A music lover.  I am not making this for any commercial.  I want it to be useful for every performers , players.  You guys are apart of this project.  Your suggection is valuable

story:
My New Upcoming Project - 'REST "IN" PEACE'

Hi, and thanks for being here. If we haven't met, my name is Isaac (Graham) Nichol. My passion is music, for the past 4 years to be precise. I've drifted through a bunch of genres and scenes of music, but I've set ashore as a solo musician and producer. I do everything myself, I mean EVERYTHING. 

My next album is titled 'REST "IN" PEACE' and to summarise quickly, it's an expression of what death would've looked like to me. I wasn't 'in' peace at all, and to be honest I haven't been for the past few years. But I am moving forward. This is my journey, my road to getting better. :)

Your contributions will help me fund a PR Campaign with a very successful company. It'll also help me live my dream as a musician/artist and feel what it's like being able to invest money into my art. You'll also help me work my ass off to finish not only this album but the next one. ;)

What I Need & What You Get

** - Subject to Change

  • I NEED $7000 for my next album's release. This sum will cover EVERYTHING to help release my album and lock in a PR Campaign with Footstomp Music, (including the previously released single of mine 'Mum, i'm Sorry'.) So yeah, technically the campaign with them has already started. No turning back now! ;)
  • AMAZINGLY IndieGoGo, offered me a discounted campaign rate. So $7000 will cover the IndieGogo fees!! Woo! 
  • Footstomp will be promoting and putting my music in front of the best eyes and ears in Australia. I have another way that I'm going to fund the t-shirts and Merch items, so stay tuned for that.
  • Perks are simple. Every contributor gets a full digital copy of the album **1 week** before the official release.
    The higher the contribution value the more you get. 
    Merch Items will be announced soon! And Live Shows!
  • If the full funds are not raised, I will save the money until I can afford to purchase and go through with it.

The Impact

  • My album is about my depression, anxiety and some cases suicide. I think the world needs to know what is happening inside young males heads. I've lost one friend now, and it was tragic. I've come close and I'm holding on, holding on for the others out there who need our support and awareness.
  • I raised $1500 last year thank you to all you amazing human beings!! <3
    Let's tip the scales with this one!
  • I am literally working every day, promoting, designing, producing, releasing, emailing. This is a FULL-TIME WORK for me. But I am not in any way able to sustain this. So I do need YOUR help.

Thank you for supporting me.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • My mental health, it still and always has been a constant battle for me but I am trying and I am already receiving professional help.
  • I hope you can continue to support me through that.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you can't support me financially, that's fine, a follow on my Instagram or a like on Facebook would mean just as much. 
  • If this means something to you, help me! In other ways, tell a friend or buy them a copy of my album. I am so thank you for any support I receive. Thank you.
  • Remember to use the sharing tools.

story:
Hi!  I began recording "Phoenix Rising" in May of 2015.  I received half of my goal in a former GoFundMe campaign which helped me complete the first half of the album.  Thankyou to all those who supported the first leg of this project.  I have seven original songs recorded so far many of which you will hear clips of in the video here.  I have three more songs to go along with creating the artwork, lay-out and manufacturing of the c.d.

For those that do not know me, I teach Yoga, Qigong and T'ai Chi in Western Massachusetts   I love  animals and have a pet sitting business.  I have been on a long and quite frankly arduous and hopefully triumphant personal healing journey.  What concerns me most above any thing beyond my own personal loss is what is happening to  animals and life on our planet.  Somehow, humanity's shadow is far  too big and transformation and a choice to heal what is creating this destruction is necessary.  It is my deepest hope that The Phoenix Rising happens in the larger world in the direction of taking more action to heal our beautiful planet and home.  I hope my songs reflect that hope...and as painful as it is, it starts with me.  And you.  And each of us to make choices that reflect our souls imminent light and calling.  If empathy and compassion win, we win.

I am reaching out to ask for your support for "Phoenix Rising".  Your contributions will finance the final stretch of this album which I hope to complete by the Fall of 2017.  It will happen, for me, it is taking it's time to become what it's meant to become.

Thankyou for your consideration.

With gratitude,

Lynne Nicole Smith

story:
We are dying to get our music out to you!

We have songs we want to launch into the universe. We need some money to pay for mastering,  duplication, and marketing. You can get in on the ground floor!!

What We Need & What You Get

We need $999 to pay for mastering and duplication. If you can help out you will get first dibs on the new album, either digitally, or physical cd or both. We also will have some cool tshirts and a mystery dvd.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't send us $ right now there are other things you can do:

  • Spread the word about our campaign so we can reach as many people as possible
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
RON BRUNER SR. (AKA) STRANGE JAZZ UNIVERSE

I’m a career musician married to Pamela Bruner, my wife of 39 years as of this time. With three sons Ronald Bruner Jr., Stephen Bruner and Jameel Bruner. Please use the link below to read the billboard magazine interview regarding my family. 

https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/6875266/three-grammy-nominated-sons-ronald-bruner-thundercat-the-internet

Born in 1956 and raised in the city of Compton California during a very interesting time. I attended Los Angeles Union SDA school, Ralph J. Bunche Jr. High and graduated from Centennial Sr. High in 1974. I then went on to Cal State University Northridge and attended three years. I was set on becoming a better musician but not so much on getting degreed. During my second year I studied with an off campus drumset teacher by the name of Billy Moore who brought my playing up to the professional standards of the day. Which opened the door into the professional playing world for me. During my second year at Northridge I had the opportunity to sub three weeks for the Temptations’ touring drummer. And at the end of my third year of school I received a call from the Temptations Music Director who informed me that the drummer retired and that the job was mine if I wanted it. I haven't looked back since.

I've worked with and or recorded with such artists as The Temptations, The Supremes, Gary Bartz, Diana Ross, Gladys Knight, Jody Watley, Randy Crawford, Johnny Gil, The Mighty Clouds Of Joy, Howard Hewett, Elektra Asylum Artist "Chameleon", Broadway Musical  "Ain't Misbehavin" at The Amandson Theater, Helen Baylor, A year long stint with the Israeli band "From The Other Side", J* Davey, John Beasley, Brandon Coleman, Kamasi Washington, Thundercat, Stanley Clarke, The L. A. Ballet Co. and others. As the commercial says, "I've seen a few things".

Strange Jazz Universe is a Jam Jazz Funk Electro Band which I began in 1996 as Miles Davis Electric Tribute Band for about 6 years. After which around 2005 I migrated into doing my own material. 

I’ve produced 5 projects as Strange Jazz Universe. The latter 3 on this list are distributed by       The L A Sound Independent Label and can be streamed on Spotify, iTunes, Google Music and such like for your review.

  1. Live In Leimert Park
  2. Mission Two, Too Possible
  3. New Space Age Materials
  4. Miles In The Sky Forever
  5. Two Moons

Two Moons caused me to win the relix magazine JamOFF! Competition for the Oct / Nov 2017 issue.

Strange Jazz Universe is working on the next recording project and I can promise you...... well....It's going to be way dope. I've been fortunate this past year to work with some awesome L A musicians and they are in. To help get this done properly I've begun an Indiegogo fundraising campaign with a goal of $15,000 as the target. Studio time for recording, mixing and mastering, the musicians, artwork, Vinyl & CD pressing and packaging, Perks and swag for the fans who are able to contribute to the campaign, a digital promotion company, a publicist. Inclusively all the peripherals surrounding the creation and promotion of a recording project. 

Project Number 6 is underway.

I haven't looked back since.I've worked with and or recorded with such artists as The Temptations, The Supremes, Gary Bartz, Diana Ross, Gladys Knight, Jody Watley, Randy Crawford, Johnny Gil, The Mighty Clouds Of Joy, Howard Hewett, Elektra Asylum Artist "Chameleon", Broadway Musical  "Ain't Misbehavin" at The Amandson Theater, Helen Baylor, A year long stint with the Israeli band "From The Other Side", J* Davey, John Beasley, Brandon Coleman, Kamasi Washington, Thundercat, Stanley Clarke, The L. A. Ballet Co. and others. As the commercial says, "I've seen a few things".Strange Jazz Universe is a Jam Jazz Funk Electro Band which I began in 1996 as Miles Davis Electric Tribute Band for about 6 years. After which around 2005 I migrated into doing my own material. I’ve produced 5 projects as Strange Jazz Universe. The latter 3 on this list are distributed by       The L A Sound Independent Label and can be streamed on Spotify, iTunes, Google Music and such like for your review.
Live In Leimert Park
Mission Two, Too Possible
New Space Age Materials
Miles In The Sky Forever
Two Moons
Two Moons caused me to win the relix magazine JamOFF! Competition for the Oct / Nov 2017 issue.Strange Jazz Universe is working on the next recording project and I can promise you...... well....It's going to be way dope. I've been fortunate this past year to work with some awesome L A musicians and they are in. To help get this done properly I've begun an Indiegogo fundraising campaign with a goal of $15,000 as the target. Studio time for recording, mixing and mastering, the musicians, artwork, Vinyl & CD pressing and packaging, Perks and swag for the fans who are able to contribute to the campaign, a digital promotion company, a publicist. Inclusively all the peripherals surrounding the creation and promotion of a recording project. Project Number 6 is underway.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
A THOUSAND TINY TORCHES...

is a 7-song EP collection of some of the songs I've written in the past year. My last album was released over 10 years ago. A THOUSAND TINY TORCHES is the album I didn't realize I've been making ever since, and with the help of an amazing community, in early 2019 we...

... ran a successful Kickstarter campaign! 

 

The Kickstarter lasted 30 days.

Welcome to Indiegogo's InDEMAND, a post-Campaign / pre-order page for those of you who didn't get to the Kickstarter, but still want to pre-order the album, pick up some other special items, and be part of the Tiny Torches album-making process. Community is everything, and every little bit helps!

All the funds raised here go toward the making and promotion of A THOUSAND TINY TORCHES.

A THOUSAND TINY TORCHES expected release date: Early 2020. 

 

Some backstory:

After a looooooong hiatus from my singer/songwriter career (during which I recorded 3 albums and toured throughout the Northeast and across the U.S.) I wrote a new collection of songs. 

These songs come from growing up and growing older. They come from listening to others and examining myself. They come from loss, grief, joy, love. They come from a deep appreciation of the folk, Americana, country, and singer-songwriter artists who have buoyed my spirit throughout my life.

This collection of songs started with a question:

"If you were the woman that you wanted to be...," how would you spend your life?

It's related to the question Mary Oliver poses in her poem, A Summer Day: "Tell me, what is it you plan to do with your one wild and precious life."

This album is my answer.

 

 

So what does it take to make a record? 

Whereas years ago making a record was a magical effort behind secret doors -- nearly impenetrable to independent artists like me, and completely closed off to you -- times have changed. YOU AND I ARE THE RECORD LABEL. 

With studio, tracking, musicians, mixing, mastering, and manufacturing, the cost of recording a single song is about $3267. Of course, there's also promotion. 

I began pre-production in May 2019, with producer Shane Alexander at Buddhaland Studios in Thousand Oaks, CA. The main tracking and mixing will be done in August by Brian Yaskulka (Lisa Loeb, The Rescues) at his Secret World Studios in the historic Sound City complex in Van Nuys, CA. Denny Weston, Jr. (KT Tunstall, Santana) will play drums. Darby Orr (Naked to the World, Gary Myrick) will play bass. Carl Byron (CALICO the band, Young Dubliners) will play organ/keys.

Add your light to A THOUSAND TINY TORCHES and you'll be one of the first to hear updates as we go.

****************************************************************************

"Lovely songwriting and arrangements." - The Boston Globe

"Silver's tough-yet-tender vocals move through the space where Lou Reed meets Chrissie Hynde, ensuring that Something Pretty Something True lives up to its name and then some." - Performing Songwriter Magazine

"Silver first seduces with a rich, highly emotional voice. Though her arty lyrical flair reflects Ani DiFranco, Joni Mitchell, and even Jane's Addiction, it's a very personal modern rock approach." - Boston Herald

"Beautifully throaty, melodic voice belting meticulous poems...a truly talented songwriter." - The Spectator (Raleigh, NC) 

"Listening to [On The Dashboard Of A Shaky Car] is like stumbling upon the perfect small town on a cross-country, broken-hearted road trip. You love the place so much and it's so familiar to you, yet you also find a whole new way of understanding your life and loves there. All of the emotional baggage you took with you is unpacked by chanteuse Arielle Silver's voice - low-riding, naked, and sure - coupled with wise, nimble lyrics and beautiful instrumentation." - Cynthia Gralla, author of The Floating World (Ballantine)

***************************************************************************

 

Thank you for supporting A THOUSAND TINY TORCHES by backing this campaign or sharing it with others in your communities. Your support means the world to me. From my deepest heart, thank you.

In song and gratitude,

Arielle

story:
Our Bio

               Manhattan Project is a Pragmatic / Avant-Garde band from Patras, Greece. The band’s music revolves around instrumental compositions in which guitar and keyboards shredding prevail. The band has a high-end modern approach to the progressive gender, with influences of djent / cinematic / symphonic music, inspired by both guitar-driven-experimental and technical symphonic metal bands. Influences of traditional – ethnic elements like the use of sitar and oud are very frequent and relegate to a variety of other musical styles. The mixture of the high qualities of all the above genres, as seen by the Manhattan Project band, gives birth to the pragmatic approach to our music : the tendency to experiment with no limits and judge the result regardless of music theories or “mistakes” of rules that might characterize the individual elements.
                The band’s line-up is consisted of George Constantine Kratsas ( EMG artist) on guitars, Leonidas Diamadopoulos on keyboards, Antonis Karpanos on the bass, Nikitas Mandolas on the drums and Tasos Seremetis on the oud.
                Currently, Manhattan Project is on the verge of releasing their debut full-length album, expected in mid-October 2016. An indiegogo campaign was just launched, aiming at the economic support by MP’s fans for the album’s expenses: funding the artwork commission, the production of the album’s physical copies, the upcoming promo-clip.
                Manhattan Project’s aim is to do a lot of live performances in Greece as well as abroad, and co-operate with a reliable record company.

Discography & clips :

July 2015:             Promo-clip of the self-titled song “The Manhattan Project”,
                                 taken from the band’s upcoming full-length album.
                                 Youtube link :https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y0wqXLuBgrg

January 2015:     Promo-clip of the song “The God Complex”, taken from the band’s
                                upcoming full-length album.
                                Youtube link : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2-Pow6QY3LI

March 2014:      Release of “Abducted Cosmos”, George Constantine Kratsas’
                               personal album,composed by George and performed by
                               Manhattan Project.Bandcamp link:                                                                                                                               https://georgeconstantinekratsas.bandcamp.com/releases

October 2013:   Promo-clip of the song “Samsara”, performed in-studio by
                               Manhattan Project. Youtube link:
                               https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QWGfB0yct04

July 2013:           Release of “Into the Abyss of Time”, Leonidas Diamandopoulos’
                               personal album

Distinctions, Awards and Sponsorships :

2016:                     Official EMG Artist – George Constantine Kratsas
                                Engl Amps Sponsorship – George Constantine Kratsas
                                Two Notes Audio Engineering Sponsorship – George Constantine Kratsa

2014:                     Best Keyboardist of the Lives Award, prize : 1000euro Yamaha keyboard –                                           Leonidas Diamandopoulos
                                Participation in Schoolwave Festival – Manhattan Project

2012:                     Volos Elite Guitar competition – 1st prize – George Constantine Kratsas

story:
Hello everybody.

We are Betrayed By the Way a metal band from lima, Peru. We are currently working on our first studio album entitled "Until Last Breath".

We have more than one year developing this project, which we think has a lot to offer.

What do we need to achieve our goal?

For the moment, we are recording and mixing the material.

We need the total of 3500 dollars to take the next step and you can be the one help us reach the target.The money raised will be distributed the following way:

  • Photo Session 
  • Album Art  
  • Web Promotion 
  • Printed T-Shirts 
  • Merch Print 
  • Registering Songs and legal expenses 
  • Printed CD
  • Video

You can either help us by donating or getting some of our perks that we have made for you from 5 bucks to 115 bucks, you can find our perks descriptions on your right on the screen.

Other Ways You Can Help usIf you don't have funds to contribute but would still like to help, please tell all of your friends or share this. You can use the tools for share of Indiegogo too. which are on your left on the screen.

The way is hard but we know that with your help we can do it. We want to thank you all for taking the time to see our video and a big THANK YOU! to every single person that will be contributing to our effort. This is just the start to something really awesome.

CD Cover:


T-shirt Art:

Reff Men

Reff Girl


Our Single Debut:

story:
A serenade to the broken hearted, possibly a little lost and confused. The stories told in Phoenix Asteroid echo the parts of your heart you'd like to soon forget, but those that have made you that much stronger. They're the songs that you'd wish you'd have heard before getting lost on the road of life.

Led by writer, singer and musician Daniel Gordon, Phoenix Asteroid's debut EP is almost in the can!
By purchasing an item you will be a part of finishing this album. Your purchase will directly go towards mixing and mastering costs and you'll walk away with some exclusive perks.

story:
"The sky is not the limit, it's the platform!" - Karma

As a recording school graduate, former educator and current full-time singer/songwriter, producer and engineer I am a woman who believes she can do it all but thanks to platforms like this, I know that there is help on the horizon. This next project "Find Your Karma" is my passion, my baby and my everything and I am hoping to send it off into the world to be as successful as possible. But I need your help #TeamKarma

What We Need & What You Get

With the goal set at $5000 in 30 days, I am looking to fully fund the production, recording, mixing, mastering, packaging and distribution of this new album. Anyone who follows my career knows I always take my time and want every piece of work I release to be the best it can be. I am doing this project FULLY independent under my own company "Good Karma Entertainment." The funds will also go towards marketing, promotion, etc. 

The Impact

Once funded and released all the profits from my first all original album will go towards fueling the "Find Your Karma" movement which will include a tour, workshops, partnerships with schools, etc. As a former educator who misses the rewards of working in a classroom environment, I want to do more than just sell music. 

The plan is to bring hope and inspiration to those watching that a dream is always possible if you work hard and stay true to yourself and craft.  In an industry that doesn't always highlight women of substance, purity and virtue, I want to place the fate of my next project into the hands of the people who truly matter, the fans and supporters aka #TeamKarma. This will also inspire many woman, men and young children alike that is possible to maintain a sense of integrity and be successful in today's industry.

Also a portion of the funds raised will go towards the Black Lives Matters movement and those affected by the Orlando shooting. I know there are several ways to give back and I continue to do my part in contributing to things that are bigger than me. 

In addition to the project and giving back, I will also be using proceeds from this campaign to sponsor another young artist under newly founded nonprofit "Find Your Karma." This sponsorship will include artist development, vocal coaching, image consulting, mentorship as well recording, mixing and mastering a demo project. I hope to give another artist the help, guidance and support I didn't have when I started! #GoodKarma

Risks & Challenges

I am one of those people who is always looking to help and never FOR help. But I feel so passionately about my project and campaign, I know that with the right help I can get it to the masses to build an even bigger platform and opportunity to be a role model and leader for the youth and women of today's generation.

There is always a chance that a goal set will not become a goal reached. If not enough people come together to support me on this journey, my album might not be possible. But I plan to put my all into pushing this campaign because I believe the work that I do, the message that I continue to spread and the consistency of my efforts both as a musician and educator will speak for itself. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Lets use the "Karma Method" which is Pay It Forward. For everyone who contributes and even for those who can't PLEASE go out and tell as many people as you can and so forth and so on. Utilize the IndieGoGo sharing tools to spread the word. This is not a charity, or just a campaign this a movement. So lets move!

.
